original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra pratibhātu te'yaṃ dharmālokamukhaprabhedakauśalyadharmaparyāyo buddhānubhāvena tathāgatajñānālokādhiṣṭhānena svakuśalamūlapariśodhanāya dharmadhātusuparyavadāpanāya sattvadhātvanugrahāya dharmakāyajñānaśārīrāya sarvabuddhābhiṣekasaṃpratīcchanāya sarvalokābhyudgatātmabhāvasaṃdarśanāya sarvalokagatisamatikramāya lokottadharmagatipariśodhanāya sarvajñajñānaparipūraṇāya //
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra pratibhātu tā iyam dharma āloka mukha prabheda kauśalya dharma paryāyaḥ buddha anubhāvena tathāgata jñāna āloka adhiṣṭhānena sva kuśala mūla pariśodhanāya dharmadhātu su paryavadāpanāya sattvadhātu anugrahāya dharmakāya jñāna śārīrāya sarva buddha abhiṣeka saṃpratīcchanāya sarva loka abhyudgata ātma bhāva saṃdarśanāya sarva loka gati samatikramāya lokottadharma gati pariśodhanāya sarvajña jñāna paripūraṇāya
translated: Moreover, noble sir, through the power of the Buddha, through the illumination of the Tathāgata’s knowledge, through the purification of your own roots of virtue, through the thorough understanding of the element of space, through the favor to the realm of beings, through the knowledge-body of the Dharma, through the consecration of all the Buddhas, through the display of a body that rises above all the world, through the transcendence of all worldly destinies, through the purification of the destiny of the Dharma that is beyond this world, and through the fulfillment of omniscient knowledge, may this Dharma discourse on the skill in the analysis of the gateway to the light of the Dharma occur to you, in order to purify the element of phenomena, in order to favor the realm of beings, in order to have a body that is the knowledge of the Dharma, in order to receive the consecration of all the Buddhas, in order to display a body that rises above all the world, in order to transcend all worldly destinies, in order to purify the destiny of the Dharma that is beyond this world, and in order to fulfill omniscient knowledge.”

original: atha khalu te buddhā bhagavanto vajragarbhasya bodhisattvasya anabhibhūtātmabhāvatāṃ copasaṃharanti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vajragarbhasya bodhisattvasya an abhibhūta ātmabhāva tām ca upasaṃharanti sma
translated: Then those Buddha Bhagavans bestowed upon the bodhisattva Vajra-garbha the state of being invincible.

original: asaṅgapratibhānanirdeśatāṃ ca suviśobhitajñānavibhaktipraveśatāṃ ca smṛtyasaṃprabhoṣādhiṣṭhānatāṃ ca suviniścitamatikauśalyatāṃ ca sarvatrānugatabuddhyanutsargatāṃ ca samyaksaṃbuddhabalānavamṛdyatāṃ ca tathāgatavaiśāradyānavalīnatāṃ ca sarvajñajñānapratisaṃvidvibhāgadharmanayanistīraṇatāṃ ca sarvatathāgatasuvibhaktakāyavākcittālaṃkārābhinirhāratāṃ copasaṃharanti sma /
analyzed: asaṅga pratibhāna nirdeśa tām ca su viśobhita jñāna vibhakti praveśa tām ca smṛti asaṃprabhoṣa adhiṣṭhāna tām ca su viniścita mati kauśalya tām ca sarvatra anugata buddhi an utsarga tām ca samyaksaṃbuddha bala an avamṛdya tām ca tathāgata vaiśāradya an avalīna tām ca sarvajña jñāna pratisaṃvid vibhāga dharma naya nistīraṇa tām ca sarva tathāgata su vibhakta kāya vāc citta alaṃkāra abhinirhāra tām ca upasaṃharanti sma
translated: the teaching of unobstructed eloquence, the entry into the manifestation of well-purified knowledge, the foundation of unforgetting memory, the skill of well-ascertained wisdom, the non-abandonment of the all-pervading mind, the indestructibility of the power of the Perfectly Enlightened One, the undauntedness of the fearlessness of the Tathāgata, the discernment of the Dharma of the knowledge, understanding, and analysis of omniscience, and the accomplishment of the well-differentiated adornment of body, speech, and mind of all Tathāgatas.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yathāpi nāma asyaiva samādherdharmatāpratilambhena pūrvaṃ praṇidhānābhirhāreṇa ca supariśodhitādhyāśayatayā ca svavadātajñānamaṇḍalatayā ca susaṃbhṛtasaṃbhāratayā ca sukṛtaparikarmatayā ca apramāṇasmṛtibhājanatayā ca prabhāsvarādhimuktiviśodhanatayā ca supratividvadhāraṇīmukhāsaṃbhedanatayā ca dharmadhātujñānamudrāsumudritatayā ca //🔽atha khalu te buddhā bhagavantastatrasthā eva ṛddhyanubhāvena dakṣiṇān pāṇīn prasārya vajragarbhasya bodhisattvasya śīrṣaṃ saṃpramārjayanti sma /
analyzed: yathā api nāma asya eva samādheḥ dharmatā pratilambhena pūrvam praṇidhāna abhirhāreṇa ca su pariśodhita adhyāśaya tayā ca su avadāta jñāna maṇḍala tayā ca su saṃbhṛta saṃbhāra tayā ca su kṛta parikarma tayā ca a pramāṇa smṛti bhājana tayā ca prabhāsvara adhimukti viśodhana tayā ca su pratividva dhāraṇī mukhā saṃbhedana tayā ca dharmadhātu jñāna mudrā su mudrita tayā ca  atha khalu te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tatrasthāḥ eva ṛddhi anubhāvena dakṣiṇān pāṇīn prasārya vajragarbhasya bodhisattvasya śīrṣam saṃpramārjayanti sma
translated: It is because of the attainment of the nature of this very samādhi, the power of his previous aspirations, his extremely purified superior intention, his naturally clear orb of wisdom, his well-accumulated provisions, his well-performed activities, his immeasurable mindfulness, his purification of radiant faith, his well-penetrated differentiation of the doors of dhāraṇīs, and his being well-sealed with the seal of the wisdom of the dharma-dhātu.🔽Then those Buddha Bhagavāns, remaining there, extended their right hands through the power of their supernormal abilities and stroked the head of the bodhisattva Vajra garbha.

analyzed: samanantara spṛṣṭaḥ ca vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: As soon as the bodhisattva Vajra garbha was touched by those Buddha Bhagavāns,

original: atha tāvadeva samādhestasmād vyutthāya tān bodhisattvānāmantrayate sma suviniścitamidaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvapraṇidhānamasaṃbhinnamanavalokyaṃ dharmadhātuvipulaṃ ākāśadhātuparyavasānamaparāntakoṭiniṣṭhaṃ sarvasattvadhātuparitrāṇam /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva samādheḥ tasmāt vyutthāya tān bodhisattvān āmantrayate sma su viniścitam idam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattva praṇidhānam asaṃbhinnam anavalokyam dharmadhātu vipulam ākāśa dhātu paryavasānam aparānta koṭi niṣṭham sarva sattvadhātu paritrāṇam
translated: Then, having arisen from that samādhi, he addressed those bodhisattvas, saying, This, sirs, sons of the victors, is the bodhisattva vow, which is well-determined, unbroken, unobservable, vast as the dharma realm, extending to the end of the space realm, reaching the farthest end of the future, and a refuge for all beings.

original: yatra hi nāma bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvā atītānāmapi buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ jñānabhūmimavataranti /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvāḥ atītānām api buddhānām bhagavatām jñāna bhūmim avataranti
translated: For, sirs, sons of the victors, the bodhisattvas enter the stage of knowledge of the past buddhas,

original: anāgatānāmapi buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ jñānabhūmimavataranti pratyutpannānāmapi buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ jñānabhūmimavataranti /

translated: Even if I die, I will certainly not be separated from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: ato'sya durgatibhayaṃ na bhavati /🔽nāsti me kaścidāśayena sarvaloke samasamaḥ /
analyzed: atas asya durgati bhayam na bhavati  na asti me kaścid āśayena sarva loke sama samaḥ
translated: Therefore, he has no fear of bad rebirths.

original: kutaḥ punaruttara ityato'sya parṣacchāradyabhayaṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: kutas punar uttaraḥ iti atas asya parṣad śāradya bhayam na bhavati
translated: There is no one in the whole world who is equal to me in intention, let alone superior. Therefore, he has no fear of timidity in the assembly.

analyzed: evam sarva bhaya trāsa chambhita tva romaharṣa apagataḥ
translated: Thus, he is free from all fear, terror, trembling, and horripilation.

original: atha khalu punarbhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvo mahākaruṇāpuraskṛtatvādanupahatena aprākṛtenādhyāśayena bhūyasyā mātrayā prayujyate sarvakuśalamūlamudāgamāya
analyzed: atha khalu punar bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahā karuṇā puraskṛta tvāt anupahatena aprākṛtena adhyāśayena bhūyasyā mātrayā prayujyate sarva kuśala mūlam udāgamāya
translated: Moreover, venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva, having placed great compassion at the forefront, with an uninjured and extraordinary superior intention, is even more engaged in perfecting all wholesome roots.

original: sa śraddhādhipateyatayā prasādabahulatayā adhimuktiviśuddhyā avakalpanābahulatayā kṛpākaruṇābhinirhāratayā mahāmaitryupetatayā aparikhinnamānasatayā hryapatrāpyālaṃkāratayā kṣāntisauratyopetatayā tathāgatārhatsamyaksaṃbuddhaśāsanagauravacitrīkaraṇatayā rātriṃdivātṛptakuśalamūlopacayatayā kalyāṇamitraniṣevaṇatayā dharmārāmābhiratatayā atṛptabāhuśrutyaparyeṣaṇatayā yathāśrutadharmayoniśaḥpratyavekṣaṇatayā aniketamānasatayā anadhyavasitalābhasatkāraślokatayā anabhinanditopakaraṇasnehatayā ratnopamacittotpādātṛptābhinirhāratayā sarvajñabhūmyabhilāṣaṇatayā tathāgatabalavaiśāradyāveṇikabuddhadharmādhyālambanatayā pāramitāsaṅgaparyeṣaṇatayā māyāśāṭhyaparivarjanatayā yathāvāditathākāritayā satatasamitaṃ satyavacanānurakṣaṇatayā tathāgatakulabhūṣaṇatayā bodhisattvaśikṣānutsarjanatayā mahāśailendrarājopamasarvajñatācittāprakampanatayā sarvalokakriyānabhilakṣaṇatayā utsargalokottarapathopetatayā atṛptabodhyaṅgasaṃbhāropacayatayā satatasamitamuttarottaraviśeṣaparimārgaṇatayā /
analyzed: sa śraddhā ādhipateya tayā prasāda bahula tayā adhimukti viśuddhyā avakalpanā bahula tayā kṛpā karuṇā abhinirhāra tayā mahā maitrī upeta tayā a parikhinna mānasa tayā hrī apatrāpya alaṃkāra tayā kṣānti sauratya upeta tayā tathāgata arhat samyaksaṃbuddha śāsana gaurava citrīkaraṇa tayā rātriṃdiva atṛpta kuśala mūla upacaya tayā kalyāṇa mitra niṣevaṇa tayā dharma ārāma abhirata tayā atṛpta bāhuśrutya paryeṣaṇa tayā yathāśruta dharma yoni
translated: He was endowed with faith, with an abundance of serenity, with pure devotion, with much reflection, with the accomplishment of compassion and kindness, with great loving-kindness, with an untiring mind, with the adornment of shame and conscience, with patience and gentleness, with the respect and veneration of the teaching of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, with the accumulation of wholesome roots day and night without satiation, with the service of spiritual friends, with delight in the Dharma, with the insatiable search for extensive learning, with the proper investigation of the Dharma as heard, with a mind free from attachment, with the non-attachment to gain, honor, and fame, with the non-attachment to the affection of material things, with the insatiable accomplishment of the mind that is like a jewel, with the longing for the stage of omniscience, with the focus on the powers, confidences, and unique qualities of the Tathāgata, with the search for the perfections without attachment, with the abandonment of deceit and dishonesty, with acting in accordance with one's words, with constant

original: evaṃrūpairbhavanto jinaputrā bhūmipariśodhakairdharmaiḥ samanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ supratiṣṭhito bhavati pramuditāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau //
analyzed: evaṃrūpaiḥ bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bhūmi pariśodhakaiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ su pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati pramuditāyām bodhisattva bhūmau
translated: “Thus, noble sons of the Victorious Ones, endowed with these qualities that purify the grounds, the bodhisattva is well-established in the bodhisattva ground The Joyful One.

original: so'syāṃ pramuditāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitaḥ san imānyevaṃrūpāṇi mahāpraṇidhānāni mahāvyavasāyān mahābhinirhārānabhinirharati yaduta aśeṣaniḥśeṣānavaśeṣasarvabuddhapūjopasthāpanāya sarvākāravaropetamudārādhimuktiviśuddhaṃ dharmadhātuvipulamākāśadhātuparyavasānamaparāntakoṭiniṣṭhaṃ sarvakalpasaṃkhyābuddhotpādaṃsaṃkhyāpratiprasrabdhaṃ mahāpūjopasthānāya prathamaṃ mahāpraṇidhānamabhinirharati /
analyzed: saḥ usyām pramuditāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ san imāni evaṃrūpāṇi mahā praṇidhānāni mahā vyavasāyān mahā abhinirhārān abhinirharati yat uta aśeṣa niḥśeṣa an avaśeṣa sarva buddha pūjā upasthāpanāya sarva ākāra vara upetam udāra adhimukti viśuddham dharmadhātu vipulam ākāśa dhātu paryavasānam aparānta koṭi niṣṭham sarva kalpa saṃkhyā buddha utpādam saṃkhyā pratiprasrabdham mahā pūjā upasthānāya prathamam mahā praṇidhānam abhinirha
translated: Abiding in this The Joyful One, the bodhisattva formulates these great aspirations, great resolutions, and great accomplishments, namely: For the sake of making offerings and services to all Buddhas without exception, with vast faith purified by the most excellent of all aspects, vast as the realm of phenomena, extending to the end of space, continuing until the end of time, uninterrupted for as many eons as there are Buddhas, he formulates the first great aspiration for making vast offerings and services.

original: yaduta sarvatathāgatabhāṣitadharmanetrīsaṃdhāraṇāya sarvabuddhabodhisattvasuparigrahāya sarvasamyaksaṃbuddhaśāsanaparirakṣaṇāya / / / /buddhotpādasaddharmaparigrahāya dvitīyam /🔽yaduta sarvabuddhotpādaniravaśeṣasarvalokadhātuprasareṣu tuṣitabhavanavāsamādiṃ kṛtvā cyavanāsaṃkramaṇagarbhasthitijanmakumārakrīḍāntaḥpuravāsābhiniṣkramaṇaduṣkaracaryābodhimaṇḍopasaṃkramaṇamāragharṣaṇābhisaṃbodhyadhyeṣaṇamahādharmacakrapravartanamahāparinirvāṇopasaṃkramaṇāya pūjādharmasaṃgrahaprayogapūrvaṃgamaṃ kṛtvā sarvatraikakālavivartanāya / / /buddhotpāda / / / /yāvanmahāpari
analyzed: yat uta sarva tathāgata bhāṣita dharma netrī saṃdhāraṇāya sarva buddha bodhisattva su parigrahāya sarva samyaksaṃbuddha śāsana parirakṣaṇāya buddha utpāda saddharma parigrahāya dvitīyam  yat uta sarva buddha utpāda niravaśeṣa sarva lokadhātu prasareṣu tuṣita bhavana vāsam ādim kṛtvā cyavanā saṃkramaṇa garbha sthiti janma kumāra krīḍā antaḥpura vāsa abhiniṣkramaṇa duṣkara caryā bodhi maṇḍa upasaṃkramaṇa māra gharṣaṇa abhisaṃbodhi adhyeṣaṇa mahā dharma cakra pravartana mahā parinirvāṇa upasaṃkramaṇāya pūjā dharma saṃgraha prayoga pūrvaṃgamam kṛtvā sarvatra eka kāla vivartanāya buddha utpāda yāvat mahā parinirvāṇ
translated: Namely, for the sake of upholding the Dharma method taught by all the Thus-Come Ones, for the sake of being well-received by all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, for the sake of protecting the teachings of all the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, for the sake of upholding the true Dharma of the Buddhas, this is the second.

analyzed: nirvāṇa upasaṃkramaṇāya tṛtīyam
translated: Namely, for the sake of all the Buddhas' appearances in the world, in all the worlds without exception, from their dwelling in the Tuṣita Heaven to their descent, conception in the womb, birth, childhood, play, harem life, renunciation, practice of austerities, approach to the seat of enlightenment, subjugation of Māra, enlightenment, entreaty to turn the wheel of the great Dharma, and approach to the great parinirvāṇa, for the sake of making offerings, gathering the Dharma, and engaging in practices, for the sake of turning the wheel of the Dharma everywhere at the same time, for the sake of the appearance of the Buddhas, up to the great parinirvāṇa, this is the third.

analyzed: yat uta sarva bodhisattva caryā vipula mahadgata apramāṇa asaṃbhinna sarva pāramitā saṃgṛhīta sarva bhūmi pariśodhanam sa aṅga upāṅga nirhāra salakṣaṇa saṃvarta vivarta sarva bodhisattva caryā bhūta yathāvat bhūmi patha upadeśa
translated: Namely, the vast, great, immeasurable, unbroken, all-encompassing perfections, the purification of all stages, the accomplishment of the main and subsidiary practices, the characteristics of creation and destruction, all the bodhisattva practices, the true and as-it-is teaching of the stages,

analyzed: pāramitā parikarma avavāda anuśāsanī anupradāna upastabdha citta utpāda abhinirhārāya caryā citta utpāda abhinirhārāya caturtham
translated: The bestowal of instructions and teachings on the perfections, the establishment of the generation of the mind for the accomplishment of the practice, the generation of the mind for the accomplishment of the practice, the fourth.

original: yaduta niravaśeṣasarvasattvadhāturūpyarūpisaṃjñāsaṃjñinaivasaṃjñināsaṃjñāṇḍajajarāyujasaṃsvedajaupapāduka / / / traidhātukaparyāpannaṣaḍgatisamavasṛtasarvopapattiparyāpannanāmarūpasaṃgṛhītāśeṣasarvasattvadhātuparipācanāya sarvabuddhadharmāvatāraṇāya sarvagatisaṃkhyāvyavacchedanāya sarvajñajñānapratiṣṭhāpanāya / / /sattvadhātu / / /sarvasattvadhātuparipācanāya pañcamam yaduta niravaśeṣasarvalokadhātuvipulasaṃkṣiptamahadgatāpramāṇasūkṣmaudārikavyatyastāvamūrdhasamatalapraveśasamavarasaraṇānugatendrajālavibhāgadaśadigaśeṣavimātratāvibhāgapraveśajñānānugama
analyzed: yat uta niravaśeṣa sarva sattvadhātu rūpya rūpi saṃjñā saṃjñinā eva saṃjñinā asaṃjña aṇḍa ja jarāyu ja saṃsveda ja aupapāduka traidhātuka paryāpanna ṣaṣ gati samavasṛta sarva upapatti paryāpanna nāma rūpa saṃgṛhīta aśeṣa sarva sattvadhātu paripācanāya sarva buddha dharma avatāraṇāya sarva gati saṃkhyā vyavacchedanāya sarvajña jñāna pratiṣṭhāpanāya sattvadhātu sarva sattvadhātu paripācanāya pañcamam yat uta niravaśeṣa sarva lokadhā
translated: Namely, for the complete ripening of the entire realm of beings, both those with form and those without form, those with perception and those without perception, those born from eggs, wombs, moisture, or spontaneously, up to those in the three realms, included in the six destinies, and all those included in rebirth, all beings included in name and form, for introducing them to all the qualities of the Buddhas, for eliminating all the categories of destinies, for establishing them in omniscient knowledge, up to for the complete ripening of the entire realm of beings.🔽For the direct knowledge of the entire realm of beings, up to for the complete ripening of the entire realm of beings. Namely, for the knowledge of entering into the various aspects of the entire realm of worlds, vast and minute, great and immeasurable, subtle and gross, inverted and upright, horizontal and level, with entrances and without, with various magical displays, and the various categories of the ten directions,

analyzed: pratyakṣa tāyai lokadhātu lokadhātu vaimātrya avatāraṇāya ṣaṣṭham
translated: for entering into the various aspects of the entire realm of worlds, up to for the complete ripening of the entire realm of beings.

analyzed: yat uta sarva kṣetra eka kṣetra eka kṣetra sarva kṣetra samavasaraṇa pariśodhanam apramāṇa buddhakṣetra prabhā vyūha alaṃkāra pratimaṇḍitam sarva kleśa apanayana pariśuddha patha upetam apramāṇa jñāna ākara sattva paripūrṇam udāra buddha viṣaya samavasaraṇam yathā āśaya sarva sattva saṃdarśana saṃtoṣaṇāya buddhakṣetra sarva buddhakṣetra pariśodhanāya saptamam
translated: namely, the ability to cause all realms to be included in one realm and one realm to be included in all realms, to purify them, to adorn them with the immeasurable array of the Buddha-land, to cause them to be endowed with the pure path that removes all afflictions, to cause them to be filled with immeasurable wisdom and beings, and to cause them to be included in the vast domain of the Buddhas, in order to show and satisfy all beings according to their inclinations. . . . the Buddha-land . . . is the seventh [cause] for the purification of all Buddha-lands.

original: yaduta sarvabodhisattvaikāśayaprayogatāyai niḥsapatnakuśalamūlopacayāya ekālambanasarvabodhisattvasamatāyai avirahitasatatasamitabuddhabodhisattvasamavadhānāya yatheṣṭabuddhotpādasaṃdarśanāya svacittotpādatathāgataprabhāvajñānānugamāya acyutānugāminyabhijñāpratilambhāya sarvalokadhātvanuvicaraṇāya sarvabuddhaparṣanmaṇḍalapratibhāsaprāptaye sarvopapattisvaśarīrānugamāya acintyamahāyānopetatāyai bodhisattvacaryācaraṇāvyavacchedāya / / /caryā / / /mahāyānāvatāraṇāya aṣṭamam /
analyzed: yat uta sarva bodhisattva eka āśaya prayoga tāyai niḥsapatna kuśala mūla upacayāya eka ālambana sarva bodhisattva samatāyai avirahita satata samita buddha bodhisattva samavadhānāya yathā iṣṭa buddha utpāda saṃdarśanāya sva citta utpāda tathāgata prabhāva jñāna anugamāya acyutā anugāminī abhijñā pratilambhāya sarva lokadhātu anuvicaraṇāya sarva buddha parṣad maṇḍala pratibhāsa prāptaye sarva upapatti sva śarīra anugamāya acintya mahāyāna upeta tāyai bodhis
translated: namely, in order to be of one mind and practice with all bodhisattvas, to accumulate roots of virtue without rivals, to be of one focus with all bodhisattvas, to be inseparable from constant and continuous association with Buddhas and bodhisattvas, to manifest the arising of Buddhas as desired, to understand the power and knowledge of the Tathagatas through one's own generation of the mind of enlightenment, to attain the superknowledges that follow without fail, to move through all world systems, to attain the appearance in all Buddha assemblies, to follow all rebirths with one's own body, to be endowed with the inconceivable great vehicle, to uninterruptedly practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, to engage in conduct, to enter the great vehicle, which is the eighth.

original: yaduta avivartyacakrasamārūḍhabodhisattvacaryācaraṇāya amoghakāyavāṅmanaskarmaṇe sahadarśananiyatabuddhadharmatvāya sahaghoṣodāhārajñānānugamāya sahaprasādakleśavinivartanāya mahābhaiṣajyarājopamāśrayapratilambhāya cintāmaṇivatkāyapratilambhāya sarvabodhisattvacaryācaraṇāya / / /caryā / / /amoghasarvaceṣṭatāyai navamam /
analyzed: yat uta a vivartya cakra samārūḍha bodhisattva caryā caraṇāya amogha kāya vāc manaḥ karmaṇe saha darśana niyata buddha dharma tvāya saha ghoṣa udāhāra jñāna anugamāya saha prasāda kleśa vinivartanāya mahā bhaiṣajya rāja upama āśraya pratilambhāya cintāmaṇi vat kāya pratilambhāya sarva bodhisattva caryā caraṇāya caryā amogha sarva ceṣṭa tāyai navamam
translated: namely, for the sake of engaging in the irreversible wheel and the conduct of a bodhisattva, for the sake of unimpeded bodily, verbal, and mental actions, for the sake of being certain about the Buddha's teachings upon seeing [the bodhisattva], for the sake of understanding through the utterance of a single voice, for the sake of turning away afflictions through faith, for the sake of attaining a body that is like a great medicine king, for the sake of attaining a body that is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, for the sake of engaging in all bodhisattva conduct, for the sake of unimpeded all activities, the ninth.

analyzed: yat uta sarva lokadhātuṣu anuttara samyaksaṃbodhi abhisaṃbodhāya eka vāla pathā vyativṛtta sarva bāla pṛthagjana janma upapati abhiniṣkramaṇa vikurvaṇa bodhimaṇḍa dharmacakra
translated: Namely, for the sake of fully awakening to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in all world systems, for the sake of not transgressing the path of a single hair, for the sake of birth and rebirth in the state of an ordinary foolish person, for the sake of leaving home, for the sake of miracles, for the sake of the seat of enlightenment, for the sake of the wheel of the Dharma,

analyzed: pravartana mahāparinirvāṇa upadarśanāya mahābuddha viṣaya prabhāva jñāna anugamāya sarva sattvadhātu yathā āśaya buddha utpāda kṣaṇa kṣaṇa vibhaṅga vibodha praśama prāpaṇa saṃdarśanāya eka abhisaṃbodhi sarva dharma nirmāṇa spharaṇāya eka ghoṣa udāhāra sarva sattva citta āśaya saṃtoṣaṇāya mahāparinirvāṇa upadarśana caryā bala avyavacchedāya mahā jñāna bhūmi sarva dharma vyavasthāpana saṃdarśanāya dharma jñāna ṛddhi māyā abhijñā
translated: In order to demonstrate the great parinirvāṇa, in order to follow the knowledge of the great power of the Buddha's domain, in order to demonstrate the attainment of peace through the moment-by-moment analysis of the arising of the Buddha according to the dispositions of all beings, in order to pervade all phenomena with a single enlightenment, in order to satisfy the minds and intentions of all beings with a single utterance, in order to demonstrate the practice of the great parinirvāṇa without interruption, in order to demonstrate the establishment of all phenomena on the ground of great wisdom, in order to pervade all world systems with the magical knowledge of phenomena, in order to accomplish the great wisdom and supernormal knowledge of enlightenment, this is the tenth.

original: iti hi bhavanto jinaputrā imānyevaṃrūpāṇi mahāpraṇidhānāni mahāvyavasāyān mahābhinirhārān daśa praṇidhānamukhāni pramukhaṃ kṛtvā paripūrṇāni daśapraṇidhānāsaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrāṇi yāni bodhisattvaḥ pramuditāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito'bhinirharati pratilabhate ca //
analyzed: iti hi bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ imāni evaṃrūpāṇi mahā praṇidhānāni mahā vyavasāyān mahā abhinirhārān daśa praṇidhāna mukhāni pramukham kṛtvā paripūrṇāni daśa praṇidhāna asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi yāni bodhisattvaḥ pramuditāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ abhinirharati pratilabhate ca
translated: Thus, sons of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva, abiding in the Bodhisattva ground of The Joyful, accomplishes and attains these great vows, great resolutions, great undertakings, the ten gateways of vows as the foremost, and the full one hundred thousand asaṃkhyeya vows.

analyzed: tāni ca mahā praṇidhānāni daśabhiḥ niṣṭhāpadaiḥ abhinirharati
translated: And those great vows are accomplished by ten ultimate bases.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: What are the ten?

original: yaduta sattvadhātuniṣṭhayā ca lokadhātuniṣṭhayā ca ākāśadhātuniṣṭhayā ca dharmadhātuniṣṭhayā ca nirvāṇadhātuniṣṭhayā ca buddhotpādadhātuniṣṭhayā ca tathāgatajñānadhātuniṣṭhayā ca cittālambanadhātuniṣṭhayā ca buddhaviṣayajñānapraveśadhātuniṣṭhayāḥ ca lokavartanīdharmavartanījñānavartanīdhātuniṣṭhayā ca /
analyzed: yat uta sattvadhātu niṣṭhayā ca lokadhātu niṣṭhayā ca ākāśa dhātu niṣṭhayā ca dharmadhātu niṣṭhayā ca nirvāṇa dhātu niṣṭhayā ca buddha utpāda dhātu niṣṭhayā ca tathāgata jñāna dhātu niṣṭhayā ca citta ālambana dhātu niṣṭhayā ca buddha viṣaya jñāna praveśa dhātu niṣṭhayā ca loka vartanī dharma vartanī jñāna vartanī dhātu niṣṭhayā ca
translated: Namely, the ultimate of the realm of beings, the ultimate of the realm of worlds, the ultimate of the realm of space, the ultimate of the realm of phenomena, the ultimate of the realm of nirvāṇa, the ultimate of the realm of the arising of Buddhas, the ultimate of the Tathāgata's wisdom realm, the ultimate of the realm of mental objects, the ultimate of entering the wisdom of the Buddha's domain, and the ultimate of the realm of the wisdom of worldly conduct, Dharma conduct, and knowledge conduct.

analyzed: iti hi yā niṣṭhā sattvadhātu niṣṭhāyāḥ
translated: Thus, the ultimate of the realm of beings is the ultimate.

original: sā me niṣṭhā eṣāṃ mahāpraṇidhānānāṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: sā me niṣṭhā eṣām mahā praṇidhānānām bhavatu
translated: May that be my limit for these great vows.

analyzed: yā niṣṭhā yāvajjñāna vartanī dhātu niṣṭhāyāḥ
translated: The limit of the realm of knowledge is the limit of the realm of dharmas.

original: sā me niṣṭhā eṣāṃ mahāpraṇidhānānāṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: sā me niṣṭhā eṣām mahā praṇidhānānām bhavatu
translated: May that be my limit for these great vows.

analyzed: iti hi aniṣṭhā sattvadhātu niṣṭhā
translated: For thus the limit of the realm of beings is the limit of the realm of dharmas.

analyzed: aniṣṭhāni imāni me kuśala mūlāni bhavantu
translated: May these roots of virtue of mine be limitless.

analyzed: aniṣṭhā yāvajjñāna vartanī dhātu niṣṭhā
translated: The limit of the realm of knowledge is the limit of the realm of dharmas.

analyzed: aniṣṭhāni imāni me kuśala mūlāni bhavantu iti
translated: May these roots of virtue of mine be limitless.

original: sa evaṃ svabhinihṛrtapraṇidhānaḥ karmaṇyacitto mṛducitto'saṃhāryaśraddho bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ evam su abhinihṛrta praṇidhānaḥ karmaṇi acittaḥ mṛdu citta usaṃhārya śraddhaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, having made such a vow, his mind is fit for action, his mind is tender, and his faith is unshakable.

original: so'bhiśraddadhāti tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ pūrvāntacaryābhinirhārapraveśaṃ pāramitāsamudāgamaṃ bhūmipariniṣpattiṃ vaiśeṣikatāṃ balapariniṣpattiṃ vaiśāradyaparipūrimāveṇikabuddhadharmāsaṃhāryatāmacintyāṃ buddhadharmatāmanantamadhyaṃ tathāgataviṣayābhinirhāramaparimāṇajñānānugataṃ tathāgatagocarānupraveśaṃ phalapariniṣpattimabhiśraddadhāti /
analyzed: saḥ abhiśraddadhāti tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām pūrva anta caryā abhinirhāra praveśam pāramitā samudāgamam bhūmi pariniṣpattim vaiśeṣika tām bala pariniṣpattim vaiśāradya paripūrim āveṇika buddha dharma asaṃhārya tām acintyām buddha dharma tām ananta madhyam tathāgata viṣaya abhinirhāram aparimāṇa jñāna anugatam tathāgata gocara anupraveśam phala pariniṣpattim abhiśraddadhāti
translated: He has faith in the past conduct, accomplishment, and entry of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones; he has faith in the perfection of the perfections, the accomplishment of the stages, the accomplishment of the special qualities, the fulfillment of the fearlessnesses, the inexhaustibility of the unique qualities of the Buddha, the inconceivable nature of the Buddha qualities, the infinite and boundless accomplishment of the domain of the Tathāgatas, the entry into the domain of the Tathāgatas that is accompanied by immeasurable knowledge, and the fulfillment of the result.

analyzed: samāsatas sarva bodhisattva caryām yāvat tathāgata bhūmi jñāna nirdeśa adhiṣṭhānam abhiśraddadhāti
translated: In brief, he has faith in all the conduct of the bodhisattvas up to the teaching of the knowledge of the stage of the Tathāgata.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavati evaṃ gambhīrāḥ khalu punarime buddhadharmāḥ evaṃ viviktāḥ evaṃ śāntāḥ evaṃ śūnyāḥ evamānimittāḥ evamapraṇihitāḥ evaṃ nirupalepāḥ evaṃ vipulāḥ evamaparimāṇāḥ evamudārāḥ evaṃ durāsadāśceme buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati evam gambhīrāḥ khalu punar ime buddha dharmāḥ evam viviktāḥ evam śāntāḥ evam śūnyāḥ evam a nimittāḥ evam apraṇihitāḥ evam nirupalepāḥ evam vipulāḥ evam aparimāṇāḥ evam udārāḥ evam durāsadāḥ ca ime buddha dharmāḥ
translated: He thinks like this: 'Thus, these Buddha qualities are indeed profound, thus secluded, thus peaceful, thus empty, thus signless, thus wishless, thus free from impurity, thus vast, thus immeasurable, thus sublime, thus difficult to attain. These Buddha qualities are like this.'

original: atha ca punarime bālapṛthagjanāḥ kudṛṣṭipatitayā saṃtatyā avidyāndhakārapayarvanaddhamānasena mānadhvajasamucchrittaiḥ saṃkalpaistṛṣṇājālābhilaṣitairmanasikārairmāyāśāṭhyagahanānucaritaiścittāśayairīrṣyāmātsaryasaṃprayuktairgatyupapattiprayogai rāgadveṣamohaparicittaiḥ karmopacayaiḥ krodhopanāhasaṃdhukṣitābhiścittajvālābhirviparyāsasaṃprayuktaiḥ karmakriyābhinirhāraiḥ kāmabhavāvidyāsravānubaddhaiścittamanovijñānabījaistraidhātuke punarbhavāṅkuramabhinirvartayanti yadidaṃ nāmarūpasahajāvinirbhāgagatam /
analyzed: atha ca punar ime bāla pṛthagjanāḥ kudṛṣṭi patitayā saṃtatyā avidyā andhakāra payarva naddha mānasena māna dhvaja samucchrittaiḥ saṃkalpaiḥ tṛṣṇā jāla abhilaṣitaiḥ manasikāraiḥ māyā śāṭhya gahana anucaritaiḥ citta āśayaiḥ īrṣyā mātsarya saṃprayuktaiḥ gati upapatti prayogaiḥ rāga dveṣa moha paricittaiḥ karma upacayaiḥ krodha upanāha saṃdhukṣitābhiḥ citta jvālābhiḥ viparyāsa saṃprayuktaiḥ karma kriyā abhinirhāraiḥ kā
translated: Moreover, these foolish ordinary beings, with a continuum fallen into wrong views, with minds bound by the forest of the darkness of ignorance, with intentions that raise the banner of pride, with mental activities that desire the net of craving, with minds that follow the dense forest of deceit and guile, with thoughts accompanied by jealousy and stinginess, with practices that lead to rebirth in the realms, with accumulations of karma nourished by desire, hatred, and delusion, with the flames of anger and resentment burning in their minds, with the accomplishment of actions accompanied by error, with the seeds of mind, thought, and consciousness bound to the streams of desire, existence, and ignorance, they produce the sprout of rebirth in the three realms, which is inseparable from the co-arising of name-and-form.

original: tenaiva ca nāmarūpeṇa vivardhitena eṣāṃ ṣaḍāyatanagrāmaḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: tena eva ca nāma rūpeṇa vivardhitena eṣām ṣaṣ āyatana grāmaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: And by that very name-and-form that has grown, this group of six sense bases comes into existence for them.

analyzed: saṃbhūteṣu āyataneṣu anyonya sparśa nipātataḥ vedanā saṃbhavati
translated: When the sense bases have come into existence, feeling arises from the mutual contact of the sense faculties.

original: tāmeva vedanāṃ bhūyo bhūyo'bhinandatāṃ tṛṣṇopādānaṃ vivardhate /
analyzed: tām eva vedanām bhūyas bhūyas abhinandatām tṛṣṇā upādānam vivardhate
translated: For those who repeatedly delight in that very feeling, craving and grasping increase.

analyzed: vivṛddhe tṛṣṇā upādāne bhavaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: When craving and grasping increase, becoming comes into being.

analyzed: saṃbhūte ca bhave jāti jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: And when becoming has come into being, birth, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair appear.

original: evameteṣāṃ sattvānāṃ duḥkhaskandho'bhinirvartate ātmātmīyavigato riktastucchaḥ śūnyo nirīho niśceṣṭo jaḍastṛṇakāṣṭhakuḍyavartmapratibhāsopamaḥ
analyzed: evam eteṣām sattvānām duḥkha skandhaḥ abhinirvartate ātma ātmīya vigataḥ riktaḥ tucchaḥ śūnyaḥ nirīhaḥ niśceṣṭaḥ jaḍaḥ tṛṇa kāṣṭha kuḍya vartma pratibhāsa upamaḥ
translated: Thus, the mass of suffering of these beings comes into being, devoid of self and what belongs to self, empty, void, devoid of effort, inactive, inert, like grass, wood, walls, paths, and reflections.

analyzed: na ca evam avabudhyante iti
translated: But they do not understand it in this way.

original: teṣāmevaṃrūpeṇa sattvānāṃ duḥkhaskandhāvipramokṣaṃ dṛṣṭvā sattveṣu mahākaruṇonmiñjaḥ saṃbhavati ete'smābhiḥ sattvāḥ paritrātavyāḥ parimocayitavyā ato mahāsaṃmohāt /
analyzed: teṣām evaṃrūpeṇa sattvānām duḥkha skandha a vipramokṣam dṛṣṭvā sattveṣu mahā karuṇā unmiñjaḥ saṃbhavati ete smābhiḥ sattvāḥ paritrātavyāḥ parimocayitavyāḥ atas mahā saṃmohāt
translated: Seeing the non-liberation of beings from the mass of suffering in this way, great compassion arises for beings in them, thinking These beings should be saved by us, should be liberated from this great delusion.

analyzed: atyanta sukhe ca nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpayitavyāḥ iti
translated: And they should be established in the highest happiness of nirvana.

analyzed: atas asya mahāmaitrī unmiñjaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: Therefore, great love arises in them.

original: evaṃ kṛpāmaitryanugatena khalu punarbhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvo'dhyāśayena prathamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau vartamānaḥ sarvavastuṣu sāpekṣacittaṃ parivarjya buddhajñāne ca udāraspṛhābhilāṣabuddhirmahātyāgeṣu prayuñjate /
analyzed: evam kṛpā maitrī anugatena khalu punar bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattva udhyāśayena prathamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau vartamānaḥ sarva vastuṣu sāpekṣa cittam parivarjya buddha jñāne ca udāra spṛhā abhilāṣa buddhiḥ mahā tyāgeṣu prayuñjate
translated: In this way, venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva, endowed with compassion and loving-kindness, having abandoned the attitude of concern for all things, and with a mind of lofty longing and aspiration for Buddha-knowledge, engages in great generosity, abiding in the first Bodhisattva ground.

original: sa ya ime tyāgāḥ yaduta dhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgāraparityāgo vā hiraṇyasuvarṇamaṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravālajātarūparajataparityāgo vā ratnābharaṇavibhūṣaṇaparityāgo vā hayarathagajapativāhanaparityāgo vā udyānatapovanavihāraparityāgo vā dāsīdāsakarmakarapauruṣeyaparityāgo vā grāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīparityāgo vā bhāryāputraduhitṛparityāgo vā sarvapriyamanāpavastuparityāgo vā śiraḥkarṇanāsākaracaraṇanayanasvamāṃsaśoṇitāsthimajjāmedaśchavicarmahṛdayasarvātmabhāvaparityāgo vā /
analyzed: sa ye ime tyāgāḥ yat uta dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāra parityāgaḥ vā hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajata parityāgaḥ vā ratna ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇa parityāgaḥ vā haya ratha gaja pati vāhana parityāgaḥ vā udyāna tapaḥ vana vihāra parityāgaḥ vā dāsī dāsa karmakara pauruṣeya parityāgaḥ vā grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānī parityāgaḥ vā bhāryā putra duhitṛ parityāgaḥ vā sarva
translated: Those abandonments are, namely, the abandonment of wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses, or the abandonment of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, natural gold, and silver, or the abandonment of precious ornaments and adornments, or the abandonment of horse-drawn chariots, elephants, and vehicles, or the abandonment of pleasure groves, hermitages, and retreats, or the abandonment of female and male servants, workers, and employees, or the abandonment of villages, towns, market towns, countries, regions, and capital cities, or the abandonment of wife, children, and daughters, or the abandonment of all pleasant and agreeable things, or the abandonment of head, ears, nose, hands, feet, eyes, flesh, blood, bones, marrow, fat, skin, hide, heart, and all one's possessions.

original: teṣvanapekṣo bhūtvā sarvavastuṣu buddhajñāne ca udāraspṛhābhilāṣabuddhiḥ parityajati /
analyzed: teṣu anapekṣaḥ bhūtvā sarva vastuṣu buddha jñāne ca udāra spṛhā abhilāṣa buddhiḥ parityajati
translated: Having become indifferent to those, he abandons all things and aspires with a lofty longing for the wisdom of the Buddhas.

original: evaṃ hyasya prathamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya mahātyāgaḥ saṃbhavati //
analyzed: evam hi asya prathamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya mahā tyāgaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: Thus, for him who is established in the first bodhisattva stage, this great abandonment becomes possible.

original: sa evaṃ karuṇāmaitrītyāgāśayo bhūtvā sarvasattvaparitrāṇārthaṃ bhūyo bhūyo laukikalokottarānarthān parimārgate parigaveṣate /
analyzed: saḥ evam karuṇā maitrī tyāga āśayaḥ bhūtvā sarva sattva paritrāṇa artham bhūyas bhūyas laukika lokottarān arthān parimārgate parigaveṣate
translated: Having such a disposition of renunciation through compassion and friendliness, he seeks again and again, and investigates, worldly and transcendent matters for the sake of protecting all beings.

analyzed: parimārgamāṇaḥ parigaveṣamāṇaḥ ca a parikheda cittam utpādayati
translated: While seeking and investigating, he generates a mind free from weariness.

analyzed: evam asya a parikhedaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: In this way, his non-weariness arises.

analyzed: aparikhinnaḥ ca sarva śāstra viśāradaḥ bhavati
translated: And being free from weariness, he becomes skilled in all treatises.

analyzed: atas asya śāstra jña tā saṃbhavati
translated: Therefore, his knowledge of treatises arises.

original: sa evaṃ śāstropetaḥ kriyākriyāvicāritayā buddhyā hīnamadhyapraṇīteṣu sattveṣu tathatvāya pratipadyate yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: saḥ evam śāstra upetaḥ kriyā akriyā vicāritayā buddhyā hīna madhya praṇīteṣu sattveṣu tathatvāya pratipadyate yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: Endowed with such treatises, he practices in accordance with reality towards inferior, middling, and superior beings with a mind that investigates what should and should not be done, to the best of his ability and according to his share.

analyzed: atas asya loka jña tā saṃbhavati
translated: Therefore, his knowledge of the world arises.

original: lokajñaśca kālavelāmātracārī hryapatrāpyavibhūṣitayā saṃtatyā ātmārthaparārtheṣu prayujyate /
analyzed: loka jñaḥ ca kālavelā mātra cārī hrī apatrāpya vibhūṣitayā saṃtatyā ātma artha para artheṣu prayujyate
translated: And knowing the world, he practices at the proper time and occasion, engaged in benefiting himself and others with a continuum adorned by shame and embarrassment.

analyzed: atas asya hrī apatrāpyam saṃbhavati
translated: Therefore, his shame and embarrassment arise.

original: teṣu ca prayogeṣu naiṣkramyacārī avivartyāpratyudāvartyabalādhānaprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: teṣu ca prayogeṣu naiṣkramya cārī a vivartya a pratyudāvartya bala ādhāna prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: And in those practices, he practices renunciation, attaining the power of irreversibility and non-retrogression.

analyzed: evam asya dhṛti bala ādhānam ājatam bhavati
translated: Thus, his steadfastness and strength are generated.

analyzed: dhṛti bala ādhāna prāptaḥ ca tathāgata pūjā upasthāneṣu prayujyate
translated: And having attained steadfastness and strength, he engages in worshipping and serving the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: śāsane ca pratipadyate
translated: And he practices in the teachings.

original: evaṃ hyasyeme daśa bhūmipariśodhakā dharmā ājātā bhavanti /
analyzed: evam hi asya ime daśa bhūmi pariśodhakāḥ dharmāḥ ājātāḥ bhavanti
translated: Thus, these ten dharmas that purify the stages are born in him.

original: tadyathā śraddhā karuṇā maitrī tyāgaḥ khedasahiṣṇutā śāstrajñatā lokajñatā hryapatrāpyaṃ dhṛtibalādhānaṃ tathāgatapūjopasthānamiti //
analyzed: tat yathā  śraddhā karuṇā maitrī tyāgaḥ kheda sahiṣṇu tā śāstra jña tā loka jña tā hrī apatrāpyam dhṛti bala ādhānam tathāgata pūjā upasthānam iti
translated: Namely, faith, compassion, friendliness, generosity, patience in weariness, knowledge of the scriptures, knowledge of the world, shame, modesty, steadfastness, and strength.

original: tasya asyāṃ pramuditāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya bahavo buddhā ābhāsamāgacchanti audārikadarśanena praṇidhānabalena ca /
analyzed: tasya asyām pramuditāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya bahavaḥ buddhāḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti audārika darśanena praṇidhāna balena ca
translated: For the bodhisattva who is established in this Joyful bodhisattva stage, many buddhas appear through coarse vision and the power of vows.

original: bahūni buddhaśatāni bahūni buddhasahasrāṇi bahūni buddhaśatasahasrāṇi bahūni buddhanayutaśatasahasrāṇi bahavo buddhakoṭyo bahūni buddhakoṭīśatāni bahūni buddhakoṭīsahasrāṇi bahūni buddhakoṭīśatasahasrāṇi bahūni buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyābhāsamāgacchanti audārikadarśanena praṇidhānabalena ca /
analyzed: bahūni buddha śatāni bahūni buddha sahasrāṇi bahūni buddha śata sahasrāṇi bahūni buddha nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bahavaḥ buddha koṭyaḥ bahūni buddha koṭī śatāni bahūni buddha koṭī sahasrāṇi bahūni buddha koṭī śata sahasrāṇi bahūni buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ābhāsam āgacchanti audārika darśanena praṇidhāna balena ca
translated: He sees many hundreds of Buddhas, many thousands of Buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas, many hundred koṭis of Buddhas, many hundred thousand koṭis of Buddhas, many hundred thousand nayutas of Buddhas, many hundred thousand nayutas of koṭis of Buddhas, many hundred thousand koṭi nayutas of Buddhas, many hundred thousand koṭi nayuta niyutas of Buddhas, by means of his great vision and the power of his vow.

original: sa tāṃstathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān dṛṣṭvā udārādhyāśayena satkaroti gurukaroti mānayati pūjayati /
analyzed: sa tān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān dṛṣṭvā udāra adhyāśayena satkaroti gurukaroti mānayati pūjayati
translated: Having seen those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, he honors them with a noble superior intention, respects them, reveres them, makes offerings to them,

analyzed: cīvara piṇḍapātra śayāna āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ ca pratipādayati
translated: and presents them with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: bodhisattva sukha upadhānam ca upasaṃharati
translated: He also provides the requisites for happiness of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: saṃgha gaṇa saṃmāna tām ca karoti
translated: He honors the assemblies of the Saṅgha.

analyzed: tāni ca kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: He dedicates those wholesome roots to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tāṃśca asya buddhān bhagavataḥ pūjayataḥ sattvaparipāka ājāto bhavati /
analyzed: tān ca asya buddhān bhagavataḥ pūjayataḥ sattva paripākaḥ ājātaḥ bhavati
translated: And while he is making offerings to those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, he matures beings.

original: sa sattvāṃśca paripācayati dānena priyavadyena ca adhimuktibalena ca /
analyzed: sa sattvān ca paripācayati dānena priya vadyena ca adhimukti balena ca
translated: He also brings beings to maturity through generosity and through pleasant speech, through the power of aspiration.

original: asyopari dve arthasaṃgrahavastūnyājāyete na tu khalvaśeṣajñānaprativedhapratilambhena /
analyzed: asya upari dve artha saṃgraha vastūni ājāyete na tu khalu aśeṣa jñāna prativedha pratilambhena
translated: Two of the bases of gathering a following arise for him, but not through the attainment of penetrating insight into everything.

original: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyo dānapāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ dāna pāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati
translated: Of the ten perfections, the perfection of generosity becomes predominant for him,

original: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudāgacchati yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudāgacchati yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: but he does not fail to practice the others as best he can and as circumstances permit.

original: sa yathā yathā buddhāṃśca bhagavataḥ pūjayati /
analyzed: sa yathā yathā buddhān ca bhagavataḥ pūjayati
translated: As he worships the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: sattvaparipākāya ca prayujya tānimān daśa bhūmipariśodhakān dharmān samādāya vartate /
analyzed: sattva paripākāya ca prayujya tān imān daśa bhūmi pariśodhakān dharmān samādāya vartate
translated: and applies himself to bringing beings to maturity, he takes up and practices those ten dharmas that purify the stages.

original: tathā tathāsya tāni kuśalamūlāni sarvajñatāpariṇāmitāni bhūyasyā mātrayottapyante /
analyzed: tathā tathā asya tāni kuśala mūlāni sarvajña tā pariṇāmitāni bhūyasyā mātrayā uttapyante
translated: As he does so, those wholesome roots of his, dedicated to complete knowing, are refined more and more.

analyzed: pariśuddhi anti
translated: They become purified.

analyzed: karmaṇyāni ca bhavanti yathākāma tayā
translated: And they become workable as he wishes.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhavanto jinaputrā jātarūpaṃ kuśalena karmāreṇa yathā yathāgnau prakṣipyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ jātarūpam kuśalena karmāreṇa yathā yathā agnau prakṣipyate
translated: Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, it is just as when well-worked gold is put into fire by a skilled goldsmith,

original: tathā tathā pariśuddhyati karmaṇyaṃ ca bhavati vibhūṣaṇālaṃkāravidhiṣu yathākāmatayā /
analyzed: tathā tathā pariśuddhi ati karmaṇyam ca bhavati vibhūṣaṇa alaṃkāra vidhiṣu yathākāma tayā
translated: In the same way, it becomes purified and workable for the various adornments and ornaments as one wishes.

original: evameva bhavanto jinaputrā yathā yathā bodhisattvo / / /peyālaṃ / / /yathākāmatayā //
analyzed: evam eva bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ yathā yathā bodhisattva upeya alam yathākāma tayā
translated: In the same way, sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva... and so forth, as before... as one wishes.

original: punaraparaṃ bhavanto jinaputra bodhisattvena asyāṃ prathamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitena asyā eva prathamāyā bodhisattvabhūmerākārapratilambhaniṣyandāḥ parimārgitavyāḥ parigaveṣitavyāḥ paripraṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam bhavantaḥ jinaputra bodhisattvena asyām prathamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitena asyāḥ eva prathamāyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ ākāra pratilambha nisyandāḥ parimārgitavyāḥ parigaveṣitavyāḥ paripraṣṭavyāḥ
translated: Moreover, sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who abides in this first bodhisattva stage should seek, investigate, and inquire about the results of attaining the aspects of this very first bodhisattva stage.

original: buddhabodhisattvānāṃ kalyāṇamitrāṇāṃ ca sakāśādatṛptena ca bhavitavyaṃ bhūmyaṅgapariniṣpādanāya /
analyzed: buddha bodhisattvānām kalyāṇa mitrāṇām ca sakāśāt atṛptena ca bhavitavyam bhūmi aṅga pariniṣpādanāya
translated: And he should be insatiable in the presence of the Buddhas, bodhisattvas, and spiritual friends in order to perfect the factors of the stage.

analyzed: evam yāvat daśamyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ aṅga pariniṣpādanāya
translated: In the same way, up to perfecting the factors of the tenth bodhisattva stage.

original: tena bhūmipakṣapratipakṣakuśalena ca bhavitavyaṃ bhūmisaṃvartavivartakuśalena ca bhūmyākāraniṣyandakuśalena ca bhūmipratilambhavibhāvanākuśalena ca bhūmyaṅgapariśodhanakuśalena ca bhūmerbhūmisaṃkramaṇakuśalena ca bhūmibhūmivyavasthānakuśalena ca bhūmibhūmiviśeṣajñānakuśalena ca bhūmibhūmipratilambhāpratyudāvartyakuśalena ca sarvabodhisattvabhūmipariśodhanatayā tathāgatajñānabhūmyākramaṇakuśalena ca bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tena bhūmi pakṣa pratipakṣa kuśalena ca bhavitavyam bhūmi saṃvarta vivarta kuśalena ca bhūmi ākāra nisyanda kuśalena ca bhūmi pratilambha vibhāvanā kuśalena ca bhūmi aṅga pariśodhana kuśalena ca bhūmeḥ bhūmi saṃkramaṇa kuśalena ca bhūmi bhūmi vyavasthāna kuśalena ca bhūmi bhūmi viśeṣa jñāna kuśalena ca bhūmi bhūmi pratilambha a pratyudāvartya kuśalena ca sarva bodhisattva bhūmi pariśodhana tayā tathāgata jñāna bhūmi ākramaṇa kuśalena ca bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, one should be skilled in the side of the stages and their antidotes, skilled in the dissolution and evolution of the stages, skilled in the outflow of the aspects of the stages, skilled in the realization and cultivation of the stages, skilled in purifying the factors of the stages, skilled in the transition from one stage to another, skilled in the arrangement of the stages, skilled in the knowledge of the distinctions between the stages, skilled in not turning back from the attainment of the stages, and skilled in conquering the stage of omniscience by fully purifying all the stages of the bodhisattvas.

original: evaṃ bhūmyākārābhinirhārakuśalasya hi bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvasya prathamāyā bodhisattvabhūmerucchalitasya niṣṭhānaṃ na saṃbhavati yāvaddaśabhūmibhūmyākramaṇamiti
analyzed: evam bhūmi ākāra abhinirhāra kuśalasya hi bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya prathamāyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ ucchalitasya niṣṭhānam na saṃbhavati yāvat daśa bhūmi bhūmi ākramaṇam iti
translated: Thus, O sons of the victors, for a bodhisattva who is skilled in accomplishing the aspects of the stages, it is impossible to reach the end, up to conquering the stage of the tenth stage, once he has risen to the first stage of the bodhisattva.

original: mārgādhiṣṭhānāgamena ca bhūmejñānālokena ca buddhajñānālokaṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: mārga adhiṣṭhāna āgamena ca bhūme jñāna ālokena ca buddha jñāna ālokam prāpnoti
translated: And by the light of the knowledge of the stages, which is based on the path, one attains the light of the knowledge of the buddhas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhavanto jinaputrāḥ kuśalaḥ sārthavāho mahāsārthaparikarṣaṇābhiprāyo mahānagaramanuprāpayitukāmaḥ ādāveva mārgaguṇāṃśca mārgavivartadoṣāṃśca mārgasthānāntaraviśeṣāṃśca mārgasthānāntaravivartadoṣāṃśca mārgakriyāpathyodanakāryatāṃ ca parimārgayati parigaveṣayate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ kuśalaḥ sārthavāhaḥ mahā sārtha parikarṣaṇa abhiprāyaḥ mahā nagaram anuprāpayitu kāmaḥ ādau eva mārga guṇān ca mārga vivarta doṣān ca mārga sthāna antara viśeṣān ca mārga sthāna antara vivarta doṣān ca mārga kriyā pathya odana kārya tām ca parimārgayati parigaveṣayate
translated: “Sirs, sons of the victors, it is like this: a skillful caravan leader who wishes to lead a great caravan to a great city first searches for and investigates the qualities of the road, the faults of detours on the road, the differences in the stages of the road, the faults of detours on the stages of the road, and the food, drink, and so on that are suitable for the journey.

original: sa yāvanmahānagarānuprāptaye kuśalo bhavatyanuccalita eva prathamānmārgāntarasthānāt /
analyzed: sa yāvat mahā nagara anuprāptaye kuśalaḥ bhavati an uccalitaḥ eva prathamāt mārga antara sthānāt
translated: Even before setting out from the first stage of the road, he becomes skilled in how to reach the great city.

original: sa evaṃ jñānavicāritayā buddhyā mahāpathyodanasamṛddhyā anupūrveṇa mahāsārthena sārdhaṃ yāvanmahānagaramanuprāpnoti /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna vicāritayā buddhyā mahā pathya odana samṛddhyā anupūrveṇa mahā sārthena sārdham yāvat mahā nagaram anuprāpnoti
translated: With a mind that has investigated with knowledge and with abundant provisions suitable for the journey, he gradually reaches the great city together with the great caravan.

original: na cāṭavīkāntāradoṣaiḥ sārthasya vā ātmano vāsyopaghātaḥ saṃpadyate /
analyzed: na ca aṭavī kāntāra doṣaiḥ sārthasya vā ātmanaḥ vā asya upaghātaḥ saṃpadyate
translated: And he and the caravan do not suffer any harm from the faults of the wilderness and the desert.

original: evameva bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvaḥ kuśalo mahāsārthavāho yadā prathamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ kuśalaḥ mahā sārthavāhaḥ yadā prathamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bhavati
translated: In the same way, sirs, sons of the victors, when a bodhisattva, a skillful great caravan leader, is established in the first bodhisattva stage,

analyzed: tadā bhūmi pakṣa pratipakṣa kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: Then one becomes skilled in the antidotes to the side of the stages.

analyzed: bhūmi saṃvarta vivarta kuśalaḥ bhavati  bhūmi ākāra nisyanda kuśalaḥ bhavati  bhūmi pratilambha vibhāvanā kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: One becomes skilled in the dissolution and evolution of the stages.🔽One becomes skilled in the outflow of the aspects of the stages.🔽One becomes skilled in the realization and cultivation of the stages.

analyzed: bhūmi aṅga pariśodhana kuśalaḥ bhavati  bhūmeḥ bhūmi saṃkramaṇa kuśalaḥ bhavati  bhūmi bhūmi vyavasthāna kuśalaḥ bhavati  bhūmi bhūmi viśeṣa jñāna kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: One becomes skilled in purifying the factors of the stages.🔽One becomes skilled in the transition from one stage to another.🔽One becomes skilled in the arrangement of the stages.

analyzed: bhūmi bhūmi pratilambha a pratyudāvarti akuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: One becomes skilled in the knowledge of the distinctions between the stages.🔽One becomes skilled in not turning back from the attainment of the stages.

analyzed: sarva bodhisattva bhūmi pariśodhana tayā tathāgata jñāna bhūmi ākramaṇa kuśalaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And by purifying all the bodhisattva stages, one becomes skilled in ascending to the stage of the wisdom of the Tathagatas.

original: tadā bodhisattvo mahāpuṇyasaṃbhārapathyodanasusaṃgṛhito jñānasaṃbhārasukṛtavicayo mahāsattvasārthaparikarṣaṇābhiprāyaḥ sarvajñatāmahānagaramanuprāpayitukāmaḥ ādāveva bhūmimārgaguṇāṃśca bhūmimārgavivartadoṣāṃśca bhūmimārgasthānāntaraviśeṣāṃśca bhūmimārgasthānāntaravivartadoṣāṃśca mahāpuṇyajñānasaṃbhārapathyadanakriyākāryatāṃ ca parimārgate parigaveṣate buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ kalyāṇamitrāṇāṃ ca sakāśāt /
analyzed: tadā bodhisattvaḥ mahā puṇya saṃbhāra pathya odana su saṃgṛhitaḥ jñāna saṃbhāra sukṛta vicayaḥ mahāsattva sārtha parikarṣaṇa abhiprāyaḥ sarvajña tā mahā nagaram anuprāpayitu kāmaḥ ādau eva bhūmi mārga guṇān ca bhūmi mārga vivarta doṣān ca bhūmi mārga sthāna antara viśeṣān ca bhūmi mārga sthāna antara vivarta doṣān ca mahā puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra pathya dana kriyā kārya tām ca parimārgate parigaveṣate buddhānām bhagavatām bodhisat
translated: Then, the Bodhisattva, well-nourished by the wholesome food of the great collection of merit, well-discriminating by the wholesome food of the great collection of knowledge, intending to lead the great caravan of beings, desiring to reach the great city of omniscience, at the very beginning seeks and investigates the qualities of the stages and paths, the faults of turning back from the stages and paths, the distinctions of the different stages and paths, the faults of turning back from the different stages and paths, and the function of the wholesome food of the great collection of merit and knowledge, from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the Bodhisattvas, and the spiritual friends.

analyzed: sa yāvat sarvajña tā mahā nagara anuprāpti kuśalaḥ bhavati an uccalitaḥ eva prathamāt mārga antara sthānāt
translated: He becomes skilled in reaching the great city of omniscience without moving from the first intermediate stage of the path.

original: sa evaṃ jñānavicāritayā buddhyā mahāpuṇyajñānasaṃbhārapathyadanasaṃruddhayā mahāntaṃ sattvasārthaṃ yathāparipācitaṃ saṃsārāṭavīkāntāradurgādatikramya yāvatsarvajñatāmahānagaramanuprāpayati /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna vicāritayā buddhyā mahā puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra pathi adana saṃruddhayā mahāntam sattva sārtham yathā paripācitam saṃsāra aṭavī kāntāra durgāt atikramya yāvat sarvajña tā mahā nagaram anuprāpayati
translated: With such a wisdom-investigated intellect, which is not obstructed by the wholesome food of the great collection of merit and wisdom, he leads the great caravan of beings, having matured them as much as possible, across the wilderness and desert of cyclic existence, and brings them to the great city of omniscience.

original: na saṃsāraṭavīkāntāradoṣaiḥ sattvasārthasya vā ātmano vā asyopaghātaḥ saṃpadyate /
analyzed: na saṃsāra ṭavī kāntāra doṣaiḥ sattva sārthasya vā ātmanaḥ vā asya upaghātaḥ saṃpadyate
translated: Neither the faults of the wilderness and desert of cyclic existence nor the caravan of beings nor he himself suffer any harm.

original: tasmāttarhi bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvena aparikhinnena bhūmiparikarmaparikarmaviśeṣābhiyuktena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvena a parikhinnena bhūmi parikarma parikarma viśeṣa abhiyuktena bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva should not become weary, but should be devoted to the special practices that purify the stages.

original: ayaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvasya prathamāyāḥ pramuditāyā bodhisattvabhūmermukhapraveśaḥ samāsato nirdiśyate //
analyzed: ayam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya prathamāyāḥ pramuditāyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ mukha praveśaḥ samāsatas nirdiśyate
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, this is the entrance to the first bodhisattva stage, the Joyful, of the bodhisattva, explained in brief.

original: yo'syāṃ pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo bhūyastvena jambūdvīpeśvaro bhavati mahaiśvaryādhipatyapratilabdho dharmānurakṣī kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvān mahātyāgena saṃgrahītukuśalaḥ sattvānāṃ mātsaryamalavinivṛttaye'paryanto mahātyāgārambhaiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ syām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyastvena jambūdvīpa īśvaraḥ bhavati mahā aiśvarya ādhipatya pratilabdhaḥ dharma anurakṣī kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvān mahā tyāgena saṃgrahītu kuśalaḥ sattvānām mātsarya mala vinivṛttaye paryantaḥ mahā tyāga ārambhaiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in this [bhumi] is usually the lord of Jambudvipa, having attained great lordship and sovereignty, he is skilled in protecting the Dharma, accomplished, and powerful. He is skilled in gathering beings through great generosity, in order to remove the stain of stinginess from beings, with limitless great acts of generosity.

original: yacca kiṃcitkarmārabhate dānena vā priyavadyatayā vā arthakriyayā vā samānārthatayā vā /
analyzed: yat ca kiṃcid karma ārabhate dānena vā priyavadya tayā vā arthakriyayā vā samāna artha tayā vā
translated: Whatever deeds he undertakes, whether through generosity, kind words, beneficial actions, or being of the same purpose,

analyzed: tat sarvam avirahitam buddha manasikāraiḥ dharma manasikāraiḥ saṃgha manasikāraiḥ bodhisattva manasikāraiḥ bodhisattva caryā manasikāraiḥ pāramitā manasikāraiḥ bhūmi manasikāraiḥ bala manasikāraiḥ vaiśāradya manasikāraiḥ āveṇika buddha dharma manasikāraiḥ yāvat sarva ākāra vara upeta sarvajña jñāna manasikaraiḥ
translated: all of that is done without separation from the mental attentions of the Buddha, the mental attentions of the Dharma, the mental attentions of the Sangha, the mental attentions of the bodhisattvas, the mental attentions of the conduct of the bodhisattvas, the mental attentions of the perfections, the mental attentions of the stages, the mental attentions of the powers, the mental attentions of the fearlessnesses, the mental attentions of the unique qualities of the Buddha, up to the mental attentions of the knowledge of all aspects and the supreme knowledge.

original: kimiti / sarvasattvānāmagryo bhaveyaṃ śreṣṭho jyeṣṭho varaḥ pravara uttamo'nuttamo nāyako vināyakaḥ pariṇāyako yāvatsarvajñajñānapratiśaraṇo bhaveyam iti /
analyzed: kim iti sarva sattvānām agryaḥ bhaveyam śreṣṭhaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ varaḥ pravaraḥ uttamaḥ nuttamaḥ nāyakaḥ vināyakaḥ pariṇāyakaḥ yāvat sarvajña jñāna pratiśaraṇaḥ bhaveyam iti
translated: Why? I will be the foremost, the best, the highest, the excellent, the sublime, the unsurpassed, the leader, the guide, the director, up to the one who has taken refuge in the knowledge of omniscience.

original: ākāṅkṣaṃśca tathārūpaṃ vīryamārabhate yathārūpeṇa vīryārambheṇa sarvagṛhakalatrabhogānutsṛjya tathāgataśāsane pravrajati /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan ca tathārūpam vīryam ārabhate yathārūpeṇa vīrya ārambheṇa sarva gṛha kalatra bhogān utsṛjya tathāgata śāsane pravrajati
translated: And desiring this, he undertakes such vigor that by such an undertaking of vigor, he abandons all householders, wives, and enjoyments and goes forth into the teaching of the Tathāgata.

original: pravrajitaśca san ekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena samādhiśataṃ ca pratilabhate samāpadyate ca /
analyzed: pravrajitaḥ ca san eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena samādhi śatam ca pratilabhate samāpadyate ca
translated: And having gone forth, in a single moment, a single instant, he attains and enters a hundred meditative absorptions.

analyzed: buddha śatam ca paśyati
translated: And he sees a hundred Buddhas.

analyzed: teṣām ca adhiṣṭhānam saṃjānīte
translated: And he recognizes their blessings.

analyzed: lokadhātu śatam ca kampayati  kṣetra śatam ca ākramati
translated: And he shakes a hundred world systems.🔽And he goes to a hundred Buddha-fields.

analyzed: lokadhātu śatam ca avabhāsayati
translated: And he illuminates a hundred world systems.

analyzed: sattva śatam ca paripācayati
translated: And he brings a hundred sentient beings to maturity.

analyzed: kalpa śatam ca tiṣṭhati
translated: And he remains for a hundred eons.

analyzed: kalpa śatam ca pūrva anta apara antataḥ praviśati
translated: And he enters into the past and future for a hundred eons.

analyzed: dharma mukha śatam ca pravicinoti
translated: And he analyzes a hundred Dharma doors.

analyzed: kāya śatam ca ādarśayati
translated: And he manifests a hundred bodies.

analyzed: kāyam kāyam ca bodhisattva śata parivāram ādarśayati
translated: He displays each body surrounded by a hundred bodhisattvas.

original: tathā uttare praṇidhānabalikā bodhisattvāḥ praṇidhānaviśeṣikatayā vikurvanti yeṣāṃ na sukarā saṃkhyā kurtuṃ kāyasya vā prabhāyā vā ṛdvervā cakṣuṣo vā gocarasya vā svarasya vā caryāyā vā vyūhasya vā adhiṣṭhānasya vā adhimuktervā abhisaṃskāraṇāṃ vā yāvadevatāvadbhirapi kalpakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrairiti pramuditā nāma prathamā bhūmiḥ //
analyzed: tathā uttare praṇidhāna balikāḥ bodhisattvāḥ praṇidhāna viśeṣika tayā vikurvanti yeṣām na sukarā saṃkhyā kurtum kāyasya vā prabhāyāḥ vā ṛdveḥ vā cakṣuṣaḥ vā gocarasya vā svarasya vā caryāyāḥ vā vyūhasya vā adhiṣṭhānasya vā adhimukteḥ vā abhisaṃskāraṇām vā yāvat devatāvadbhiḥ api kalpa koṭi niyuta śata sahasraiḥ iti pramuditā nāma prathamā bhūmiḥ
translated: Similarly, the bodhisattvas who have the power of higher vows, by the excellence of their vows, perform transformations for which it is not easy to state a number of bodies, light, miracles, eyes, spheres of action, voices, practices, arrays, consecrations, resolutions, or manifestations, even in hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of eons. Thus ends the first ground called The Joyful.

analyzed: vimalā nāma dvitīyā bhūmiḥ
translated: The second ground is called The Stainless.

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āhayo'yaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvaḥ prathamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau suparikarmakṛto dvitīyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimabhilaṣati /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yā uyam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ prathamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau su parikarma kṛtaḥ dvitīyām bodhisattva bhūmim abhilaṣati
translated: Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury said, Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, when this bodhisattva, who has been well-refined on the first bodhisattva ground, aspires to the second bodhisattva ground,

analyzed: tasya daśa citta āśayāḥ pravartante
translated: he has ten mental aspirations.

analyzed: katame daśa
translated: What are the ten?

original: yaduta ṛjvāśayatā ca mṛdvāśayatā ca karmaṇyāśayatā ca damāśayatā ca śamāśayatā ca kalyāṇāśayatā ca asaṃsṛṣṭāśayatā ca anapekṣāśayatā ca udārāśayatā ca māhātmyāśayatā ca /
analyzed: yat uta ṛju āśaya tā ca mṛdu āśaya tā ca karmaṇya āśaya tā ca dama āśaya tā ca śama āśaya tā ca kalyāṇa āśaya tā ca asaṃsṛṣṭa āśaya tā ca anapekṣa āśaya tā ca udāra āśaya tā ca māhātmya āśaya tā ca
translated: Namely, a straight intention, a gentle intention, a workable intention, a disciplined intention, a peaceful intention, a wholesome intention, an unadulterated intention, an independent intention, a vast intention, and a magnanimous intention.

analyzed: ime daśa citta āśayāḥ pravartante
translated: These ten mental intentions arise.

original: tato dvitīyāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau vimalāyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bhavati //
analyzed: tatas dvitīyāyām bodhisattva bhūmau vimalāyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: Then he is established in the second bodhisattva stage, the Stainless.

original: tatra bhavanto jinaputrā vimalāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattvaḥ prakṛtyaiva daśabhiḥ kuśalaiḥ karmapathaiḥ samanvāgato bhavati /
analyzed: tatra bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ vimalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ prakṛtyā eva daśabhiḥ kuśalaiḥ karma pathaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: There, O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who is established in the Stainless bodhisattva stage naturally becomes endowed with ten wholesome actions.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: With which ten?

analyzed: yat uta prāṇa atipātāt prativirataḥ bhavati
translated: Namely, he becomes one who abstains from killing.

original: nihatadaṇḍo nihataśastro nihatavairo lajjāvān dayāpannaḥ sarvaprāṇibhūteṣu hitasukhānukampī maitracittaḥ /
analyzed: nihata daṇḍaḥ nihata śastraḥ nihata vairaḥ lajjāvān dayā āpannaḥ sarva prāṇi bhūteṣu hita sukha anukampī maitra cittaḥ
translated: Having abandoned the rod and weapon, having abandoned conflict, having a sense of shame, having compassion, he is benevolent towards all living beings, having a mind of loving-kindness.

analyzed: sa saṃkalpaiḥ api prāṇi vihiṃsām na karoti
translated: Even with intentions, he does not harm living beings.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ para sattveṣu sattva saṃjñinaḥ saṃcintya audārika kāya viheṭhanayā
translated: How much less would he intentionally harm other beings, perceiving them as beings?

original: adattādānātprativirataḥ khalu punarbhavati svabhogasaṃtuṣṭaḥ parabhogānabhilāṣī anukampakaḥ /
analyzed: a datta ādānāt prativirataḥ khalu punar bhavati sva bhoga saṃtuṣṭaḥ para bhoga an abhilāṣī anukampakaḥ
translated: He is one who abstains from taking what is not given, being content with his own wealth and not desiring the wealth of others, compassionate,

original: sa paraparigṛhītebhyo vastubhyaḥ paraparigṛhītasaṃjñī steyacittamupasthāpya antaśastṛṇaparṇamapi nādattamādātā bhavati /
analyzed: sa para parigṛhītebhyaḥ vastubhyaḥ para parigṛhīta saṃjñī steya cittam upasthāpya antaśas tṛṇa parṇam api na a dattam ādātā bhavati
translated: and even if he sees a piece of wood or a leaf floating in the water, he does not take it, thinking it might belong to someone else.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ anyebhyaḥ jīvita upakaraṇebhyaḥ
translated: How much less would he take the wealth of others?

original: kāmamithyācārātprativirataḥ khalu punarbhavati svadārasaṃtuṣṭaḥ paradārānabhilāṣī /🔽sa paraparigṛhītāsu strīṣu parabhāryāsu gotradhvajadharmarakṣitāsu abhidhyāmapi notpādayati /
analyzed: kāma mithyā ācārāt prativirataḥ khalu punar bhavati sva dāra saṃtuṣṭaḥ para dāra anabhilāṣī  sa para parigṛhītāsu strīṣu para bhāryāsu gotra dhvaja dharma rakṣitāsu abhidhyām api na utpādayati
translated: He is one who abstains from sexual misconduct, being content with his own wife and not desiring the wives of others.🔽He does not even arouse thoughts of lust towards women who are protected by their family, protected by their religion, or protected by their ornaments.

original: kaḥ punarvādo dvīndriyasamāpatyā vā anaṅgavijñaptyā vā //
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ dvi indriya samāpatyā vā anaṅga vijñaptyā vā
translated: How much less would he engage in sexual intercourse with them?

original: anṛtavacanātprativirataḥ khalu punarbhavati satyavādī bhūtavādī kālavādī /
analyzed: anṛta vacanāt prativirataḥ khalu punar bhavati satya vādī bhūta vādī kāla vādī
translated: He is one who abstains from false speech, being truthful, speaking the truth, speaking at the right time,

analyzed: yathāvādī tathākārī
translated: and acting in accordance with his words.

original: so'ntaśaḥ svapnāntaragato'pi vinidhāya dṛṣṭiṃ kṣāntiṃ ruciṃ matiṃ prekṣāṃ visaṃvādanābhiprāyo nānṛtāṃ vācaṃ niścārayati /
analyzed: saḥ untaśas svapna antara gataḥ api vinidhāya dṛṣṭim kṣāntim rucim matim prekṣām visaṃvādana abhiprāyaḥ na anṛtām vācam niścārayati
translated: Even if he is in a dream, he does not utter false speech with the intention of deceiving, having turned away from sight, patience, desire, thought, and view.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ samanvāhṛtya
translated: How much less so after careful consideration.

original: piśunavacanātprativirataḥ khalu punarbhavati abhedāviheṭhāpratipannaḥ sattvānām /🔽sa netaḥ śrutvā amutrākhyātā bhavatyamīṣāṃ bhedāya /
analyzed: piśuna vacanāt prativirataḥ khalu punar bhavati abheda a viheṭhā pratipannaḥ sattvānām  sa na itas śrutvā amutra ākhyātā bhavati amīṣām bhedāya
translated: He is one who abstains from slander, not engaging in divisive speech towards beings.🔽Having heard here, he does not repeat it there to divide them.

original: na amutaḥ śrutvā ihākhyātā bhavatyeṣāṃ bhedāya /
analyzed: na amutas śrutvā iha ākhyātā bhavati eṣām bhedāya
translated: Having heard there, he does not repeat it here to divide them.

analyzed: na saṃhitān bhinatti
translated: He does not divide those who are united.

original: na bhinnānāmanupradānaṃ karoti /🔽na vyagrārāmo bhavati na vyagrarato na vyagrakaraṇīṃ vācaṃ bhāṣate sadbhūtāmasadbhūtāṃ vā //
analyzed: na bhinnānām anupradānam karoti  na vyagra ārāmaḥ bhavati na vyagra rataḥ na vyagra karaṇīm vācam bhāṣate sat bhūtām a sat bhūtām vā
translated: He does not praise those who are divided.🔽He does not delight in disunity, does not rejoice in disunity, and does not speak words that create disunity, whether true or false.

analyzed: paruṣa vacanāt prativirataḥ khalu punar bhavati
translated: He is one who abstains from harsh speech.

original: sa yeyaṃ vāgadeśā karkaśā parakaṭukā parābhisaṃjananī anvakṣānvakṣaprāgbhārā grāmyā pārthagjanakī anelā akarṇasukhā krodharoṣaniścāritā hṛdayaparidahanī manaḥsaṃtāpakarī apriyā amanaāpā amanojñā svasaṃtānaparasaṃtānavināśinī /
analyzed: sa yā iyam vāc adeśā karkaśā para kaṭukā para abhisaṃjananī anvakṣa anvakṣa prāgbhārā grāmyā pārthagjanakī anelā akarṇa sukhā krodha roṣa niścāritā hṛdaya paridahanī manaḥ saṃtāpa karī apriyā amanaāpā amanojñā sva saṃtāna para saṃtāna vināśinī
translated: That speech which is harsh, offensive, hurtful to others, contemptuous, arrogant, worldly, vulgar, unpleasant to the ear, unappealing, arising from anger and rage, burning the heart, tormenting the mind, disagreeable, unlovable, unpleasant, destructive to one's own continuum and others' continuums,

original: tathārūpāṃ vācaṃ prahāya yeyaṃ vāk snigdhā mṛdvī manojñā madhurā priyakaraṇī manaāpakaraṇī hitakaraṇī nelā karṇasukhā hṛdayaṃgamā premaṇīyā paurī varṇavispaṣṭā vijñeyā śravaṇīyā niśritā bahujaneṣṭā bahujanakāntā bahujanapriyā bahujanamanaāpā vijñāpannā sarvasattvahitasukhāvahā samāhitā manautplāvanakarī manaḥprahlādanakarī svasaṃtānaparasaṃtānaprasādanakarī tathārūpāṃ vācaṃ niścārayati //
analyzed: tathārūpām vācam prahāya yā iyam vāc snigdhā mṛdvī manojñā madhurā priya karaṇī manaāpa karaṇī hita karaṇī nelā karṇa sukhā hṛdayaṃgamā premaṇīyā paurī varṇa vispaṣṭā vijñeyā śravaṇīyā niśritā bahu jana iṣṭā bahu jana kāntā bahu jana priyā bahu jana manaāpā vijñāpannā sarva sattva hita sukha āvahā samāhitā manaḥ utplāvana karī manaḥ prahlādana karī sva saṃtāna para saṃtāna prasādana karī tathārūpām vācam niścārayat
translated: having abandoned such speech, he utters speech that is smooth, gentle, pleasing, sweet, endearing, delightful, beneficial, not coarse, pleasant to the ear, endearing to the heart, lovable, urban, clear in syllables, understandable, audible, based, loved by many people, pleasing to many people, dear to many people, delightful to many people, understood by the wise, bringing benefit and happiness to all beings, concentrated, causing mental exaltation, gladdening the mind, purifying one's own continuum and others' continuums, he utters such speech.

original: saṃbhinnapralāpātprativirataḥ khalu punarbhavati suparihāryavacanaḥ kālavādī bhūtavādī arthavādī dharmavādī nyāyavādī vinayavādī /
analyzed: saṃbhinna pralāpāt prativirataḥ khalu punar bhavati su parihārya vacanaḥ kāla vādī bhūta vādī artha vādī dharma vādī nyāya vādī vinaya vādī
translated: He is one who abstains from frivolous speech, speaking words that are worth keeping, timely, true, beneficial, and endowed with good meaning.

original: sa nidānavatīṃ vācaṃ bhāṣate kālena sāvadānam /
analyzed: sa nidānavatīm vācam bhāṣate kālena sa avadānam
translated: He speaks words that are meaningful, timely, and beneficial.

original: sa cāntaśa itihāsapūrvakamapi vacanaṃ parihārya pariharati /🔽kaḥ punarvādo vāgvikṣepeṇa //
analyzed: sa ca antaśas itihāsa pūrvakam api vacanam parihārya pariharati  kaḥ punar vādaḥ vāc vikṣepeṇa
translated: He even avoids stories from the past, let alone frivolous speech.

original: anabhidhyāluḥ khalu punarbhavati parasveṣu parakāmeṣu parabhogeṣu paravittopakaraṇeṣu /
analyzed: an abhidhyāluḥ khalu punar bhavati para sveṣu para kāmeṣu para bhogeṣu para vitta upakaraṇeṣu
translated: He is not covetous of the possessions, desires, enjoyments, wealth, or means of others.

original: paraparigṛhīteṣu spṛhāmapi notpādayati /🔽kimiti yatpareṣāṃ tannāma syāditi nābhidhyāmutpādayati /
analyzed: para parigṛhīteṣu spṛhām api na utpādayati  kim iti yat pareṣām tat nāma syāt iti na abhidhyām utpādayati
translated: He does not even arouse a desire for what belongs to others.

analyzed: na prārthayate na praṇidadhāti
translated: He does not arouse covetousness, thinking, “If only they would give it to me!” He does not wish for it or aspire to it.

analyzed: na lobha cittam utpādayati
translated: He does not arouse a greedy mind.

analyzed: a vyāpanna cittaḥ khalu punar bhavati
translated: He is one who has a mind free of ill will.

original: sarvasattveṣu maitracitto hitacitto dayācittaḥ sukhacittaḥ snigdhacittaḥ sarvajagadanugrahacittaḥ sarvabhūtahitānukampācittaḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattveṣu maitra cittaḥ hita cittaḥ dayā cittaḥ sukha cittaḥ snigdha cittaḥ sarva jagat anugraha cittaḥ sarva bhūta hita anukampā cittaḥ
translated: He has a mind of loving kindness, a mind of benefit, a mind of compassion, a mind of happiness, a mind of affection, a mind of kindness, and a mind of sympathy for all beings.

original: sa yānīmāni krodhopanāhakhilamalavyāpādaparidāhasaṃdhukṣitapratighādyāni tāni prahāya yānīmāni hitopasaṃhitāni maitryupasaṃhitāni sarvasattvahitasukhāya
analyzed: sa yāni imāni krodha upanāha khila mala vyāpāda paridāha saṃdhukṣita pratigha ādyāni tāni prahāya yāni imāni hita upasaṃhitāni maitrī upasaṃhitāni sarva sattva hita sukhāya
translated: He abandons these things such as anger, resentment, spite, malice, burning anger, and the like, and having abandoned them, he reflects on these things that are beneficial, connected with friendliness, for the benefit and happiness of all beings.

analyzed: tāni anuvitarkayitā bhavati
translated: He becomes one who reflects on these.

analyzed: samyak dṛṣṭiḥ khalu punar bhavati samyakpatha gataḥ kautukamaṅgala nānā prakāra kuśīla dṛṣṭi vigata ṛju dṛṣṭiḥ aśaṭhaḥ māyāvī buddha dharma saṃgha niyata āśayaḥ
translated: Moreover, he becomes one of right view, one who has gone on the right path, free from the various kinds of wrong views such as curiosity and auspiciousness, one of upright view, one who is not deceitful, not crafty, one whose intention is fixed on the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: sa imān daśa kuśalān karmapathān satatasamitamanurakṣan evaṃ cittāśayamabhinirharati yā kācitsattvānāmapāyadurgativinipātaprajñaptiḥ sarvā sā eṣāṃ daśānāmakuśalānāṃ karmapathānāṃ samādānahetoḥ /
analyzed: saḥ imān daśa kuśalān karma pathān satata samitam anurakṣan evam citta āśayam abhinirharati yā kācid sattvānām apāya durgati vinipāta prajñaptiḥ sarvā sā eṣām daśānām akuśalānām karma pathānām samādāna hetoḥ
translated: He, always and constantly guarding these ten paths of wholesome action, manifests this kind of intention and resolve: Whatever is designated as the lower realms, bad destinies, and falling into misfortune for beings, all that is due to undertaking these ten unwholesome paths of action.

original: hanta ahamātmanaiva samyakpratipattisthitaḥ parān samyakpratipattau sthāpayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: hanta aham ātmanā eva samyak pratipatti sthitaḥ parān samyak pratipattau sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: Well then, I myself, abiding in right practice, will establish others in right practice.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: asthānametadanavakāśo yadātmā vipratipattisthitaḥ parān samyakpratipattau sthāpayet /
analyzed: asthānam etat anavakāśaḥ yat ātmā vipratipatti sthitaḥ parān samyak pratipattau sthāpayet
translated: It is impossible and cannot happen that one who is established in wrong practice can establish others in right practice.

analyzed: na etad sthānam vidyate iti
translated: This is not possible.

original: sa evaṃ pravicinoti eṣāṃ daśānāṃ akuśalānāṃ karmapathānāṃ samādānahetornirayatiryagyoniyamalokagatayaḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: saḥ evam pravicinoti eṣām daśānām akuśalānām karma pathānām samādāna hetoḥ niraya tiryagyoni yama loka gatayaḥ prajñāyante
translated: He examines thus: Due to undertaking these ten unwholesome courses of action, the destinies of hell, animal realm, and the world of Yama are known.

original: punaḥ kuśalānāṃ karmapathānāṃ samādānahetormanuṣyopapattimādiṃ kṛtvā yāvadbhavāgramityupapattayaḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: punar kuśalānām karma pathānām samādāna hetoḥ manuṣya upapattim ādim kṛtvā yāvat bhava agram iti upapattayaḥ prajñāyante
translated: Again, due to undertaking the wholesome courses of action, starting with human rebirth up to the peak of existence, rebirths are known.

original: tata uttaṃra ta eva daśa kuśalāḥ karmapathāṃ prajñākāreṇa paribhāvyamānāḥ prādeśikacittatayā traidhātukottrastamānasatayā mahākaruṇāvikalatayā parataḥ śravaṇānugamena ghoṣānugamena ca śrāvakayānaṃ saṃvartayanti /
analyzed: tatas te eva daśa kuśalāḥ karma pathām prajñākāreṇa paribhāvyamānāḥ prādeśika citta tayā traidhātuka uttrasta mānasa tayā mahā karuṇā vikala tayā paratas śravaṇa anugamena ghoṣa anugamena ca śrāvaka yānam saṃvartayanti
translated: Beyond that, those very ten wholesome courses of action, when contemplated with the aspect of wisdom, due to the mind being limited, due to the mind being frightened by the three realms, due to being incomplete in great compassion, due to following what is heard from others, and due to following mere sound, they lead to the Śrāvaka Vehicle.
