analyzed: evam pariśeṣāṇām
translated: Similarly for the rest.

original: sa evaṃ dvādaśākāraṃ pratītyasamutpādaṃ pratyavekṣate'nulomapratilomaṃ yaduta bhavāṅgānusaṃdhitaśca ekacittasamavasaraṇataśca svakarmāsaṃbhedataśca avinirbhāgataśca trivartmānuvartanataśca pūrvāntapratyutpannāparāntāvekṣaṇataśca triduḥkhatāsamudayataśca hetupratyayaprabhavataśca utpādavyayavinibandhanataśca abhāvākṣayatāpratyavekṣaṇataśca //
analyzed: saḥ evam dvādaśa ākāram pratītyasamutpādam pratyavekṣate inuloma pratilomam yat uta bhava aṅga anusaṃdhitaḥ ca eka citta samavasaraṇataḥ ca sva karma a saṃbhedataḥ ca avinirbhāgataḥ ca tri vartma anuvartanataḥ ca pūrva anta pratyutpanna apara anta avekṣaṇataḥ ca tri duḥkha tā samudayataḥ ca hetu pratyaya prabhavataḥ ca utpāda vyaya vinibandhanataḥ ca abhāva akṣaya tā pratyavekṣaṇataḥ ca
translated: He thus examines dependent origination in twelve aspects, both in the forward and reverse orders, namely: by connecting the links of existence, by subsuming them in a single mind, by the inseparability of one's own karma, by the absence of a separate agent, by following the three times, by observing the past, present and future, by the origin of the three kinds of suffering, by the cause and conditions, by the connection of arising and decay, and by examining the imperishability of non-existence.

original: tasyaivaṃ dvādaśākāraṃ pratītyasamutpādaṃ pratyavekṣamāṇasya nirātmato niḥsattvato nirjīvato niṣpudgalataḥ kārakavedakarahitato'svāmikato hetupratyayādhīnataḥ svabhāvaśūnyato viviktato'svabhāvataśca prakṛtyā pratyavekṣamāṇasya śūnyatāvimokṣamukhamājātaṃ bhavati //🔽tasyaivaṃ bhavāṅgānāṃ svabhāvanirodhātyantavimokṣapratyupasthānato na kiṃciddharmanimittamutpadyate /
analyzed: tasya evam dvādaśa ākāram pratītyasamutpādam pratyavekṣamāṇasya nirātmataḥ niḥsattvataḥ nirjīvataḥ niṣpudgalataḥ kāraka vedaka rahitataḥ svāmikataḥ hetu pratyaya adhīnataḥ svabhāva śūnyataḥ viviktataḥ svabhāvataḥ ca prakṛtyā pratyavekṣamāṇasya śūnyatā vimokṣa mukham ājātam bhavati  tasya evam bhava aṅgānām svabhāva nirodha atyanta vimokṣa pratyupasthānataḥ na kiṃcid dharma nimittam utpadyate
translated: For him, contemplating thus the cessation of the nature of the members of existence, the door of liberation of wishlessness arises, because of the nearness of complete liberation.

original: ato'sya ānimittavimokṣamukhamājātaṃ bhavati //🔽tasyaivaṃ śūnyatānimittamavatīrṇasya na kaścidabhilāṣa utpadyate anyatra mahākaruṇāpūrvakātsattvaparipācanāt /🔽evamasya apraṇihitavimokṣamukhamājātaṃ bhavati //
analyzed: atas asya ā nimitta vimokṣa mukham ājātam bhavati 🔽tasya evam śūnyatā nimittam avatīrṇasya na kaścid abhilāṣaḥ utpadyate anyatra mahā karuṇā pūrvakāt sattva paripācanāt 🔽evam asya apraṇihita vimokṣa mukham ājātam bhavati
translated: For him, contemplating thus the cessation of the nature of the members of existence, the door of liberation of wishlessness arises, because of the nearness of complete liberation.🔽For him, contemplating thus the cessation of the nature of the members of existence, the door of liberation of wishlessness arises, because of the nearness of complete liberation.🔽For him, contemplating thus the cessation of the nature of the members of existence, the door of liberation of wishlessness arises, because of the nearness of complete liberation.🔽For him, contemplating thus the cessation of the nature of the members of existence, the door of liberation of wishlessness arises, because of the nearness of complete liberation.🔽For him, contemplating thus the cessation of the nature of the members of existence, the door of liberation of wishlessness arises, because of the nearness of complete liberation.

original: ya imāni trīṇi vimokṣamukhāni bhāvayan ātmaparasaṃjñāpagato kārakavedakasaṃjñāpagato bhāvābhāvasaṃjñāpagato bhūyasyā mātrayā mahākaruṇāpuraskṛtaḥ prayujyate'pariniṣpannānāṃ bodhyaṅgānāṃ pariniṣpattaye /
analyzed: yaḥ imāni trīṇi vimokṣa mukhāni bhāvayan ātma para saṃjñā apagataḥ kāraka vedaka saṃjñā apagataḥ bhāva abhāva saṃjñā apagataḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā mahā karuṇā puraskṛtaḥ prayujyate pariniṣpannānām bodhyaṅgānām pariniṣpattaye
translated: One who cultivates these three doors of liberation, free from the notions of self and others, free from the notions of agent and experiencer, free from the notions of existence and non-existence, even more strongly, preceded by great compassion, strives for the accomplishment of the unaccomplished factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: tasya evam bhavati saṃyogāt saṃskṛtam pravartate
translated: He thinks thus: The conditioned arises from conjunction.

analyzed: visaṃyogāt na pravartate
translated: It does not arise from disjunction.

analyzed: sāmagryā saṃskṛtam pravartate
translated: The conditioned arises from assemblage.

analyzed: visāmagryā na pravartate
translated: It does not arise from non-assemblage.

original: hanta vayamevaṃ bahudoṣaduṣṭaṃ saṃskṛtaṃ viditvā asya saṃyogasya asyāḥ sāmagryā vyavacchedaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: hanta vayam evam bahu doṣa duṣṭam saṃskṛtam viditvā asya saṃyogasya asyāḥ sāmagryāḥ vyavacchedam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Well then, having known the conditioned to be thus afflicted with many faults, we will make a separation from this conjunction, from this assemblage.

analyzed: na ca atyanta upaśamam sarva saṃskārāṇām avirāgayiṣyāmaḥ sattva paripācana tāyai
translated: And we will not cause the complete cessation of all formations, in order to ripen beings.

original: evamasya bhavanto jinaputrāḥ saṃskāragataṃ bahudoṣaduṣṭaṃ svabhāvarahitamanutpannāniruddhaṃ prakṛtyā pratyavekṣamāṇasya mahākaruṇābhinirhārataśca sattvakāryānutsargataśca saṅgajñānābhimukho nāma prajñāpāramitāvihāro'bhimukhībhavatyavabhāsayogena /
analyzed: evam asya bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ saṃskāra gatam bahu doṣa duṣṭam svabhāva rahitam anutpanna aniruddham prakṛtyā pratyavekṣamāṇasya mahā karuṇā abhinirhārataḥ ca sattva kārya anutsargataḥ ca saṅga jñāna abhimukhaḥ nāma prajñāpāramitā vihāra ubhimukhībhavati avabhāsa yogena
translated: Thus, my friends, sons of the Victorious Ones, for him who contemplates the flow of conditioned things as full of many faults, devoid of intrinsic nature, unborn and unceasing, by nature, and who does not abandon the welfare of beings out of the accomplishment of great compassion, the abode of the perfection of wisdom called facing the knowledge of non-attachment becomes manifest to him through the yoga of illumination.

original: sa evaṃ jñānasamanvāgataḥ prajñāpāramitāvihārāvabhāsito bodhyaṅgāhārakāṃśca pratyayānupasaṃharati /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna samanvāgataḥ prajñāpāramitā vihāra avabhāsitaḥ bodhyaṅga āhārakān ca pratyayān upasaṃharati
translated: Endowed with such knowledge, illuminated by the abode of the perfection of wisdom, he gathers the conditions that nourish the factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: na ca saṃskṛta saṃvāsena saṃvasati
translated: But he does not dwell in association with conditioned things.

analyzed: svabhāva upaśamam ca saṃskārāṇām pratyavekṣate
translated: He contemplates the natural peace of conditioned things.

analyzed: na ca tatra avatiṣṭhate bodhyaṅga a parityakta tvāt
translated: But he does not abide in that, because he does not abandon the factors of enlightenment.

original: tasya asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya avatāraśūnyatā ca nāma samādhirājāyate /
analyzed: tasya asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya avatāra śūnyatā ca nāma samādhiḥ ājāyate
translated: For the bodhisattva who abides in this Abhimukhi bodhisattva stage, the samadhi called emptiness of non-entry arises.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatā / / /paramārthaśūnyatā / / /paramaśūnyatā / / /mahāśūnyatā / / /saṃprayogaśūnyatā / / /abhinirhāraśūnyatā yathāvadavikalpaśūnyatā sāpekṣaśūnyatā vinirbhāgāvinirbhāgaśūnyatā nāma samādhirājāyate /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā paramārtha śūnyatā paramaśūnyatā mahāśūnyatā saṃprayoga śūnyatā abhinirhāra śūnyatā yathāvat avikalpa śūnyatā sāpekṣa śūnyatā vinirbhāga avinirbhāga śūnyatā nāma samādhiḥ ājāyate
translated: The emptiness of inherent nature, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the supreme, the emptiness of the great, the emptiness of association, the emptiness of accomplishment, the emptiness of the way things are, the emptiness of dependence, the emptiness of the indivisibility of the divided and the undivided—these are the names of the samādhi kings.

analyzed: tasya evaṃpramukhāni daśa śūnyatā samādhi mukha śata sahasrāṇi āmukhībhavanti
translated: For him, these and other such hundreds of thousands of gateways to the emptiness samādhi become manifest.

analyzed: evam a nimitta samādhi mukha śata śahasrāṇi apraṇihita samādhi mukha śata sahasrāṇi āmukhībhavanti
translated: In the same way, hundreds of thousands of gateways to the signless samādhi and hundreds of thousands of gateways to the wishless samādhi become manifest.

original: tasya bhūyasyā mātrayā asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasyabhedyāśayatā ca paripūryate /
analyzed: tasya bhūyasyā mātrayā asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya ca paripūryate
translated: For the bodhisattva who is thus established in this Abhimukhī bodhisattva bhūmi, the intention of indestructibility is fulfilled to an even greater extent.

analyzed: niyata āśaya tā kalyāṇa āśaya tā gambhīra āśaya tā a pratyudāvartya āśaya tā a pratiprastrabdha āśaya tā vimala āśaya tā ananta āśaya tā jñāna abhilāṣa āśaya tā upāya prajñā saṃprayoga āśaya tā ca paripūryate
translated: He perfects the intention that is determined, the intention that is virtuous, the intention that is profound, the intention that is irreversible, the intention that is unswerving, the intention that is pure, the intention that is infinite, the intention that is desirous of knowledge, and the intention that is the union of means and wisdom.

original: tasyaite daśa bodhisattvāśayāḥ svanugatā bhavanti tathāgatabodhau /
analyzed: tasya ete daśa bodhisattva āśayāḥ su anugatāḥ bhavanti tathāgata bodhau
translated: These ten bodhisattva intentions follow him as he goes to the enlightenment of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: a pratyudāvartanīya vīryaḥ ca bhavati sarva para pravādibhiḥ
translated: He has irreversible perseverance, and cannot be defeated by any opponent.

analyzed: samavasṛtaḥ ca bhavati jñāna bhūmau
translated: He is in accord with the stage of knowledge.

analyzed: vinivṛttaḥ ca bhavati śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmibhyaḥ
translated: He has turned away from the stages of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: ekāntikaḥ ca bhavati buddha jñāna abhimukha tāyām
translated: He is one-pointed in his devotion to the knowledge of the buddhas.

analyzed: asaṃhāryaḥ ca bhavati sarva māra kleśa samudācāraiḥ
translated: He cannot be swayed by any of the activities of Māra or the afflictions.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhitaḥ ca bhavati bodhisattva jñāna āloka tāyām
translated: He is well-established in the light of the knowledge of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: su paribhāvitaḥ ca bhavati śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita dharma samudācāraiḥ
translated: He is well-cultivated in the practices of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

analyzed: saṃprayuktaḥ ca bhavati upāya prajñā vicāraiḥ
translated: He is endowed with the considerations of means and wisdom.

analyzed: vyavakīrṇaḥ ca bhavati bodhi pākṣika dharma abhinirhāraiḥ
translated: And he is mixed with the accomplishments of the factors of awakening.

original: tasya asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya prajñāpāramitāvihāro'tiriktatara ājāto bhavati /
analyzed: tasya asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya prajñāpāramitā vihāra utiriktataraḥ ājātaḥ bhavati
translated: For him, while dwelling in this Abhimukhī bodhisattva stage, the abode of the perfection of wisdom becomes even more abundant.

original: tīkṣṇā cānulomikī tṛtīyā kṣāntireṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ yathāvadanulomatayā na vilomatayā //
analyzed: tīkṣṇā ca ānulomikī tṛtīyā kṣāntiḥ eṣām dharmāṇām yathāvat anuloma tayā na viloma tayā
translated: And their sharp and favorable third acceptance of these dharmas arises in accordance with reality, not in contradiction with reality.

original: tasya asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya yathāvatsamāpattiprajñājñānālokatayā prayujyate /
analyzed: tasya asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya yathāvat samāpatti prajñā jñāna āloka tayā prayujyate
translated: For him, the bodhisattva dwelling in this Abhimukhī bodhisattva stage, engages through the light of wisdom born from proper meditative absorption.

analyzed: pratipattitaḥ ca ādhārayati
translated: And he upholds it through practice.

analyzed: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā tathāgata dharma kośa prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes one who has attained the treasure of the Tathāgata's Dharma.

original: tasya asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya anekān kalpāṃstāni kuśalamūlāni bhūyasyā mātrayā uttaptaprabhāsvaratarāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya anekān kalpān tāni kuśala mūlāni bhūyasyā mātrayā uttapta prabhāsvaratarāṇi bhavanti
translated: For him, the bodhisattva dwelling in this Abhimukhī bodhisattva stage, for many eons those wholesome roots become even more refined and radiant.

analyzed: anekāni kalpa śatāni
translated: For many hundreds of eons...

analyzed: tāni kuśala mūlāni bhūyasyā mātrayā uttapta prabhāsvaratarāṇi bhavanti
translated: Those wholesome roots become even more refined and radiant.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhavanto jinaputrāstadeva jātarūpaṃ vaiḍūryaparisṛṣṭaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayottaptaprabhāsvarataraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ tat eva jātarūpam vaiḍūrya parisṛṣṭam bhūyasyā mātrayā uttapta prabhāsvarataram bhavati
translated: “So it is, Venerable Blessed One. So it is, Venerable Sugata. Just as that gold from the Jambū River, when embellished with lapis lazuli, becomes even more radiant and resplendent,

original: evameva bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvasya asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya tāni kuśalamūlānyupāyaprajñājñānavicāritāni bhūyasyā mātrayottaptaprabhāsvaratarāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: evam eva bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya tāni kuśala mūlāni upāya prajñā jñāna vicāritāni bhūyasyā mātrayā uttapta prabhāsvaratarāṇi bhavanti
translated: in the same way, Venerable Blessed One, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi called Perfect Joy become even more radiant and resplendent through being refined by skillful means, wisdom, and knowledge,

analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas ca praśama asaṃhārya tām gacchanti
translated: and they become more and more difficult to surpass.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhavanto jinaputrāścandrābhā sattvāśrayāṃśca prahlādayati asaṃhāryā ca bhavati catasṛbhirvātamaṇḍalībhiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ candra ābhā sattva āśrayān ca prahlādayati asaṃhāryā ca bhavati catasṛbhiḥ vātamaṇḍalībhiḥ
translated: “So it is, Venerable Blessed One. So it is, Venerable Sugata. Just as the light of the moon delights the bodies of sentient beings and cannot be overcome by the four wind-mâra-forces,

original: evameva bhavanto jinaputra bodhisattvasya asyāmabhimukhyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya tāni kuśalamūlānyanekeṣāṃ sattvakoṭinayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ kleśajvālāḥ praśamayanti /
analyzed: evam eva bhavantaḥ jinaputra bodhisattvasya asyām abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya tāni kuśala mūlāni anekeṣām sattva koṭi nayuta śata sahasrāṇām kleśa jvālāḥ praśamayanti
translated: in the same way, Venerable Blessed One, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi called Perfect Joy pacify the flames of the mental afflictions of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of sentient beings,

analyzed: prahlādayanti
translated: and they delight them.

analyzed: asaṃhāryāṇi ca bhavanti caturbhiḥ mārāvacaraiḥ
translated: And they are not to be taken away by the four kinds of Maras.

original: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati
translated: For him, among the ten perfections, the perfection of wisdom becomes the most outstanding.

original: na ca pariśeṣā na samudāgacchati yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: na ca pariśeṣā na samudāgacchati yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: And the rest are not accomplished, but to the best of his ability and as much as he can.

original: iyaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvasya abhimukhī nāma ṣaṣṭhī bodhisattvabhūmiḥ samāsanirdeśataḥ /
analyzed: iyam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya abhimukhī nāma ṣaṣṭhī bodhisattva bhūmiḥ samāsa nirdeśataḥ
translated: This, Venerable Ones, is the sixth Bodhisattva stage, called the Facing, of the Bodhisattvas, taught in brief.

original: yasyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo bhūyastvena sunirmito bhavati devarājaṃ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānāmabhimānapratiprasrabdhaye kuśalaḥ sattvānyābhimānikadharmebhyo vinivartayitum /
analyzed: yasyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyastvena su nirmitaḥ bhavati devarājam kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānām abhimāna pratiprasrabdhaye kuśalaḥ sattva anya ābhimānika dharmebhyaḥ vinivartayitum
translated: Established in which, the Bodhisattva is for the most part the god king Sunirmāṇarati, skilled in causing beings to abandon conceit, skilled in turning beings away from dharmas of conceit.

original: asaṃhāryaśca bhavati sarvaśrāvakaparipṛcchāyāṃ kuśalaḥ sattvān pratītyasamutpāde'vatārayitum /
analyzed: asaṃhāryaḥ ca bhavati sarva śrāvaka paripṛcchāyām kuśalaḥ sattvān pratītyasamutpādā iva tārayitum
translated: And he is not to be taken away by all the questions of the Shravakas, skilled in introducing beings into dependent origination.

analyzed: yat ca kiṃcid  abhimukhī nāma ṣaṣṭī bhūmiḥ
translated: And whatever is...🔽The sixth stage is called the Facing.

analyzed: duraṃgamā nāma saptamī bhūmiḥ
translated: The seventh stage is called the Far-Going.

original: vajragarbha āha yo'yaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvaḥ ṣaṣṭyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau suparipūrṇabodhisattvamārgaḥ saptamīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimākramati /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ āha yaḥ yam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ ṣaṣṭyām bodhisattva bhūmau su paripūrṇa bodhisattva mārgaḥ saptamīm bodhisattva bhūmim ākramati
translated: Vajragarbha said, “Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, when a bodhisattva on the sixth bodhisattva ground has fully completed the bodhisattva path, he enters the seventh bodhisattva ground.

analyzed: sa daśabhiḥ upāya prajñā jñāna abhinirhṛtaiḥ mārga antara ārambha viśeṣaiḥ ākramati
translated: He enters it through ten distinctive aspects of beginning a new path, which are accomplished through skillful means, wisdom, and knowledge.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: What are the ten?

analyzed: yat uta śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita samādhi su paribhāvita mānasaḥ ca bhavati
translated: Namely, he has a mind that is well cultivated in the samādhis of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

analyzed: mahā puṇya jñāna sambhāra upacayam ca saṃbibharti
translated: He accumulates the collections of great merit and wisdom.

analyzed: nairātmya niḥsattva nirjīva niṣpudgala tām ca sarva dharmāṇām avatarati
translated: He penetrates the selflessness, non-sentience, non-living being, and non-personhood of all phenomena.

analyzed: catur apramāṇa abhinirhāram ca na utsṛjati
translated: He does not abandon the accomplishment of the four immeasurables.

analyzed: puṇya dharma ucchraya pāramitā abhisaṃskāram ca abhisaṃskaroti
translated: He performs the perfections of increasing merit and virtue.

analyzed: na ca kiṃcid dharmam abhiniviśate  sarva traidhātuka viveka prāptaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He does not cling to any phenomena.🔽He has attained detachment from the entire three realms.

analyzed: traidhātuka viṭhapana alaṃkāra abhinirhāram ca abhinirharati
translated: He accomplishes the adornment of the three realms.

analyzed: atyanta śānta upaśāntaḥ ca sarva kleśa jvālā apagamāt bhavati
translated: He is utterly peaceful and calm, having eliminated the flames of all afflictions.

analyzed: sarva sattva rāga dveṣa kleśa jvālā praśama abhinirhāram ca abhinirharati
translated: He accomplishes the pacification of the flames of passion, aggression, and afflictions of all beings.

analyzed: māyā marīci svapna pratibhāsa pratiśrutkā udaka candra pratibimba nirmāṇa bhāva abhāva svabhāva advaya anugataḥ ca bhavati

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavati evamapramāṇaḥ khalu punastathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ viṣayo yasya na sukarā saṃkhyā kartuṃ kalpakoṭiśatasahasrairyāvadetāvadbhirapi kalpakoṭiniyutaśatasahasraiḥ /

translated: “Just as, sons of the Victorious Ones, the space between two worlds, one with a defiled and one with a pure intention, is difficult to cross and cannot be crossed as it is, except through the power of great supernormal knowledge,

original: evameva bhoḥ prathamāṃ bhūmimupādāya bodhisattvaḥ pāramitāyānābhirūḍhaḥ sarvajagadanuvicaran saṃkleśadoṣān prajānāti /
analyzed: evam eva bhoḥ prathamām bhūmim upādāya bodhisattvaḥ pāramitā yāna abhirūḍhaḥ sarva jagat anuvicaran saṃkleśa doṣān prajānāti
translated: In the same way, O friend, the bodhisattva, starting from the first stage, mounted on the vehicle of the perfections, roaming through the entire world, knows the faults of afflictions,

analyzed: na ca taiḥ doṣaiḥ lipyate samyak mārga abhirūḍha tvāt
translated: but he is not tainted by those faults, because he is mounted on the right path.

analyzed: na ca tāvat samatikrāntaḥ sarva jagat saṃkleśa doṣān vaktavyaḥ
translated: And he should not yet be said to have transcended the faults of the defilements of the entire world.

original: saptasu bhūmiṣu sarvaprāyogikacaryāṃ vihāya saptamyā bhūmeraṣṭamīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimavakrānto bhavati /
analyzed: saptasu bhūmiṣu sarva prāyogika caryām vihāya saptamyāḥ bhūmeḥ aṣṭamīm bodhisattva bhūmim avakrāntaḥ bhavati
translated: Having abandoned all the practices of the seven stages, he enters from the seventh stage into the eighth stage of the bodhisattva.

original: tadā pariśuddhaṃ bodhisattvayānamabhirūḍhaḥ sarvajagadanuvicaran sarvajagatsaṃkleśadoṣān prajānāti /
analyzed: tadā pariśuddham bodhisattva yānam abhirūḍhaḥ sarva jagat anuvicaran sarva jagat saṃkleśa doṣān prajānāti
translated: Then, having mounted the pure vehicle of the bodhisattvas, he moves through the entire world and knows the faults of the defilements of the entire world.

analyzed: na ca taiḥ doṣaiḥ lipyate samatikrānta tvāt lokatriyābhyaḥ
translated: And he is not tainted by those faults, because he has transcended the three worlds.

original: asyāṃ punarbho jinaputra sapyamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattvo bhūyastvena rāgādipramukhaṃ sarvakleśagaṇaṃ samatikrānto bhavati /
analyzed: asyām punarbho jinaputra bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyastvena rāga ādi pramukham sarva kleśa gaṇam samatikrāntaḥ bhavati
translated: Moreover, O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who is established in this seventh bodhisattva stage mostly transcends the entire multitude of afflictions headed by passion.

original: so'syāṃ dūraṃgamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau caran bodhisattvo'saṃkleśāniṣkleśa iti vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ usyām dūraṃgamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau caran bodhisattvaḥ ūṃsaṃkleśa aniṣkleśaḥ iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: That bodhisattva who practices in this far-reaching bodhisattva stage should be said to be neither defiled nor undefiled.

original: tatkasmāt / asamudācārātsarvakleśānāṃ na saṃkleśa iti vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: tat kasmāt asamudācārāt sarva kleśānām na saṃkleśaḥ iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: Why is that? Because of the non-manifestation of all afflictions, he should be said to be neither defiled.

analyzed: tathāgata jñāna abhilāṣāt aparipūrṇa abhiprāya tvāt ca na niṣkleśaḥ iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: And because of his desire for the wisdom of the Tathāgatas and because his intentions are not yet fulfilled, he should be said to be neither undefiled.

original: so'syāṃ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattvo'dhyāśayapariśuddhena kāyakarmaṇā samanvāgato bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ usyām saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattva udhyāśaya pariśuddhena kāya karmaṇā samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, the Far-reaching, is endowed with physical actions that are pure in their superior attitude.

original: adhyāśayapariśuddhena vākkarmaṇā adhyāśayapariśuddhena manaskarmaṇā samanvāgato bhavati /🔽ye ceme daśākuśalāḥ karmapathāstathāgatavivarṇitāḥ /
analyzed: adhyāśaya pariśuddhena vāc karmaṇā adhyāśaya pariśuddhena manaḥ karmaṇā samanvāgataḥ bhavati  ye ca ime daśa akuśalāḥ karma pathāḥ tathāgata vivarṇitāḥ
translated: He is endowed with verbal actions and mental actions that are pure in their superior attitude.

original: tān sarveṇa sarvaṃ samatikrānto bhavati /🔽ye ceme daśa kuśalāḥ karmapathāḥ samyaksaṃbuddhānubhāvitāḥ /
analyzed: tān sarveṇa sarvam samatikrāntaḥ bhavati  ye ca ime daśa kuśalāḥ karma pathāḥ samyaksaṃbuddha anubhāvitāḥ
translated: He has completely transcended all the ten unwholesome courses of action that are condemned by the Tathāgata.

analyzed: tān satata samitam anuvartate
translated: He always and continuously practices the ten wholesome courses of action that are approved by the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: yāni laukikāni śilpasthānakarmasthānāni yānyabhinirhṛtāni pañcamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau /
analyzed: yāni laukikāni śilpasthāna karmasthānāni yāni abhinirhṛtāni pañcamyām bodhisattva bhūmau
translated: Whatever worldly crafts, occupations, and activities he has accomplished on the fifth bodhisattva stage,

analyzed: tāni asya sarvāṇi anābhogataḥ evam pravartante
translated: all of those proceed for him effortlessly.

original: sa ācāryaḥ saṃmato bhavati trisāhasra mahāsāhasralokadhātau /
analyzed: saḥ ācāryaḥ saṃmataḥ bhavati tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau
translated: He becomes an acknowledged teacher in the great trichiliocosm,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksambuddhān
translated: except for the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones,

analyzed: aṣṭamīm bhūmim upādāya ca bodhisattvān
translated: and the bodhisattvas who are on the eighth stage and above.

original: nāsya kaścitsamo bhavatyāśayena vā prayogeṇa vā /
analyzed: na asya kaścid samaḥ bhavati āśayena vā prayogeṇa vā
translated: No one is equal to him in terms of intention or application.

original: yāni cemāni dhyānāni samādhayaḥ samapattayo'bhijñā vimokṣāśca /
analyzed: yāni ca imāni dhyānāni samādhayaḥ samapattayaḥ abhijñāḥ vimokṣāḥ ca
translated: And these meditative absorptions, concentrations, attainments, superknowledges, and liberations,

analyzed: tāni asya sarveṇa sarvam āmukhībhavanti bhāvanā abhinirhāra ākāreṇa
translated: all of them manifest to him in the form of accomplishment through cultivation.

original: na ca tāvadvipākataḥ pariniṣpannāni bhavanti tadyathāpi nāma aṣṭamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya /
analyzed: na ca tāvat vipākataḥ pariniṣpannāni bhavanti tat yathā api nāma aṣṭamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya
translated: And they are not yet fully perfected through fruition, just as for a bodhisattva established in the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: asyāṃ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya sarvacittotpādeṣu prajñopāyabhāvanābalaṃ paripūryate /
analyzed: asyām saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya sarva citta utpādeṣu prajñā upāya bhāvanā balam paripūryate
translated: For a bodhisattva established in this seventh bodhisattva stage, the power of cultivating wisdom and means in all mental states is fulfilled.

analyzed: bhūyasyā mātrayā sarva bodhyaṅga paripūrim pratilabhate
translated: He obtains the fulfillment of all the factors of enlightenment to an even greater extent.

original: so'syāṃ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitaḥ san suvicitavicayaṃ ca nāma bodhisattvasamādhi samāpadyate /
analyzed: saḥ usyām saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ san suvicitavicayam ca nāma bodhisattva samādhi samāpadyate
translated: Abiding in this seventh bodhisattva stage, he enters the bodhisattva meditative absorption called Thoroughly Investigated Investigation.

analyzed: su vicintita artham ca nāma
translated: And the one called Well-Contemplated Meaning.

analyzed: viśeṣamatim ca nāma  prabheda artha kośam ca
translated: And the one called Distinct Understanding.🔽And the one called Treasury of Differentiated Meanings.

analyzed: sarva artha vicayam ca
translated: And the one called Investigation of All Meanings.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhita dṛḍha mūlam ca
translated: And the one called Well-Established Firm Root.

analyzed: jñāna abhijñā mukham ca
translated: And the gateway to the higher knowledge of wisdom.

analyzed: dharmadhātu parikarmam ca
translated: And the purification of the dharma realm.

original: tathāgatānuśaṃsaṃ ca / / / /🔽vicitrārthakośasaṃsāranirvāṇamukhaṃ ca bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpadyate /🔽sa evaṃpramukhāni mahābhijñājñānamukhāni paripūrṇāni daśa samādhiśatasahasrāṇi bhūmipariśodhikāni samāpadyate //🔽sa eṣāṃ samādhīnāmupāyaprajñāsupariśodhitānāṃ pratilambhānmahākaruṇābalena cātikrānto bhavati śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmim /🔽abhimukhaśca bhavati prajñājñānavicāraṇābhūmeḥ //
analyzed: tathāgata anuśaṃsam ca  vicitra artha kośa saṃsāra nirvāṇa mukham ca bodhisattva samādhim samāpadyate  saḥ evaṃpramukhāni mahā abhijñā jñāna mukhāni paripūrṇāni daśa samādhi śata sahasrāṇi bhūmi pariśodhikāni samāpadyate  saḥ eṣām samādhīnām upāya prajñā su pariśodhitānām pratilambhāt mahā karuṇā balena ca atikrāntaḥ bhavati śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmim  abhimukhaḥ ca bhavati prajñā jñāna vicāraṇā bhūmeḥ
translated: And the praise of the tathāgatas.

original: tasya asyāṃ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya apramāṇaṃ kāyakarma nimittāpagataṃ pravartate /🔽apramāṇaṃ vākkarma / / /manaskarma nimittāpagataṃ pravartate suviśodhitamanutpattikadharmakṣāntyavabhāsitam /🔽vimukticandra āha nanu bho jinaputra /
analyzed: tasya asyām saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya apramāṇam kāya karma nimitta apagatam pravartate 🔽apramāṇam vāc karma manaḥ karma nimitta apagatam pravartate su viśodhitam anutpattika dharma kṣānti avabhāsitam 🔽vimukticandraḥ āha nanu bho jinaputra

original: prathamāyāmeva bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya apramāṇaṃ kāyavāṅmanaskarma sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhacaryāṃ samatikrāntaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: prathamāyām eva bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya apramāṇam kāya vāc manaḥ karma sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha caryām samatikrāntam bhavati
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the first bodhisattva stage alone has immeasurable physical, verbal, and mental actions that transcend all the practices of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ āha bhavati bho jinaputra
translated: Vajragarbha said: It exists, O son of the victors.

analyzed: tat punar buddha dharma adhyālambana māhātmyena
translated: But that is due to the greatness of the object of the Buddha's teachings.

analyzed: na punar sva buddhi vicāreṇa
translated: Not by the power of one's own intellect.

original: asyāṃ tu punaḥ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau svabuddhigocaravicārapratilambhādasaṃhāryaṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhairbhavati /
analyzed: asyām tu punar saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sva buddhi gocara vicāra pratilambhāt asaṃhāryam śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ bhavati
translated: However, in this seventh bodhisattva stage, it becomes incapable of being taken away by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas due to the attainment of the domain of one's own intellect.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhavanto jinaputrā rājakulaprasūto rājaputro rājalakṣaṇasamanvāgato jātamātra eva sarvāmātyagaṇamabhibhavati rājādhipatyena /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ rāja kula prasūtaḥ rāja putraḥ rāja lakṣaṇa samanvāgataḥ jāta mātraḥ eva sarva amātya gaṇam abhibhavati rāja ādhipatyena
translated: Just as, O sons of the victors, a prince born in the royal family, endowed with the marks of a king, surpasses all the ministers as soon as he is born by his royal lordship,

analyzed: na punar sva buddhi vicāreṇa
translated: not by the power of his own intellect.

original: yadā punaḥ sa saṃvṛddho bhavati tadā svabuddhibalādhānataḥ sarvāmātyakriyāsamatikrānto bhavati /
analyzed: yadā punar sa saṃvṛddhaḥ bhavati tadā sva buddhi bala ādhānataḥ sarva amātya kriyā samatikrāntaḥ bhavati
translated: But when he grows up, then he surpasses all the activities of the ministers by the power of his own intellect.

analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ saha citta utpādena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhān abhibhavati adhyāśaya māhātmyena
translated: In the same way, O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva, by the greatness of his superior intention, surpasses all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas as soon as he generates the mind [of enlightenment].

analyzed: na punar sva buddhi vicāreṇa
translated: But not by the investigation of his own intellect.

original: asyāṃ tu saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattvaḥ svaviṣayajñānaviśeṣamāhātmyāvasthitatvātsarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhakriyāmatikrānto bhavati
analyzed: asyām tu saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sva viṣaya jñāna viśeṣa māhātmya avasthita tvāt sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha kriyām atikrāntaḥ bhavati
translated: However, the bodhisattva who is established in this seventh bodhisattva stage, by virtue of being established in the greatness of the special knowledge of his own domain, transcends the activity of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sa khalu punarbho bodhisattvo'syāṃ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito gambhīrasya vivittasyāpracārasya kāyavāṅmanaskarmaṇo lābhī bhavati /
analyzed: sa khalu punar bho bodhisattvaḥ ūsyām saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ gambhīrasya vivittasya a pracārasya kāya vāc manaḥ karmaṇaḥ lābhī bhavati
translated: Moreover, that bodhisattva who is established in this seventh bodhisattva stage becomes one who attains the profound, secluded, and unmanifest activity of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: na ca uttaram viśeṣa parimārgaṇa abhiyogam avasṛjati
translated: And he does not abandon the intense effort to seek the superior distinction.

analyzed: yena parimārgaṇa abhiyogena nirodha prāptaḥ ca bhavati
translated: By that intense effort to seek [the superior distinction], he attains cessation,

analyzed: na ca nirodham sākṣātkaroti
translated: but he does not actualize cessation.

original: vimukticandra āha katamāṃ bhūmimupādāya bodhisattvo nirodhaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: vimukticandraḥ āha katamām bhūmim upādāya bodhisattvaḥ nirodham samāpadyate
translated: Vimukticandra said: From which stage onward does the bodhisattva enter into cessation?

original: vajragarbha āha ṣaṣṭhīṃ bho jinaputra bodhisattvabhūmimupādāya bodhisattvo nirodhaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ āha ṣaṣṭhīm bho jinaputra bodhisattva bhūmim upādāya bodhisattvaḥ nirodham samāpadyate
translated: Vajragarbha said, “Son of the Victorious Ones, from the sixth bodhisattva ground onward, the bodhisattva enters cessation.

original: asyāṃ punaḥ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvaścittakṣaṇe cittakṣaṇe nirodhaṃ samāpadyate ca vyuttiṣṭhate ca /
analyzed: asyām punar saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ citta kṣaṇe citta kṣaṇe nirodham samāpadyate ca vyuttiṣṭhate ca
translated: However, the bodhisattva established on this seventh bodhisattva ground enters cessation and emerges from it in every moment of thought.

original: na ca nirodhaḥ sākṣātkṛta iti vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca nirodhaḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: It should not be said that he has realized cessation.

original: tena so'cintyena kāyavāṅmana skarmaṇā samanvāgata ityucyate /
analyzed: tena sa ucintyena kāya vāc manaḥ karmaṇā samanvāgataḥ iti ucyate
translated: Therefore, he is said to be endowed with inconceivable physical, verbal, and mental action.

original: āścaryaṃ bho yatra hi nāma bodhisattvo bhūtakoṭivihāreṇa ca viharati /
analyzed: āścaryam bho yatra hi nāma bodhisattvaḥ bhūtakoṭi vihāreṇa ca viharati
translated: It is amazing, sir, that the bodhisattva abides in the abode of the peak of existence

analyzed: na ca nirodham sākṣātkaroti
translated: but does not realize cessation.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra puruṣaḥ kuśalo mahāsāgare vārilakṣaṇābhijñaḥ paṇḍito vyakto medhāvī tatropagatayā mīmāṃsayā samanvāgato mahāsāgare mahāyānapātrābhirūḍho vahanakuśalaśca bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra puruṣaḥ kuśalaḥ mahā sāgare vāri lakṣaṇa abhijñaḥ paṇḍitaḥ vyaktaḥ medhāvī tatra upagatayā mīmāṃsayā samanvāgataḥ mahā sāgare mahā yānapātra abhirūḍhaḥ vahana kuśalaḥ ca bhavati
translated: It is just as, sir, a skilled person in the great ocean, who is knowledgeable about the characteristics of the water, is wise, clear, and intelligent, and who has gone there endowed with the investigation of the great ocean, has boarded a great ship in the great ocean, and is skilled in navigation.

analyzed: vāri kuśalaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he is skilled in the water.

analyzed: na ca mahā samudre vāri doṣaiḥ lipyate
translated: He is not tainted by the faults of the water in the great ocean.

original: evameva bho jinaputra asyāṃ saptamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvaḥ sarvajñajñānamahāsāgarāvatīrṇaḥ pāramitāmahāyānapātrābhirūḍho bhūtakoṭivihāreṇa ca viharati /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra asyām saptamyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarvajña jñāna mahā sāgara avatīrṇaḥ pāramitā mahā yānapātra abhirūḍhaḥ bhūtakoṭi vihāreṇa ca viharati
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva established in this seventh Bodhisattva stage, having entered the great ocean of omniscient knowledge, having mounted the great vehicle of the perfections, dwells in the abode of the ultimate reality.

analyzed: na ca nirodham sākṣātkaroti
translated: But he does not directly realize cessation.

analyzed: na ca sasṃkṛta atyanta vyupaśama vitarka doṣaiḥ lipyate
translated: And he is not tainted by the faults of conceptualization that are the complete cessation of conditioned things.

original: sa evaṃ jñānabalādhānaprāptaḥ samādhijñānabalabhāvanābhinirhṛtayā buddhyā mahatopāyaprajñābalādhānena saṃsāramukhaṃ cādarśayati /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna bala ādhāna prāptaḥ samādhi jñāna bala bhāvanā abhinirhṛtayā buddhyā mahatā upāya prajñā bala ādhānena saṃsāra mukham ca ādarśayati
translated: Having attained the power of such knowledge, with a wisdom that is the accomplishment of the meditation on the power of knowledge and concentration, with the great power of skillful means and wisdom, he displays the door of saṃsāra.

analyzed: nirvāṇa satata āśayaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he has a continuous intention for nirvāṇa.

analyzed: mahā parivāra parivṛtaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he is surrounded by a great retinue.

analyzed: satata samitam ca citta viveka pratilabdhaḥ bhavati
translated: And he always attains mental seclusion.

analyzed: traidhātuka upapattim ca praṇidhāna vaśena abhinirharati sattva paripācana artham
translated: And for the sake of ripening beings, he manifests rebirth in the three realms through the power of his vow.

analyzed: na ca loka doṣaiḥ lipyate
translated: And he is not tainted by the faults of the world.

analyzed: śānta praśānta upaśāntaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he is peaceful, tranquil, and calm.

analyzed: upāyena ca jvalati
translated: And he blazes with skillful means.

analyzed: jvalan ca na dahate
translated: And although he blazes, he does not burn.

analyzed: vivartate ca śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmibhyām

analyzed: buddha jñāna viṣaya kośa prāptaḥ ca bhavati
