analyzed: māra viṣaya gataḥ ca dṛśyate
translated: He is seen to be in the domain of Māra.

analyzed: catur māra patha samatikrāntaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He transcends the path of the four māras.

analyzed: māra viṣaya gocaram ca ādarśayati
translated: He displays the domain and sphere of activity of Māra.

analyzed: sarva tīrthya āyatana upagataḥ ca dṛśyate
translated: He is seen to have gone to all the abodes of the tīrthikas.

analyzed: buddha tīrthya āyatana an utsṛṣṭa āśayaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He does not abandon the intention to go to the abodes of the buddhas.

analyzed: sarva loka kriyā anugataḥ ca dṛśyate
translated: He is seen to follow all worldly actions.

analyzed: lokottara dharma gati samavasaraṇaḥ ca bhavati  sarva deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya śakra brahma lokapāla atireka vyūha alaṃkāra viṭhapana aprāptaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He is included in the transcendence of worldly dharmas.🔽He attains the display of adornments that surpass the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma ti manasikāram ca na vijahāti
translated: He does not abandon the mental attention to all the dharmas of the buddhas.

original: tasyaivaṃ jñānasamanvāgatasya asyāṃ saptasyāṃ dūraṃgamāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya bahavo buddhā ābhāsamāgacchanti / / / /
analyzed: tasya evam jñāna samanvāgatasya asyām saptasyām dūraṃgamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya bahavaḥ buddhāḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: For him who is endowed with such knowledge, who is in this seventh bodhisattva stage called Far-reaching, many buddhas appear.

analyzed: tān ca tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān paryupāsate
translated: And they attend upon those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: teṣāṃ ca sakāśādgauravacitrīkāreṇa satkṛtya dharmadeśanāṃ śṛṇoti /
analyzed: teṣām ca sakāśāt gaurava citrīkāreṇa satkṛtya dharma deśanām śṛṇoti
translated: And in their presence, with respect and honor, they listen to the Dharma teaching.

analyzed: udgṛhṇāti dhārayati
translated: They receive it and retain it.

analyzed: śrutvā ca yathāvat samāpatti prajñā jñāna ālokena prayujyate
translated: Having heard it, they apply it with the light of knowledge born from meditation and wisdom, as it truly is.

analyzed: pratipattitaḥ ca ādhārayati
translated: And they practice it.

analyzed: śāsana saṃdhārakaḥ ca bhavati teṣām buddhānām mahātmanām
translated: And they uphold the teachings of those great Buddhas.

analyzed: asaṃhāryaḥ ca sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha abhisamaya paripṛcchāsu
translated: And they are unassailable in answering questions about the realizations of all Hearers and Solitary Buddhas.

analyzed: tasya bhūyasyā mātrayā sattva anugrahāya gambhīra dharma kṣāntiḥ viśuddhi ati
translated: And their acceptance of the profound Dharma becomes purified to an even greater extent for the benefit of beings.

analyzed: tasya anekān kalpān tāni kuśala mūlāni uttapyante
translated: For him, for many eons, those wholesome roots are refined.

analyzed: pariśuddhi anti
translated: They become purified.

analyzed: karmaṇyāni ca bhavanti
translated: And they become workable.

analyzed: paryavadānam ca āgacchanti
translated: And they reach consummation.

analyzed: anekāni kalpa śatāni anekāni kalpa koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi tāni kuśala mūlāni uttapyante
translated: For many hundreds of eons... for many trillions of eons, those wholesome roots are refined.

analyzed: pariśuddhi anti
translated: They become purified.

analyzed: karmaṇyāni ca bhavanti
translated: And they become workable.

analyzed: paryavadānam ca āgacchanti
translated: And they reach consummation.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrāḥ tadeva jātarūpaṃ sarvaratnapratyuptaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayottaptataraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ tat eva jātarūpam sarva ratna pratyuptam bhūyasyā mātrayā uttaptataram bhavati
translated: For example, sons of the Victorious Ones, that very gold, when inlaid with all kinds of jewels, becomes even more refined, more radiant, and more valuable than other ornaments made of gold.

analyzed: prabhāsvarataram bhavati
translated: It becomes even more radiant.

analyzed: asaṃhāryataram ca bhavati anyābhyaḥ bhūṣaṇa vikṛtibhyaḥ
translated: It becomes even more valuable than other ornaments made of gold.

original: evameva bho jinaputrāḥ / / /tāni kuśalamūlānyupāyaprajñājñānābhinirhṛtāni bhūyasyā mātrayottaptatarāṇi bhavanti prabhāsvaratarāṇi /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ tāni kuśala mūlāni upāya prajñā jñāna abhinirhṛtāni bhūyasyā mātrayā uttaptatarāṇi bhavanti prabhāsvaratarāṇi
translated: In the same way, sons of the Victorious Ones, those roots of virtue, produced by skillful means, wisdom, and knowledge, become even more refined, more radiant,

analyzed: paryavadātatarāṇi asaṃhāryatarāṇi ca bhavanti sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ
translated: and more purified than those of all the Hearers and Solitary Realizers.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrāḥ sūryābhā asaṃhāryā bhavanti sarvajyotirgaṇacandrābhābhiścaturṣu mahādvīpeṣu /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ sūrya ābhāḥ asaṃhāryāḥ bhavanti sarva jyotiḥ gaṇa candra ābhābhiḥ caturṣu mahā dvīpeṣu
translated: For example, sons of the Victorious Ones, the light of the sun is invaluable, and it surpasses the light of all the hosts of stars and the moon in the four great continents.

analyzed: sarva sneha gatāni bhūyastvena pariśoṣayanti
translated: It dries up most of the watery places.

analyzed: sarva śasyāni paripācayanti
translated: It ripens all the crops.

original: evameva bho jinaputrā / / /tāni kuśalamūlānyasaṃhāryāṇi bhavanti sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrātāni kuśala mūlāni asaṃhāryāṇi bhavanti sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ
translated: In the same way, sons of the Victorious Ones, those roots of virtue are invaluable to all the Hearers and Solitary Realizers.🔽For example, sons of the Victorious Ones, the light of the sun is invaluable, and it surpasses the light of all the hosts of stars and the moon in the four great continents.

analyzed: catur viparyāsa gatāni ca sarva kleśa sneha gatāni bhūyastvena pariśoṣayanti
translated: And they dry up almost all the moisture of the afflictions that are associated with the four inversions.

analyzed: kleṣa āvilāni ca sarva saṃtānāni paripācayanti
translated: And they ripen all the continuums that are defiled by the afflictions.

original: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhya upāyakauśalyapāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ upāya kauśalya pāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati
translated: Of the ten perfections, the perfection of skillful means is preeminent for him.

original: na ca pariśeṣā na samudāgacchati yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: na ca pariśeṣā na samudāgacchati yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: And the rest are not accomplished, but to the best of his ability and as much as he can.

original: iyaṃ bho jinaputrā bodhisattvasya dūraṃgamā nāma saptamī bodhisattvabhūmiḥ samāsanirdeśataḥ /
analyzed: iyam bho jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya dūraṃgamā nāma saptamī bodhisattva bhūmiḥ samāsa nirdeśataḥ
translated: This, sons of the Victorious Ones, is the seventh bodhisattva stage, called Far-reaching, taught in brief.

original: yasyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo bhūyastvena vaśavartī bhavati devarājaḥ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānāmabhisamayajñānopasaṃhāreṣvaparyantaḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaparipṛcchāsu kuśalaḥ sattvānniyāmamavakrāmayitum /
analyzed: yasyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyastvena vaśa vartī bhavati devarājaḥ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānām abhisamaya jñāna upasaṃhāreṣu aparyantaḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha paripṛcchāsu kuśalaḥ sattvān niyāmam avakrāmayitum
translated: A bodhisattva who is established in this stage becomes, for the most part, a king of the gods with power over others, skilled, a lord, inexhaustible in bestowing the knowledge of realization upon beings, skilled in answering all the questions of the hearers and solitary realizers, and able to lead beings to the state of certainty.

analyzed: yat ca kicid
translated: And whatever there is...

analyzed: dūraṃgamā nāma saptamī bhūmiḥ
translated: The seventh stage is called Far-reaching.

analyzed: acalā nāma aṣṭamī bhūmiḥ
translated: The eighth stage is called Immovable.

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha yo'yaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvaḥ saptasu bodhisattvabhūmiṣu sukṛtavicayaḥ prajñopāyābhyāṃ supariśodhitamārgaḥ susaṃbhṛtasaṃbhāraḥ suparibaddhamahāpraṇidhānaḥ adhiṣṭhitatathāgatādhiṣṭhānaḥ svakuśalamūlabalādhānaprāptaḥ tathāgatabalavaiśāradyāveṇikabuddhadharmānugatasaṃjñāmanasikāraḥ supariśodhitādhyāśayasaṃkalpa puṇyajñānabalābhyudgataḥ mahākaruṇākṛpābhyāṃ sarvasattvānutsṛṣṭaprayogaḥ apramāṇajñānapathānugataḥ /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yaḥ yam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ saptasu bodhisattva bhūmiṣu su kṛta vicayaḥ prajñā upāyābhyām su pariśodhita mārgaḥ su saṃbhṛta saṃbhāraḥ su paribaddha mahā praṇidhānaḥ adhiṣṭhita tathāgata adhiṣṭhānaḥ sva kuśala mūla bala ādhāna prāptaḥ tathāgata bala vaiśāradya āveṇika buddha dharma anugata saṃjñā manasikāraḥ su pariśodhita adhyāśaya saṃkalpa puṇya jñāna bala abhyudgataḥ mahā k
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said, Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, this bodhisattva who has well examined the seven bodhisattva stages, whose path is well purified by wisdom and means, who has well gathered the accumulations, who has well bound the great vows, who is empowered by the blessings of the Tathagatas, who has attained the power of his own roots of virtue, whose attention is in accord with the powers, confidences, and unique qualities of the Buddhas, whose intention of pure superior attitude is well purified, who is exalted by the power of merit and wisdom, who never abandons the practice of great compassion and mercy for all beings, who follows the path of immeasurable wisdom,

analyzed: sa sarva dharmāṇām ādi anutpanna tām ca yathābhūtam avatarati
translated: The bodhisattva Vajragarbha said, Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, this bodhisattva who has well examined the seven bodhisattva stages, whose path is well purified by wisdom and means, who has well gathered the accumulations, who has well bound the great vows, who is empowered by the empowerment of the Tathagata, who has attained the power of his own roots of virtue, whose attention is in accord with the powers, confidences, and unique qualities of the Buddha, whose intention of pure superior attitude is well purified, who is exalted by the power of merit and knowledge, who is not abandoning the practice of great compassion and mercy for all beings, who is following the path of immeasurable knowledge,

original: ajātatāṃ ca alakṣaṇatāṃ ca asaṃbhūtatāṃ ca avināśitāṃ ca aniṣṭhitatāṃ ca apravṛttitāṃ ca anabhinivṛttitāṃ ca abhāvasvabhāvatāṃ ca ādimadhyaparyavasānasamatāṃ ca tathatāvikalpasarvajñajñānapraveśatāṃ ca sarvadharmāṇāṃ yathābhūtamavatarati /
analyzed: a jāta tām ca a lakṣaṇa tām ca a saṃbhūta tām ca a vināśi tām ca aniṣṭhita tām ca a pravṛtti tām ca anabhinivṛtti tām ca abhāva svabhāva tām ca ādi madhya paryavasāna sama tām ca tathatā vikalpa sarvajña jñāna praveśa tām ca sarva dharmāṇām yathābhūtam avatarati
translated: He penetrates the unborn nature, the nature of no characteristics, the nature of non-arising, the nature of non-destruction, the nature of non-abiding, the nature of non-occurrence, the nature of non-manifestation, the nature of non-existence, the equality of beginning, middle, and end, and the entry into the wisdom of omniscience that is the non-conceptuality of suchness of all phenomena, as they truly are.

analyzed: sa sarvaśas citta manaḥ vijñāna vikalpa saṃjñā apagataḥ nava gṛhīta ākāśa samaḥ abhyavakāśa prakṛtitaḥ vatīrṇaḥ anutpattika dharma kṣānti prāptaḥ iti ucyate
translated: He is said to be free from all thoughts, mind, consciousness, and conceptual notions, to be like space without grasping, to have entered the nature of the open sky, and to have attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: tatra bhavanto jinaputrā evaṃ kṣāntisamanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ sahapratilambhādacalāyā bodhisattvabhūmergambhīraṃ bodhisattvavihāramanuprāpto bhavati durājñātamasaṃbhinnaṃ sarvanimittāpagataṃ sarvasaṃjñāgrahavyāvṛttamapramāṇamasaṃhāryaṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ sarvavivekābhimukhībhūtam tadyathāpi nāma bhavanto jinaputrā bhikṣurṛddhimāṃścetovaśipāramitāprāpto'nupūrveṇa navamaṃ nirodhaṃ samāpannaḥ sarveñjitamanyanāspanditavikalpāpagato
analyzed: tatra bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ evam kṣānti samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ saha pratilambhāt acalāyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ gambhīram bodhisattva vihāram anuprāptaḥ bhavati durājñātam asaṃbhinnam sarva nimitta apagatam sarva saṃjñā graha vyāvṛttam apramāṇam asaṃhāryam sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ sarva viveka abhimukhībhūtam tat yathā api nāma bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bhikṣuḥ ṛddhimān cetaḥ vaśi pāramitā prāptaḥ anupūrveṇa navamam nirodham samāpa
translated: There, venerable Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva endowed with such patience, upon attaining the immovable bodhisattva stage, attains the profound bodhisattva abode, which is difficult to know, indivisible, free from all signs, turned away from all conceptual grasping, immeasurable, unassailable by all hearers and solitary realizers, and oriented towards all isolations. Venerable Victorious Ones, just as a monk who has attained magical power and mastery over mind, gradually entering the ninth cessation, becomes free from all movement, thought, fluctuation, and conceptualization,

original: evameva bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvo'syā aṣṭamyā acalāyā bodhisattvabhūmeḥ sahapratilambhātsarvābhogavigato'nābhogadharmatāprāptaḥ kāyavākcittautsukyāpagataḥ sarveñjitamanyanāspanditavikalpāpagato vipākadharmatāvasthito bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ usyāḥ aṣṭamyāḥ acalāyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ saha pratilambhāt sarva ābhoga vigataḥ na ābhoga dharmatā prāptaḥ kāya vāc citta autsukya apagataḥ sarva iñjita manyana āspandita vikalpa apagataḥ vipāka dharmatā avasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: in the same way, venerable Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva, upon attaining this eighth bodhisattva stage called Immovable, becomes free from all effort, attains the effortless nature of phenomena, free from the eagerness of body, speech, and mind, free from all movement, thought, fluctuation, and conceptualization, abiding in the state of the natural result.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrāḥ puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapnāntaragato mahaughaprāptamātmānaṃ saṃjānīte /🔽sa tatra mahadvyāyāmautsukyamārabhetottaraṇāya /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ puruṣaḥ suptaḥ svapna antara gataḥ mahā ogha prāptam ātmānam saṃjānīte  sa tatra mahat vyāyāma autsukyam ārabheta uttaraṇāya
translated: “O sons of the victorious ones, it is as follows: Suppose a man, while asleep and dreaming, were to perceive himself as having reached a great flood.🔽He would then begin a great effort and exertion to cross it.

analyzed: sa tena eva mahatā vyāyāma autsukyena vibudhyeta
translated: He would awaken through that very great effort and exertion.

analyzed: samanantara vibuddhaḥ ca vyāyāma autsukya bhaya apagataḥ bhavet
translated: And immediately after awakening, he would be free from the fear of effort and exertion.

original: evameva bho jinaputrā bodhisattvaścaturmahaughaprāptaṃ sattvakāyaṃ saṃjānāna uttaraṇābhiprāyaḥ sarvajñajñānābhisaṃbodhāya mahadvyāyāmautsukyamārabhate
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ catur mahā ogha prāptam sattvakāyam saṃjānānaḥ uttaraṇa abhiprāyaḥ sarvajña jñāna abhisaṃbodhāya mahat vyāyāma autsukyam ārabhate
translated: In just the same way, O sons of the victorious ones, the bodhisattva, perceiving the realm of beings as having reached the four great floods, with the intention to cross them, begins a great effort and exertion to fully awaken to omniscient knowledge.

original: sa mahāvīryārambhaprāptaḥ samanantaramanuprāpta imāmacalāṃ bodhisattvabhūmiṃ sarvābhogavigato bhavati /
analyzed: sa mahā vīrya ārambha prāptaḥ samanantaram anuprāptaḥ imām acalām bodhisattva bhūmim sarva ābhoga vigataḥ bhavati
translated: Having attained the great exertion, he immediately attains this unshakable bodhisattva ground and becomes free from all effort.

original: tasya sarveṇa sarvaṃ dvayasamudācāro vā nimittasamudācāro vā nābhāsībhavati /
analyzed: tasya sarveṇa sarvam dvaya samudācāraḥ vā nimitta samudācāraḥ vā na ābhāsībhavati
translated: For him, in every way, the practice of duality or the practice of signs no longer appears.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrā brahmalokopapattisthitaḥ kāmāvacarān kleśān na samudācarati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ brahma loka upapatti sthitaḥ kāmāvacarān kleśān na samudācarati
translated: O sons of the victorious ones, it is as follows: Just as one born and abiding in the Brahma world does not engage in the afflictions of the desire realm,

original: evameva bho jinaputrā bodhisattvo'calāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitaḥ sarvacittamanovijñānasamudācārānna samudācarati /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ ucalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ sarva citta manaḥ vijñāna samudācārān na samudācarati
translated: In the same way, O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who is on the unshakable bodhisattva stage does not engage in the activities of all mind, thought, and consciousness.

analyzed: sarva buddha samudācāram api bodhi samudācāram api bodhisattva samudācāram api pratyekabuddha samudācāram api śrāvaka samudācāram api nirvāṇa samudācāram api arhat samudācāram api anāgāmi samudācāram api nirvāṇa samudācāram api arhat samudācāram api anāgāmi samudācāram api sakṛdāgāmi samudācāram api srotaāpanna samudācāram api na samudācarati
translated: He does not engage in the activities of all buddhas, the activities of enlightenment, the activities of bodhisattvas, the activities of pratyekabuddhas, the activities of śrāvakas, the activities of nirvāṇa, the activities of arhats, the activities of non-returners, the activities of once-returners, or the activities of stream-enterers.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ laukikān samudācārān samudācariṣyati iti
translated: How much less would he engage in worldly activities?

original: tasya khalu bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya evamimāmacalāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanugatasya pūrvapraṇidhānabalādhānasthitasya buddhā bhagavantastasmin dharmamukhasrotasi tathāgatajñānopasaṃhāraṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: tasya khalu bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya evam imām acalām bodhisattva bhūmim anugatasya pūrva praṇidhāna bala ādhāna sthitasya buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tasmin dharma mukha srotasi tathāgata jñāna upasaṃhāram kurvanti
translated: To that bodhisattva who has thus entered this unshakable bodhisattva stage, who abides in the power and support of former vows, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, provide the means for attaining the knowledge of the Tathagatas in that stream of Dharma doors.

original: evaṃ cainaṃ bruvanti sādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: evam ca enam bruvanti sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: And they say to him, 'Good, good it is, O son of good family!

analyzed: eṣā parama artha kṣāntiḥ buddha dharma anugamāya
translated: This is the supreme patience for following the Buddha's teachings.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra yā asmākaṃ daśabalacaturvaiśāradyabuddhadharmasamṛddhiḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra yā asmākam daśa bala catur vaiśāradya buddha dharma samṛddhiḥ
translated: Moreover, O son of good family, that prosperity of the Buddha's qualities, the ten powers and four forms of fearlessness, which we have,

analyzed: sā tava na asti
translated: is not yours.

analyzed: tasyāḥ buddha dharma samṛddheḥ paryeṣaṇāya abhiyogam kuru
translated: Strive to attain that prosperity of the Buddha's qualities.

analyzed: vīryam ārabhasva
translated: Exert yourself.

analyzed: etat eva kṣānti mukham mā unmokṣīḥ
translated: Do not let go of this very door of patience.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra kiṃcāpi tvayaivaṃ śāntavimokṣavihāro'nuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra kiṃca api tvayā evam śānta vimokṣa vihāraḥ anuprāptaḥ
translated: Moreover, O son of good family, although you have attained this peaceful abode of liberation,

original: imān punaraśāntānapraśāntān bālapṛthagjanān nānākleśasamudācāraprāptān vividhavitarkopahatamānasān samanvāhara / apekṣasva /
analyzed: imān punar aśāntān apraśāntān bāla pṛthagjanān nānā kleśa samudācāra prāptān vividha vitarka upahata mānasān samanvāhara apekṣasva
translated: still consider and have compassion for these beings who are not peaceful, not calm, who are foolish ordinary people, who have attained the practice of various afflictions, whose minds are afflicted by various thoughts.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra pūrvapraṇidhānamanusmara sattvārthasaṃprāpaṇaṃ jñānamukhācintyatāṃ ca /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra pūrva praṇidhānam anusmara sattva artha saṃprāpaṇam jñāna mukha acintyatām ca
translated: Moreover, noble sir, remember your former vow to benefit sentient beings, and the inconceivability of the doors of wisdom.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra eṣā sarvadharmāṇāṃ dharmatā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra eṣā sarva dharmāṇām dharma tā
translated: Moreover, noble sir, this is the nature of all phenomena.

original: utpādādvā tathāgatānāmanutpādādvā sthitaivaiṣā dharmatā dharmadhātusthitiḥ yadidaṃ sarvadharmaśūnyatā sarvadharmānupalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: utpādāt vā tathāgatānām anutpādāt vā sthitā eva eṣā dharmatā dharmadhātu sthitiḥ yat idam sarva dharma śūnyatā sarva dharma anupalabdhiḥ
translated: Whether Tathāgatas arise or do not arise, this nature of things, this stability of the dharma-element, remains—namely, the emptiness of all things, the non-apprehension of all things.

analyzed: na etayā tathāgatāḥ eva kevalam prabhāvyante
translated: Not only are the Tathāgatas manifested by this,

analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhāḥ api hi etām avikalpa dharmatām anuprāpnuvanti
translated: all the Disciples and Solitary Sages also attain this non-conceptual nature of things.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra prekṣasva tāvat tvamasmākaṃ kāyāpramāṇatāṃ ca jñānāpramāṇatāṃ ca buddhakṣetrāpramāṇatāṃ ca jñānābhinirhārāpramāṇatāṃ ca prabhāmaṇḍalāpramāṇatāṃ ca svarāṅgaviśuddhyapramāṇatāṃ ca /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra prekṣasva tāvat tvam asmākam kāya apramāṇa tām ca jñāna apramāṇa tām ca buddhakṣetra apramāṇa tām ca jñāna abhinirhāra apramāṇa tām ca prabhā maṇḍala apramāṇa tām ca svara aṅga viśuddhi apramāṇa tām ca
translated: Moreover, noble sir, just look at the immeasurability of our bodies, the immeasurability of our wisdom, the immeasurability of our buddha-fields, the immeasurability of our manifestation of wisdom, the immeasurability of our halos, and the immeasurability of the purity of our speech.

analyzed: tathā eva tvam api abhinirhāram utpādaya
translated: In the same way, you should also generate the resolve for manifest enlightenment.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra ekastveṣa āloko yo'yaṃ sarvadharmanirvikalpālokaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra ekaḥ tu eṣaḥ ālokaḥ yaḥ yam sarva dharma nirvikalpa ālokaḥ
translated: Moreover, noble sir, this is the only light, namely, the light of all the nonconceptual Dharmas.

analyzed: īdṛśāḥ tu kula putra dharma ālokāḥ tathāgatānām aparyanta gatāḥ aparyanta kṛtāḥ aparyanta baddhāḥ
translated: Noble sir, the light of the Dharma of the Tathagatas is like this: it is infinite, it has been made infinite, it is boundlessly infinite.

analyzed: yeṣām saṃkhyā na asti
translated: It has no number.

analyzed: gaṇanā pramāṇam upaniṣad aupamyam na asti
translated: It has no calculation, no measure, no comparison, and no example.

analyzed: teṣām adhigamāya abhinirhāram utpādaya
translated: Generate the achievement of realization of them.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputra prekṣasva tāvaddaśasu dikṣu apramāṇakṣetratāṃ ca apramāṇasattvatāṃ ca apramāṇadharmavibhaktitāṃ ca /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putra prekṣasva tāvat daśasu dikṣu apramāṇa kṣetra tām ca apramāṇa sattva tām ca apramāṇa dharma vibhakti tām ca
translated: Moreover, noble sir, just look at the infinity of the fields in the ten directions, the infinity of the beings, and the infinity of the analysis of the Dharmas.

analyzed: tat sarvam anugaṇaya
translated: Take all of that into account.

analyzed: yathāvat tayā abhinirhāram utpādaya
translated: Generate the achievement of realization in accordance with reality.

original: iti hi bho jinaputra te buddhā bhagavanta evaṃbhūmyanugatasya bodhisattvasya evaṃ pramukhānyaprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni jñānābhinirhāramukhānyupasaṃharanti /
analyzed: iti hi bho jinaputra te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ evaṃbhūmyanugatasya bodhisattvasya evam pramukhāni aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni jñāna abhinirhāra mukhāni upasaṃharanti
translated: Thus, sons of the Victorious Ones, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, bestow on the Bodhisattva who has attained this stage the doors of the achievement of realization of the foremost of the immeasurable, innumerable kinds of knowledge,

analyzed: yaiḥ jñāna abhinirhāra mukhaiḥ
translated: by means of which doors of the achievement of realization the Bodhisattva accomplishes the activity of the achievement of realization through the analysis of immeasurable knowledge.

analyzed: ārocayāmi te bho jinaputra
translated: I declare to you, O son of the Victorious Ones,

analyzed: prativedayāmi
translated: I make it known to you.

original: te cedbuddhā bhagavantastaṃ bodhisattvamevaṃ sarvajñajñānābhinirhāramukheṣu nāvatārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ced buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tam bodhisattvam evam sarvajña jñāna abhinirhāra mukheṣu na avatārayeyuḥ
translated: If those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, were not to introduce that Bodhisattva into the doors of the manifestation of omniscient knowledge,

analyzed: tat eva asya parinirvāṇam bhavet sarva sattva kārya pratiprasrabdhiḥ ca
translated: that would be his complete nirvāṇa, and the cessation of all activities for sentient beings.

original: tena khalu punarbuddhā bhagavantastasya bodhisattvasya tāvadapramāṇaṃ jñānābhinirhārakarmopasaṃharanti /
analyzed: tena khalu punar buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tasya bodhisattvasya tāvat apramāṇam jñāna abhinirhāra karma upasaṃharanti
translated: But, moreover, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, bestow upon that Bodhisattva the immeasurable activity of the manifestation of knowledge,

original: yasyaikakṣaṇābhinirhṛtasya jñānābhinirhārakarmaṇaḥ sa pūrvakaḥ prathamacittotpādamupādāya yāvatsaptamīṃ bhūmipratiṣṭhāmupāgata ārambhaḥ śatatamīmapi kalāṃ nopeti /🔽sahasratamīmapi /
analyzed: yasya eka kṣaṇa abhinirhṛtasya jñāna abhinirhāra karmaṇaḥ sa pūrvakaḥ prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat saptamīm bhūmi pratiṣṭhām upāgataḥ ārambhaḥ śatatamīm api kalām na upeti  sahasratamīm api
translated: of which the activity of the manifestation of knowledge produced in a single instant is not even a hundredth part, not even a thousandth part,🔽not even a hundred thousandth part...🔽it is not even a fraction,

analyzed: śata sahasratamīm apipeyālam koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upeti  saṃkhyām api  gaṇanām api
translated: not even a number,🔽not even a calculation,🔽not even a simile,

analyzed: upamām api  upa nisām api
translated: not even a comparison,

analyzed: yāvat aupamyam api na kṣamate
translated: up to it is not even a metaphor,🔽of the activity of the manifestation of knowledge that he had previously produced from the first generation of the mind up to the seventh stage.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi bho jinaputra pūrvamekakāyābhinirhāratayā caryābhinirhāro'bhūt /
analyzed: tathā hi bho jinaputra pūrvam eka kāya abhinirhāra tayā caryā abhinirhāraḥ bhūt
translated: For thus, O son of the Victorious Ones, previously the accomplishment of conduct was through the manifestation of a single body.

original: imāṃ punarbhūmiṃ samārūḍhasya bodhisattvasya apramāṇakāyavibhaktito bodhisattvacaryābalaṃ samudāgacchati /
analyzed: imām punar bhūmim samārūḍhasya bodhisattvasya apramāṇa kāya vibhaktitaḥ bodhisattva caryā balam samudāgacchati
translated: But for a bodhisattva who has ascended to this stage, the power of bodhisattva conduct arises through the manifestation of immeasurable bodily distinctions,

original: apramāṇaghoṣābhinirhārataḥ apramāṇajñānābhinirhārataḥ apramāṇopapattyabhinirhārataḥ apramāṇakṣetrapariśodhanataḥ apramāṇasattvaparipācanataḥ apramāṇabuddhapūjopasthānataḥ apramāṇadharmakāyānubodhataḥ apramāṇābhijñābalādhānābhinirhārataḥ apramāṇaparṣanmaṇḍalavibhaktyabhinirhārataśca apramāṇānugatena kāyavāṅmanaskarmābhinirhāreṇa sarvabodhisattvacaryābalaṃ samudāgacchatyavicālyayogena /
analyzed: apramāṇa ghoṣa abhinirhārataḥ apramāṇa jñāna abhinirhārataḥ apramāṇa upapatti abhinirhārataḥ apramāṇa kṣetra pariśodhanataḥ apramāṇa sattva paripācanataḥ apramāṇa buddha pūjā upasthānataḥ apramāṇa dharmakāya anubodhataḥ apramāṇa abhijñā bala ādhāna abhinirhārataḥ apramāṇa parṣad maṇḍala vibhakti abhinirhārataḥ ca apramāṇa anugatena kāya vāc manaḥ karma abhinirhāreṇa sarva bodhisattva caryā balam samudāgacchati a vicālya yo
translated: through the manifestation of immeasurable voices, through the manifestation of immeasurable knowledge, through the manifestation of immeasurable rebirths, through the purification of immeasurable buddha-fields, through the maturation of immeasurable beings, through the worship and service of immeasurable buddhas, through the realization of the immeasurable Dharma body, through the manifestation of the attainment of immeasurable superknowledges and powers, and through the manifestation of the division of immeasurable assemblies. The power of all bodhisattva conduct arises through the manifestation of immeasurable bodily, verbal, and mental actions, through the yoga of unshakable engagement.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra mahāsamudragāmī poto'prāpto mahāsamudraṃ sābhogavāhano bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra mahā samudra gāmī potu prāptaḥ mahā samudram sa ābhoga vāhanaḥ bhavati
translated: For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, a ship sailing to the great ocean has exertion as its means of propulsion before reaching the great ocean.

original: sa eva samanantaramanuprāpto mahāsamudramanābhogavāhano vātamaṇḍalīpraṇīto yadekadivasena mahāsamudre kramate /
analyzed: saḥ eva samanantaram anuprāptaḥ mahā samudram anābhoga vāhanaḥ vāta maṇḍalī praṇītaḥ yat eka divasena mahā samudre kramate
translated: He has just arrived at the great ocean, carried effortlessly by the wind, in one day, as if carried by a wind circle.

analyzed: tat sarva sābhoga vāhana tayā na śakyam varṣa śatena api tāvat aprameyam anuprāptum
translated: That cannot be reached in even a hundred years by the effort of sailing.

original: evameva bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ susaṃbhṛtamahākuśalamūlasaṃbhāro mahāyānasamudāgamābhirūḍho mahābodhisattvacaryāsāgaramanuprāpto yadekamuhūrtena jñānānābhogatayā sarvajñajñānenākramati /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ su saṃbhṛta mahā kuśala mūla saṃbhāraḥ mahāyāna samudāgama abhirūḍhaḥ mahā bodhisattva caryā sāgaram anuprāptaḥ yat eka muhūrtena jñāna anābhogatayā sarvajña jñānena ākramati
translated: In the same way, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva, having accumulated the great provisions of roots of virtue, having mounted the great vehicle, having reached the ocean of the great Bodhisattva conduct, in one moment, by the effortless knowledge, he reaches the knowledge of all the Omniscient Ones.

original: tanna śakyaṃ pūrvakeṇa sābhogakarmaṇā kalpaśatasahasreṇāpi tāvadaprameyamanuprāptum //
analyzed: tat na śakyam pūrvakeṇa sa ābhoga karmaṇā kalpa śata sahasreṇa api tāvat aprameyam anuprāptum
translated: That cannot be reached in even a hundred thousand eons by the previous effort.

original: tatra bho jinaputra bodhisattvo'ṣṭamīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāpto mahatyā upāyakauśalyajñānābhinirhārānābhogaprasṛtayā bodhisattvabuddhyā sarvajñajñānaṃ vicārayan lokadhātusaṃbhavaṃ ca vicārayati /
analyzed: tatra bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ uṣṭamīm bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptaḥ mahatyā upāya kauśalya jñāna abhinirhāra an ābhoga prasṛtayā bodhisattva buddhyā sarvajña jñānam vicārayan lokadhātu saṃbhavam ca vicārayati
translated: There, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva, having reached the eighth Bodhisattva stage, with the Bodhisattva mind that has attained the great accomplishment of skillful means and knowledge, free from effort, contemplating the knowledge of all the Omniscient Ones, contemplates the origin of the world systems.

analyzed: lokadhātu vibhavam ca vicārayati
translated: He contemplates the destruction of the world systems.

analyzed: sa yathā ca lokaḥ saṃvartate
translated: How the world contracts,

analyzed: tam ca prajānāti
translated: and he knows that.

original: yathā ca loko vivartate / / / / /🔽yena ca karmopacayena lokaḥ saṃvartate / / / / /
analyzed: yathā ca lokaḥ vivartate  yena ca karma upacayena lokaḥ saṃvartate
translated: And how the world expands...🔽And by what accumulation of karma the world contracts...

original: yena ca karmakṣayeṇa loko vivartate / / / / /🔽yāvatkālaṃ ca lokaḥ saṃvartate / / / / /
analyzed: yena ca karma kṣayeṇa lokaḥ vivartate  yāvatkālam ca lokaḥ saṃvartate
translated: And by what exhaustion of karma the world expands...🔽And for how long the world contracts...

original: yāvatkālaṃ ca loko vivartate / / / / /🔽yāvatkālaṃ ca lokaṃ saṃvṛttastiṣṭhati / / / / /
analyzed: yāvatkālam ca lokaḥ vivartate  yāvatkālam ca lokam saṃvṛttaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: And for how long the world expands...🔽And for how long the world remains contracted...

analyzed: yāvatkālam ca lokaḥ vivṛttaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: And for how long the world remains expanded.

analyzed: tam ca prajānāti sarvatra ca anavaśeṣataḥ
translated: He knows all that without exception.

original: sa pṛthivīdhātuparīttatāṃ ca prajānāti mahadgatatāṃ ca / / /apramāṇatāṃ ca / / /vibhaktitāṃ ca prajānāti /🔽abdhātu / / / /
analyzed: sa pṛthivī dhātu parītta tām ca prajānāti mahadgata tām ca apramāṇa tām ca vibhakti tām ca prajānāti  ap dhātu
translated: He knows the smallness of the earth element, its greatness, its immeasurability, and its differentiation.🔽The water element...

analyzed: tejaḥ dhātu
translated: The fire element...

original: vāyudhātu / / / /🔽sa paramāṇurajaḥsūkṣmatāṃ ca prajānāti /🔽mahadgatatāṃ ca apramāṇatāṃ ca vibhaktitāṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: vāyudhātu  sa paramāṇu rajaḥ sūkṣmatām ca prajānāti  mahadgata tām ca apramāṇa tām ca vibhakti tām ca prajānāti
translated: The wind element...🔽He knows the subtlety of the smallest particle.🔽He knows its greatness, its immeasurability, and its differentiation.

analyzed: apramāṇa paramāṇu rajaḥ vibhakti kauśalyam ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the skill in differentiating the immeasurable smallest particles.

original: asyāṃ ca lokadhātau yāvanti pṛthivīdhātoḥ paramāṇurajāṃsi tāni prajānāti /🔽yāvanti abdhātoḥ / / / /
analyzed: asyām ca lokadhātau yāvanti pṛthivī dhātoḥ paramāṇu rajāṃsi tāni prajānāti  yāvanti ap dhātoḥ
translated: the number of atoms in the water element,

analyzed: tejaḥ dhātoḥ
translated: the number of atoms in the fire element,

original: vāyudhātoḥ / / / /🔽yāvantyo ratnavibhaktayo yāvanti ca ratnaparamāṇurajāṃsi tāni prajānāti /
analyzed: vāyu dhātoḥ  yāvantyaḥ ratna vibhaktayaḥ yāvanti ca ratna paramāṇu rajāṃsi tāni prajānāti
translated: the number of atoms in the wind element,🔽and the number of atoms in the various jewels, and the number of atoms in each jewel.

analyzed: sattvakāya
translated: He knows the bodies of beings,

analyzed: kṣetrakāya
translated: the bodies of fields,

original: sa sattvānāṃ kāyaudārikatāṃ ca kāyasūkṣmatāṃ ca kāyavibhaktitāṃ ca prajānāti /🔽yāvanti paramāṇurajāṃsi saṃbhūtāni nairayikakāyāśrayatastāni prajānāti /
analyzed: sa sattvānām kāya audārika tām ca kāya sūkṣma tām ca kāya vibhakti tām ca prajānāti  yāvanti paramāṇu rajāṃsi saṃbhūtāni nairayika kāya āśrayataḥ tāni prajānāti
translated: He knows the coarseness and subtlety of beings' bodies, and the distinctions in their bodies.🔽He knows the number of atoms that make up the bodies of beings in the hells,

analyzed: tiryagyoni kāya āśrayataḥ  yama loka kāya āśrayataḥ
translated: the number of atoms that make up the bodies of beings in the animal realm,🔽the number of atoms that make up the bodies of beings in the realm of Yama,

analyzed: asura loka kāya āśrayataḥ
translated: the number of atoms that make up the bodies of beings in the realm of the asuras,

analyzed: deva loka kāya āśrayataḥ
translated: the number of atoms that make up the bodies of beings in the realm of the gods,

analyzed: manuṣya loka kāya āśrayataḥ
translated: the number of atoms that make up the bodies of beings in the human realm.

original: sa evaṃ paramāṇurajaḥprabhedajñānāvatīrṇaḥ kāmadhātusaṃvartaṃ ca prajānāti /🔽rūpadhātuvivartaṃ / / / /
analyzed: saḥ evam paramāṇu rajaḥ prabheda jñāna avatīrṇaḥ kāmadhātu saṃvartam ca prajānāti  rūpadhātu vivartam
translated: Having attained this knowledge of the distinctions of atoms, he knows the dissolution of the desire realm,🔽he knows the evolution of the form realm,

analyzed: ārūpya dhātu vivartam ca prajānāti
translated: and he knows the evolution of the formless realm.

analyzed: rūpa dhātu parītta tām ārūpya dhātu parītta tām
translated: the limitedness of the form realm, the limitedness of the formless realm,

original: āmadhātuparīttatāṃ ca mahadgatatāṃ ca apramāṇatāṃ ca vibhaktitāṃ ca prajānāti /🔽rūpadhātuparīttatāṃ / / / ārūpyadhātuparīttataṃ / / / /🔽kāmadhātuparīttatāṃ ca mahadgatatāṃ ca apramāṇatāṃ ca vibhaktitāṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: āma dhātu parītta tām ca mahat gata tām ca apramāṇa tām ca vibhakti tām ca prajānāti  rūpa dhātu parītta tām ārūpya dhātu parītta tam  kāmadhātu parītta tām ca mahadgata tām ca apramāṇa tām ca vibhakti tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the smallness, greatness, immeasurability, and differentiation of the form realm, the formless realm,🔽and the desire realm.🔽He knows the smallness, greatness, immeasurability, and differentiation of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽He knows the smallness, greatness, immeasurability, and differentiation of the desire realm.

analyzed: rūpa dhātu ārūpya dhātu parītta tām
translated: He knows the smallness, greatness, immeasurability, and differentiation of the form realm and the formless realm.

original: traidhātukavicārajñānānugame svabhinirhṛtajñānālokaḥ sattvakāyaprabhedajñānakuśalaḥ kṣetrakāyavibhāgajñānakuśalaśca sattvopapattyāyatanābhinirhāre buddhiṃ cārayati /
analyzed: traidhātuka vicāra jñāna anugame su abhinirhṛta jñāna ālokaḥ sattva kāya prabheda jñāna kuśalaḥ kṣetra kāya vibhāga jñāna kuśalaḥ ca sattva upapatti āyatana abhinirhāre buddhim cārayati
translated: Having attained the knowledge of the investigation of the three realms, with the light of self-arisen knowledge, skilled in the knowledge of the distinctions in the bodies of beings and skilled in the knowledge of the distinctions in the fields, he directs his mind towards the manifestation of the realms of rebirth of beings.

analyzed: sa yādṛśī sattvānām upapattiḥ ca kāya samudāgamaḥ ca
translated: Whatever the rebirth and bodily attainment of beings is like,

analyzed: tādṛśam eva sva kāyam adhitiṣṭhati sattva paripācanāya
translated: he manifests his own body in that way for the sake of ripening beings.

original: sa ekāmapi trisāhasramahāsāhasrāṃ lokadhātuṃ spharitvā sattvānāṃ svakāyaṃ vibhaktyadhimuktiṣu tathatvāyopapattaye'bhinirharati pratibhāsajñānānugamanatayā yathā sattvāḥ paripākaṃ gacchantyanuttarasamyaksaṃbodhivimuktaye /
analyzed: saḥ ekām api tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrām lokadhātum spharitvā sattvānām sva kāyam vibhakti adhimuktiṣu tathatvāya upapattaye abhinirharati pratibhāsa jñāna anugamana tayā yathā sattvāḥ paripākam gacchanti anuttara samyaksaṃbodhi vimuktaye
translated: He manifests his own body to beings in one great trichiliocosm, or in three, or in four, or in five, or in ten, or in twenty, or in thirty, or in forty, or in fifty, or in a hundred, or in a thousand, or in a hundred thousand, or in a koṭi, or in a hundred koṭis, or in a thousand koṭis, or in a hundred thousand koṭis, or in a hundred thousand nayutas, or in a hundred thousand quintillions of great trichiliocosms, or in even more than that, up to countless, immeasurable, incalculable great trichiliocosms, and manifests his own body to beings in all of them, in accordance with their inclinations, for the sake of their liberation.

original: evaṃ dve vā tisro vā catasro vā pañca vā daśa vā viṃśatirvā triṃśadvā catvāriṃśadvā pañcāśadvā śataṃ vā yāvadanabhilāpyā api trisāhasramahāsāhasrā lokadhātūḥ spharitvā sattvānāṃ svakāyaṃ / / /peyālaṃ / / /pratibhāsajñānānugamanatayā /
analyzed: evam dve vā tisraḥ vā catasraḥ vā pañca vā daśa vā viṃśatiḥ vā triṃśat vā catvāriṃśat vā pañcāśat vā śatam vā yāvat anabhilāpyāḥ api tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāḥ lokadhātūḥ spharitvā sattvānām sva kāyaṃpeya alaṃpratibhāsa jñāna anugamanatayā
translated: He manifests his own body to beings in two great trichiliocosms, or in three, or in four, or in five, or in ten, or in twenty, or in thirty, or in forty, or in fifty, or in a hundred, or in a thousand, or in a hundred thousand, or in a koṭi, or in a hundred koṭis, or in a thousand koṭis, or in a hundred thousand koṭis, or in a hundred thousand nayutas, or in a hundred thousand quintillions of great trichiliocosms, or in even more than that, up to countless, immeasurable, incalculable great trichiliocosms, and manifests his own body to beings in all of them, in accordance with their inclinations, for the sake of their liberation.

original: sa evaṃjñānasamanvāgato'syāṃ bhūmau supratiṣṭhita ekabuddhakṣetrācca na calati /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna samanvāgataḥ asyām bhūmau su pratiṣṭhitaḥ ekabuddhakṣetrāt ca na calati
translated: Endowed with such knowledge, well-established in this stage, he does not move from a single buddha-field.

original: anabhilāpyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu tathāgataparṣanmaṇḍaleṣu ca pratibhāsaprāpto bhavati //
analyzed: an abhilāpyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu tathāgata parṣad maṇḍaleṣu ca pratibhāsa prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: He attains the state of reflection in the assemblies of the Tathāgatas in inexpressibly many buddha-fields.

original: yādṛśī sattvānāṃ kāyavibhaktiśca varṇaliṅgasaṃsthānārohapariṇāhādhimuktyadhyāśayaśca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu teṣu ca parṣanmaṇḍaleṣu tatra tatra tathā tathā svakāyamādarśayati /
analyzed: yādṛśī sattvānām kāya vibhaktiḥ ca varṇa liṅga saṃsthāna āroha pariṇāha adhimukti adhyāśayaḥ ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu teṣu ca parṣad maṇḍaleṣu tatra tatra tathā tathā sva kāyam ādarśayati
translated: He displays his own body in various ways in those buddha-fields and assemblies, according to the distinctions in the bodies of beings, their colors, genders, forms, heights, circumferences, aspirations, and superior intentions.

analyzed: sa śramaṇa parṣad maṇḍaleṣu śramaṇa varṇa rūpam ādarśayati
translated: In assemblies of ascetics, he displays the form and appearance of an ascetic.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa parṣad maṇḍaleṣu brāhmaṇa varṇa rūpam ādarśayati
translated: In assemblies of brahmins, he displays the form and appearance of a brahmin.

original: iti hi bho jinaputra yāvanto'nabhilāpyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvānāmupapattyāyatanādhimuktiprasarāsteṣu tathatvāya svakāyavibhaktimādarśayati
analyzed: iti hi bho jinaputra yāvantaḥ an abhilāpyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvānām upapatti āyatana adhimukti prasarāḥ teṣu tathatvāya sva kāya vibhaktim ādarśayati
translated: Thus, O son of the Victorious Ones, in as many inconceivable Buddha-fields as there are realms of rebirth and aspirations of beings, he displays the manifestation of his own body for the sake of their reality.

original: sa sarvakāyavikalpāpagataḥ kāyasamatāprāptaḥ taccāsya kāyasaṃdarśanamakṣūṇamavandhyaṃ ca sattvaparipākavinayāya
analyzed: sa sarva kāya vikalpa apagataḥ kāya samatā prāptaḥ tat ca asya kāya saṃdarśanam akṣūṇam avandhyam ca sattva paripāka vinayāya
translated: He, being free from all conceptual thoughts of body and having attained the equality of body, and that manifestation of his body is not wasted or fruitless for the training and ripening of beings.

analyzed: sa sattva kāyam ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the realm of beings,

analyzed: kṣetra kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of fields,

analyzed: karma vipāka kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of the ripening of karma,

analyzed: śrāvaka kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of the hearers,

analyzed: pratyekabuddha kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of the solitary buddhas,

analyzed: bodhisattva kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of the bodhisattvas,

analyzed: tathāgata kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of the Tathagatas,

analyzed: jñāna kāyam ca
translated: and the realm of knowledge,

analyzed: dharmakāyam ca
translated: and the realm of the Dharma,

analyzed: ākāśa kāyam ca prajānāti
translated: and he knows the realm of space.

original: sa sattvānāṃ cittāśayābhinirhāramājñāya yathākālaparipākavinayānatikramādākāṅkṣan sattvakāyaṃ svakāyamadhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa sattvānām citta āśaya abhinirhāram ājñāya yathā kāla paripāka vinaya anatikramāt ākāṅkṣan sattva kāyam sva kāyam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Having understood the mental aspirations of beings and not transgressing the timely ripening and training, he, if he wishes, establishes the realm of beings in his own body.

analyzed: evam kṣetra kāyam karma vipāka kāyam ātma kāyam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, he establishes the realm of fields, the realm of the ripening of karma, and so on up to the realm of self in his own body.

original: sa sattvānāṃ cittāśayābhinirhāramājñāya yaṃ yameva kāyaṃ yasmin yasmin kāye ākāṅkṣati /
analyzed: sa sattvānām citta āśaya abhinirhāram ājñāya yam yam eva kāyam yasmin yasmin kāye ākāṅkṣati
translated: Knowing the thoughts and aspirations of beings, he manifests whatever body he wishes in whatever body.

original: taṃ tameva kāyaṃ tasmin tasmin kāye svakāyaṃ🔽adhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tam tam eva kāyam tasmin tasmin kāye sva kāyam  adhitiṣṭhati
translated: He manifests his own body in that body.

analyzed: sa sattva kāyānām karma kāya tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the bodies of beings as bodies of karma.

analyzed: vipāka kāya tām ca
translated: He knows the bodies of fruition.

analyzed: kleśa kāya tām ca  rūpa kāya tām ca
translated: He knows the bodies of afflictions.🔽He knows the bodies of form.

original: ārūpyakāyatāṃ ca prajānāti /🔽kṣetrakāyānāṃ parīttatāṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: ārūpya kāya tām ca prajānāti  kṣetra kāyānām parītta tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the bodies of the formless.

original: mahadgatatāṃ ca apramāṇatāṃ ca saṃkliṣṭatāṃ ca viśuddhatāṃ ca vyatyastatāṃ ca adhomūrdhatāṃ ca samatalatāṃ ca samavasaraṇatāṃ ca digjālavibhāgatāṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: mahadgata tām ca apramāṇa tām ca saṃkliṣṭa tām ca viśuddha tām ca vyatyasta tām ca adhas mūrdha tām ca sama tala tām ca samavasaraṇa tām ca diś jāla vibhāga tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the bodies of fields as limited, vast, immeasurable, defiled, pure, inverted, upside down, level, uniform, and the division of the net of directions.

analyzed: karma vipāka kāyānām vibhakti saṃketam prajānāti
translated: He knows the conventions of the division of bodies of the fruition of karma.

original: evaṃ śrāvakākāyānāṃ pratyekabuddhakāyānāṃ bodhisattvakāyānāṃ vibhaktisaṃketaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: evam śrāvaka akāyānām pratyekabuddha kāyānām bodhisattva kāyānām vibhakti saṃketam prajānāti
translated: Thus he knows the conventions of the division of bodies of disciples, bodies of solitary realizers, and bodies of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tathāgata kāyānām abhisaṃbodhi kāya tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the bodies of the Thus Gone Ones as bodies of complete enlightenment.

analyzed: praṇidhāna kāya tām ca
translated: He knows the bodies of aspirations.

analyzed: nirmāṇa kāya tām ca
translated: the emanation body,

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna kāya tām ca
translated: the empowered body,

analyzed: rūpa lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana vicitra alaṃkāra kāya tām ca
translated: the body adorned with various marks and signs,

analyzed: prabhā kāya tām ca
translated: the body of light,

analyzed: manaḥ maya kāya tām ca
translated: the mind-made body,

analyzed: puṇya kāya tām ca
translated: the body of merit,

analyzed: jñāna kāya tām ca
translated: the body of knowledge,

analyzed: dharma kāya tām ca prajānāti
translated: and the Dharma body.

analyzed: jñāna kāyānām su vicārita tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the thorough investigation of the bodies of knowledge,

original: yathāvannistīraṇatāṃ ca phalaprayogasaṃgṛhītatāṃ ca laukikalokottaravibhāgatāṃ ca triyāṇavyavasthānatāṃ ca sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇatāṃ ca nairyāṇikānairyāṇikatāṃ ca śaikṣāśaikṣatāṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: yathāvat nistīraṇa tām ca phala prayoga saṃgṛhīta tām ca laukika lokottara vibhāga tām ca triyāṇa vyavasthāna tām ca sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa tām ca nairyāṇika anairyāṇika tām ca śaikṣa aśaikṣa tām ca prajānāti
translated: the thorough analysis as it is, the inclusion of the result and application, the division into mundane and supramundane, the establishment of the three vehicles, the common and uncommon, the definitive and non-definitive, and the trained and untrained.

analyzed: dharmakāyānām sama tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the equality of the Dharma bodies,

original: avikopanatāṃ ca avasthānasaṃketasaṃvṛttivyavasthānatāṃ ca sattvāsattvadharmavyavasthānatāṃ ca buddhadharmāryasaṃghavyavasthānatāṃ ca prajānāti
analyzed: avikopana tām ca avasthāna saṃketa saṃvṛtti vyavasthāna tām ca sattva asattva dharma vyavasthāna tām ca buddha dharma ārya saṃgha vyavasthāna tām ca prajānāti
translated: the imperturbability, the establishment of the conventional designations of the abodes, the establishment of sentient beings and non-sentient phenomena, and the establishment of the Buddha, Dharma, and noble Sangha.

original: ākāśakāyānāmapramāṇatāṃ ca sarvatrānugatatāṃ ca aśarīratāṃ ca avitathānantatāṃ ca rūpakāyābhivyaktitāṃ ca prajānāti //
analyzed: ākāśa kāyānām apramāṇa tām ca sarvatra anugata tām ca aśarīra tām ca avitatha ananta tām ca rūpa kāya abhivyakti tām ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the immeasurability of the bodies of space, their all-pervasiveness, their incorporeality, their non-deceptive infinity, and their manifestation as form bodies.

original: sa evaṃ kāyajñānābhinirhāraprāpto vaśavartī bhavati sarvasattveṣu /
analyzed: saḥ evam kāya jñāna abhinirhāra prāptaḥ vaśavartī bhavati sarva sattveṣu
translated: Having attained the realization of this knowledge of the body, he becomes a master over all beings.

analyzed: āyuḥ vaśitām ca pratilabhate na abhilāpya anabhilāpya kalpa āyuḥ pramāṇa adhiṣṭhāna tayā
translated: He attains mastery over life, by abiding in the immeasurable and inexpressible lifespan.

analyzed: cetaḥ vaśitām ca pratilabhate pramāṇa asaṃkhyeya samādhi nidhi apti jñāna praveśa tayā
translated: He attains mastery over mind, by entering the knowledge of the meditative absorptions of immeasurable and innumerable [beings].

analyzed: pariṣkāra vaśitām ca sarva lokadhātu aneka vyūha alaṃkāra pratimaṇḍita adhiṣṭhāna saṃdarśana tayā
translated: He attains mastery over resources, by manifesting the adornments of various arrays in all world systems.

analyzed: karma vaśitām ca yathākālam karma vipāka adhiṣṭhāna saṃdarśana tayā
translated: He attains mastery over action, by manifesting the results of actions at the appropriate time.

original: upapattivaśitāṃ ca sarvalokadhātūpapattisaṃdarśanatayā adhimuktisaṃdarśanatayā sarvalokadhātubuddhapratipūrṇasaṃdarśanatayā praṇidhānasaṃdarśanatayā yatheṣṭabuddhakṣetrakālābhisaṃbodhisaṃdarśanatayā ṛddhisaṃdarśanatayā sarvabuddhakṣetraṛddhivikurvaṇasaṃdarśanatayā dharmasaṃdarśanatayā anantamadhyadharmamukhālokasaṃdarśanatayā jñānasaṃdarśanatayā tathāgatabalavaiśāradyāveṇikabuddhadharmalakṣaṇānuvyañjanābhisaṃbodhisaṃdarśanatayā //
analyzed: upapatti vaśitām ca sarva lokadhātu upapatti saṃdarśana tayā adhimukti saṃdarśana tayā sarva lokadhātu buddha pratipūrṇa saṃdarśana tayā praṇidhāna saṃdarśana tayā yatheṣṭa buddhakṣetra kāla abhisaṃbodhi saṃdarśana tayā ṛddhi saṃdarśana tayā sarva buddhakṣetra ṛddhi vikurvaṇa saṃdarśana tayā dharma saṃdarśana tayā ananta madhya dharma mukha āloka saṃdarśana tayā jñāna saṃdarśana tayā tathāgata bala vaiśāradya āveṇika buddha dharma
translated: The power of rebirth, by manifesting rebirth in all world systems, by manifesting aspirations, by manifesting all world systems filled with buddhas, by manifesting prayers, by manifesting the attainment of enlightenment at the appropriate time in the buddha-field of one’s choice, by manifesting miraculous powers, by manifesting all the miraculous transformations in the buddha-fields, by manifesting the Dharma, by manifesting the infinite and boundless light of the Dharma, and by manifesting knowledge, by manifesting the realization of the characteristics, minor marks, powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of the tathāgatas.

original: sa āsāṃ daśānāṃ bodhisattvavaśitānāṃ sahapratilambhena acintyajñānī ca bhavati atulyajñānī ca aprameyajñānī ca vipulajñānī ca asaṃhāryajñānī ca bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ āsām daśānām bodhisattva vaśitānām saha pratilambhena acintya jñānī ca bhavati atulya jñānī ca aprameya jñānī ca vipula jñānī ca asaṃhārya jñānī ca bhavati
translated: He, having attained these ten powers of a bodhisattva, becomes one of inconceivable knowledge, one of incomparable knowledge, one of immeasurable knowledge, one of vast knowledge, and one of irreproachable knowledge.

original: tasyaivaṃbhūmyanugatasya evaṃ jñānasamanvāgatasya atyantāgavadyaḥ kāyakarmasamudācāraḥ pravartate /
analyzed: tasya evaṃbhūmi anugatasya evam jñāna samanvāgatasya atyanta agavadyaḥ kāya karma samudācāraḥ pravartate
translated: For him who has thus attained the stage and is endowed with such knowledge, the manifestation of bodily action is absolutely irreproachable.

analyzed: atyanta anavadyaḥ ca vāc
translated: His speech is absolutely irreproachable.

analyzed: atyanta anavadyaḥ ca manaḥsamudācāraḥ pravartate
translated: His mental activity is absolutely irreproachable.

analyzed: jñāna pūrvaṃgamaḥ jñāna anuparivartī prajñāpāramitā ādhipateyaḥ mahā karuṇā pūrvakaḥ upāya kauśalya su vibhaktaḥ praṇidhāna su abhinirhṛtaḥ tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna su adhiṣṭhita upratiprasrabdha sattva artha prayoga uparyanta lokadhātu vibhakti gataḥ
translated: It proceeds with knowledge as its vanguard, accompanied by knowledge, governed by the perfection of wisdom, preceded by great compassion, well-differentiated by skillful means, accomplished by vows, well-blessed by the empowerment of the Tathāgatas, uninterrupted in its application to the welfare of beings, and extends to the differentiation of infinite world systems.

original: samāsato bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya imāmacalāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāptasya sarvabuddhadharmasamudānayanāya kāyavāṅmanaskarmasamudācāraḥ pravartate /
analyzed: samāsatas bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya imām acalām bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptasya sarva buddha dharma samudānayanāya kāya vāc manaḥ karma samudācāraḥ pravartate
translated: In brief, O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who has attained this immovable bodhisattva stage engages in the conduct of body, speech, and mind in order to gather all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: sa evamimāmacalāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāptaḥ supratiṣṭhitāśayabalaśca bhavati sarvakleśasamudācārāpagatatvāt /
analyzed: saḥ evam imām acalām bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptaḥ su pratiṣṭhita āśaya balaḥ ca bhavati sarva kleśa samudācāra apagata tvāt
translated: Having attained this immovable bodhisattva stage, he becomes one whose power of well-established intention is unshakable, due to being free from all mental afflictions and their activity.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhita adhyāśaya balaḥ ca bhavati mārga a vipravāsita tvāt
translated: He becomes one whose power of well-established superior intention is unshakable, due to not straying from the path.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā bala su pratiṣṭhitaḥ ca bhavati sattva artha an utsarga tvāt
translated: He becomes one whose power of well-established great compassion is unshakable, due to not abandoning the welfare of beings.
The power of great loving-kindness... because of protecting all beings.

analyzed: dhāraṇī bala a saṃpramoṣa dharma tvāt
translated: The power of retention... because of the Dharma of non-forgetfulness.

analyzed: pratibhāna bala sarva buddha dharma pravicaya vibhāga kuśala tvāt
translated: The power of eloquence... because of skillfully discerning and distinguishing all the teachings of the Buddhas.

analyzed: abhijñā bala aparyanta lokadhātu caryā vibhāga kuśala tvāt
translated: The power of the higher knowledges... because of skillfully discerning activities in limitless world systems.

analyzed: praṇidhāna bala sarva bodhisattva kriyā an utsarga tvāt
translated: The power of vows... because of not abandoning the practices of all bodhisattvas.

analyzed: pāramitā bala sarva buddha dharma samudānayana tvāt
translated: The power of the perfections... because of gathering all the teachings of the Buddhas.

analyzed: tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna bala sarva ākāra sarva jñāna abhimukha tvāt
translated: The power of the blessings of the Tathagatas... because of facing all aspects of omniscience.

analyzed: saḥ evam bala ādhāna prāptaḥ sarva kriyāḥ ca saṃdarśayati
translated: Having attained such powers, he displays all activities.

analyzed: sarva kriyāsu ca anavadyaḥ bhavati anupaliptaḥ ca
translated: And he is irreproachable and unstained in all activities.

original: iyaṃ bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya aṣṭamī jñānabhūmiracaletyucyate'saṃhāryatvāt /
analyzed: iyam bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya aṣṭamī jñāna bhūmiḥ acalā iti ucyate saṃhārya tvāt
translated: Son of the Victorious Ones, this is the eighth stage of the bodhisattva, called Immovable, because it cannot be surpassed.

analyzed: avivartya bhūmiḥ iti ucyate jñāna a vivartya tvāt
translated: It is called the stage of irreversibility, because the knowledge cannot be turned back.

analyzed: durāsada bhūmiḥ iti ucyate sarva jagat durjñāna tvāt
translated: It is called the difficult to conquer stage, because it is difficult for the whole world to know.

analyzed: kumāra bhūmiḥ iti ucyate anavadya tvāt
translated: It is called the stage of the youth, because it is irreproachable.

analyzed: janma bhūmiḥ iti ucyate yathā abhiprāya vaśavarti tvāt
translated: The stage of birth is so called because it is subject to one's own intention.

analyzed: pariniṣpanna bhūmiḥ iti ucyate a punar kārya tvāt
translated: The stage of completion is so called because there is nothing more to be done.

analyzed: pariniṣṭhita bhūmiḥ iti ucyate
translated: The stage of perfection is so called.

analyzed: sukṛta jñāna vicaya tvāt
translated: Because it is well-known and well-investigated.

analyzed: nirmāṇabhūmiḥ iti ucyate su abhinirhṛta praṇidhāna tvāt
translated: The stage of manifestation is so called because it is accomplished by one's own vow.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna bhūmiḥ iti ucyate
translated: The stage of basis is so called.

analyzed: parā vikopana tvāt
translated: Because it is not disturbed by others.

analyzed: anābhogabhūmiḥ iti ucyate pūrva anta abhinirhṛta tvāt
translated: The stage of non-effort is so called because it is accomplished in the past.

original: evaṃ jñānasvabhinirhṛtaḥ khalu punarbho jinaputra bodhisattvo buddhagotrānugato buddhaguṇaprabhāvabhāsitastathāgateryāpathacaryācāritrānugato buddhaviṣayābhimukhaḥ satatasamitaṃ svadhiṣṭhitatathāgatādhiṣṭhānaśca bhavati śakrabrahmalokapālapratyudgataśca vajrapāṇisatatānubaddhaśca samādhibalānutsṛṣṭaśca ca apramāṇakāyavibhaktyabhinirhṛtaśca sarvakāyacaryābalopagataśca mahābhijñāvipākapariniṣpannaśca anantasamādhivaśavartī ca apramāṇavyākaraṇapratyeṣakaśca yathāparipavakkajagadabhisaṃbodhinidarśakaśca bhavati /
analyzed: evam jñāna su abhinirhṛtaḥ khalu punar bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ buddha gotra anugataḥ buddha guṇa prabhāva bhāsitaḥ tathāgata īryāpatha caryā cāritra anugataḥ buddha viṣaya abhimukhaḥ satata samitam su adhiṣṭhita tathāgata adhiṣṭhānaḥ ca bhavati śakra brahma lokapāla pratyudgataḥ ca vajrapāṇi satata anubaddhaḥ ca samādhi bala anutsṛṣṭaḥ ca ca apramāṇa kāya vibhakti abhinirhṛtaḥ ca sarva kāya caryā bala upagataḥ ca mahā abhijñā vipāk
translated: “Thus, O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who is born from the essence of wisdom, who is in the lineage of the buddhas, who is illuminated by the power and qualities of the buddhas, who follows the conduct and way of life of the tathāgatas, who is oriented toward the domain of the buddhas, who is constantly and always empowered by the tathāgatas, who is welcomed by Śakra, Brahmā, and the world protectors, who is always accompanied by Vajrapāṇi, who is never separated from the power of samādhi, who is born from the manifestation of immeasurable bodily distinctions, who has attained the power of all bodily conduct, who is perfected through the ripening of great higher knowledge, who has mastery over infinite samādhis, who is the recipient of immeasurable prophecies, who manifests the complete and perfect enlightenment of the world in accordance with the world’s readiness for the teachings—

original: sa evaṃ jñānabhūmyanugato mahāyānamaṇḍalānupraviṣṭaḥ suvicāritamahājñānābhijñaḥ satatasamitaṃ pramuktaprajñālokaraśmirasaṅgadharmadhātupathāvatīrṇo lokadhātupathavibhaktikovidaḥ sarvākāraguṇasaṃdarśakaḥ svacittotpādavaśavartī pūrvāntāparāntasuvicitajñānaḥ sarvamārapathāvartanavivartanajñānānugataḥ sarvatathāgataviṣayagocarānupraviṣṭo'paryantalokadhātuprasareṣu bodhisattvacaryāṃ caratyapratyudāvartyayogena /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna bhūmi anugataḥ mahāyāna maṇḍala anupraviṣṭaḥ su vicārita mahā jñāna abhijñaḥ satata samitam pramukta prajñā loka raśmiḥ asaṅga dharmadhātu patha avatīrṇaḥ lokadhātu patha vibhakti kovidaḥ sarva ākāra guṇa saṃdarśakaḥ sva citta utpāda vaśavartī pūrva anta apara anta su vicita jñānaḥ sarva māra patha āvartana vivartana jñāna anugataḥ sarva tathāgata viṣaya gocara anupraviṣṭa upari anta lokadhātu prasareṣu bodhisattva ca
translated: Thus, having attained the stage of wisdom, having entered the maṇḍala of the Great Vehicle, having great wisdom and supernormal knowledge well-investigated, always having the light-rays of the wisdom of liberation, having entered the path of the unobstructed Dharma realm, skilled in the divisions of the paths of the world realms, showing all aspects of qualities, having mastery over the arising of his own mind, with the knowledge of well-investigating the past and future, following the knowledge of turning back and reversing all the paths of Māra, having entered the domain and sphere of all Tathāgatas, he practices the conduct of a bodhisattva in the world realms that extend to infinity, without turning back.

analyzed: tatas ucyate bodhisattva ucalām bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, it is said that the bodhisattva who has attained the immovable bodhisattva stage is called a bodhisattva.

original: tatra bho jinaputra acalāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāpto bodhisattvaḥ satatasamitamaparyantatathāgatadarśanāvirahito bhavati samādhibalasvabhinirhṛtatvāt
analyzed: tatra bho jinaputra acalām bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptaḥ bodhisattvaḥ satata samitam aparyanta tathāgata darśana avirahitaḥ bhavati samādhi bala su abhinirhṛta tvāt
translated: There, O son of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who has attained the immovable bodhisattva stage is always and constantly inseparable from seeing the limitless Tathāgatas, because he has accomplished the power of samādhi.

analyzed: audārikam buddha darśana pūjā upasthānam na utsṛjati
translated: He does not abandon the coarse worship and service of seeing the Buddhas.

original: sa ekaikasmin kalpe ekaikasmin lokadhātuprasare anekān buddhān /
analyzed: saḥ ekaikasmin kalpe ekaikasmin lokadhātu prasare anekān buddhān
translated: In each eon, in the expansion of each world-system, he honors many buddhas,

original: anekāni buddhaśatāni / / /peyālaṃ / / /anekāni buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi satkaroti gurukaroti mānayati pūjayati sarvākārapūjābhinirhāraṃ copasaṃharati
analyzed: anekāni buddha śatāni peyālam anekāni buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi satkaroti gurukaroti mānayati pūjayati sarva ākāra pūjā abhinirhāram ca upasaṃharati
translated: many hundreds of buddhas, and so on up to: many hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of buddhas, he worships, he attends upon, he reveres, he honors, and he offers them everything that could be offered.

analyzed: tān ca tathāgatān paryupāste
translated: He attends upon those Tathāgatas.

analyzed: lokadhātu vibhakti pūrvakam ca dharma āloka upasaṃhāram pratīcchati
translated: He receives the teaching of the light of the Dharma, preceded by the division of the world-systems.

original: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā tathāgatadharmakośaprāpto'saṃhāryo bhavati lokadhātuparipṛcchānirdeśeṣu /
analyzed: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā tathāgata dharma kośa prāpta usaṃhāryaḥ bhavati lokadhātu paripṛcchā nirdeśeṣu
translated: He becomes even more unassailable in the explanations of the questions about the world-systems, having attained the treasure of the Dharma of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: tāni ca asya kuśala mūlāni anekān kalpān uttapyante
translated: And those roots of goodness of his burn for many eons.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra tadeva jātarūpaṃ supariniṣṭhitaṃ kuśalena karmāreṇa suparikarmakṛtaṃ jambūdvīpasvāminaḥ kaṇṭhe śirasi vā ābaddhamasaṃhāryaṃ bhavati sarvajambūdvīpakānāṃ sattvānāmābharaṇavikṛtaiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra tat eva jātarūpam su pariniṣṭhitam kuśalena karmāreṇa su parikarma kṛtam jambūdvīpa svāminaḥ kaṇṭhe śirasi vā ābaddham asaṃhāryam bhavati sarva jambūdvīpakānām sattvānām ābharaṇa vikṛtaiḥ
translated: Just as, O son of the victorious ones, that very gold, well-finished by a skillful goldsmith, well-worked, is bound on the neck or head of the lord of Jambudvīpa, and cannot be surpassed by the ornaments of all the beings in Jambudvīpa,

original: evameva bho jinaputra asyāmacalāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśalamūlānyasaṃhāryāṇi bhavanti sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhairyāvatsaptamībhūmisthitaiśca bodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra asyām acalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśala mūlāni asaṃhāryāṇi bhavanti sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ yāvat saptamī bhūmi sthitaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: In the same way, son of the Victorious Ones, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is in this Immovable bodhisattva bhumi cannot be taken away by all the shravakas and pratyekabuddhas, up to those bodhisattvas who are in the seventh bhumi.

original: imāṃ ca bhūmimanugatasya bodhisattvasya mahatī prajñājñānaprabhā sattvānāṃ kleśatamāṃsi praśamayati suvibhaktajñānamukhābhinirhāratayā /
analyzed: imām ca bhūmim anugatasya bodhisattvasya mahatī prajñā jñāna prabhā sattvānām kleśa tamāṃsi praśamayati suvibhakta jñāna mukha abhinirhāra tayā
translated: And when the bodhisattva has entered this bhumi, the great light of wisdom and knowledge of the bodhisattva pacifies the darkness of afflictions of beings through the accomplishment of the door of well-distinguished knowledge.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra sāhasriko mahābrahmā sāhasra lokadhātuṃ maitryā spharitvā prabhayāvabhāsayati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra sāhasrikaḥ mahābrahmā sāhasra lokadhātum maitryā spharitvā prabhayā avabhāsayati
translated: Just as, son of the Victorious Ones, the great Brahma of the Sahasra-world-system, having pervaded the Sahasra-world-system with friendliness, illuminates it with light.

original: evameva bho jinaputra bodhisattvo'syāmacalāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito yāvaddaśabuddhakṣetraśatasahasraparamāṇurajaḥsamān lokadhātūn mahatā maitryavabhāsena spharitvā sattvānāṃ kleśaparidāhānanupūrveṇa praśamayati /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ usyām acalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ yāvat daśa buddhakṣetra śata sahasra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn mahatā maitrī avabhāsena spharitvā sattvānām kleśa paridāha ananupūrveṇa praśamayati
translated: In the same way, son of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who is in this Immovable bodhisattva bhumi, having pervaded up to ten billion world-realms equal to the atoms of ten billion buddha-fields with the great radiance of friendliness, gradually pacifies the burning of afflictions of beings.

analyzed: āśrayān ca prahlādayati
translated: And he delights the abodes.

original: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ praṇidhānapāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ praṇidhāna pāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati
translated: Of his ten perfections, the perfection of vows becomes preeminent,

original: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudāgacchati yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudāgacchati yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: but he does not neglect the other perfections, practicing them to the best of his ability and as much as he can.

original: iyaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvasya acalā nāma aṣṭamī bodhisattvabhūmiḥ samāsanirdeśataḥ /
analyzed: iyam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya acalā nāma aṣṭamī bodhisattva bhūmiḥ samāsa nirdeśataḥ
translated: This, good sons of the Victorious Ones, is the eighth bodhisattva stage called The Immovable, taught in brief.

analyzed: vistaraśaḥ punar aparyanta kalpa nirdeśa niṣṭhā atas anugantavyā
translated: It should be understood in detail as it is taught in the sutra, which is limitless in scope.

original: yasyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo bhūyastvena mahābrahmā bhavati sāhasrādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: yasyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyastvena mahā brahmā bhavati sāhasra adhipatiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in this stage becomes, for the most part, a great Brahma, the lord of a thousand worlds.

original: abhibhūranabhibhūto'nvarthadarśī vaśiprāptaḥ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānāṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhabodhisattvapāramitopadeśopasaṃhāreṣu asaṃhāryo lokadhātuvibhaktiparipṛcchānirdeśeṣu /
analyzed: abhibhūḥ anabhibhūtaḥ anvarthadarśī vaśiprāptaḥ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattva pāramitā upadeśa upasaṃhāreṣu asaṃhāryaḥ lokadhātu vibhakti paripṛcchā nirdeśeṣu
translated: He is a conqueror, unconquered, a seer of reality, one who has attained mastery, accomplished, a lord, in all the teachings of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, in the compilation of the Dharma, and in the explanation of the distinctions of world systems and the answers to questions.

analyzed: yat ca kiṃcid  acalā nāma aṣṭamī bhūmiḥ
translated: And whatever...🔽The eighth stage is called The Immovable.

analyzed: sādhumatī nāma navamī bhūmiḥ
translated: The ninth stage is called The Excellent One.

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha yo'yaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattva evamapramāṇajñeyavicāritayā buddhyā bhūyaścottarān śāntān vimokṣānadhyavasyan adhyālambamānaḥ bhūyaścottaraṃ tathāgatajñānaṃ susamāptaṃ vicārayan tathāgataguhyānupraveśaṃ cāvataran acintyajñānamāhātmyaṃ ca pravicinvan dhāraṇīsamādhipravicayaṃ ca pariśodhayan abhijñāvaipulyaṃ cābhinirharan lokadhātuvibhaktiṃ cānugacchan tathāgatabalavaiśādyāveṇikabuddhadharmāsaṃhāryatāṃ ca parikarmayan tathāgatadharmacakrapravartanavṛṣabhatāṃ cānukramamāṇaḥ mahākaruṇādhiṣṭhānapratilambhaṃ cānutsṛjan navamīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimākramati so'syāṃ sādhumatyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitaḥ kuśalākuśalāvyākṛtadharmābhisaṃskāraṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yaḥ yam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ evam apramāṇa jñeya vicāritayā buddhyā bhūyas ca uttarān śāntān vimokṣān adhyavasyan adhyālambamānaḥ bhūyas ca uttaram tathāgata jñānam su samāptam vicārayan tathāgata guhya anupraveśam ca avataran acintya jñāna māhātmyam ca pravicinvan dhāraṇī samādhi pravicayam ca pariśodhayan abhijñā vaipulyam ca abhinirharan lokadhātu vibhaktim ca anugacchan tathāgata bala vaiśādya āveṇika
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said, “Good men, sons of the victorious ones, when a bodhisattva, with such an immeasurable and discerning intellect, further aspires to the tranquil liberations, and, aspiring and relying on them, further aspires to the well-completed knowledge of the Tathāgata, enters the secrets of the Tathāgata, penetrates the greatness of inconceivable knowledge, purifies the discernment of dhāraṇīs and samādhis, manifests the vastness of the superknowledges, follows the distinctions of world systems, purifies the Tathāgata's powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of a buddha, gradually turns the wheel of the Dharma of the Tathāgata, and does not abandon the attainment of the basis of great compassion, he enters the ninth bodhisattva stage. Abiding in this Good Wisdom bodhisattva stage, he knows as it truly is the formation of skillful, unskillful, and neutral dharmas.

analyzed: sa āsrava anāsrava dharma abhisaṃskāram ca
translated: The formative activity of dharmas with and without impurity...

analyzed: laukika lokottara dharma abhisaṃskāram ca  cintya acintya dharma abhisaṃskāram ca
translated: The formative activity of mundane and supramundane dharmas...🔽The formative activity of conceivable and inconceivable dharmas...

analyzed: niyata aniyata dharma abhisaṃskāram ca
translated: The formative activity of determined and undetermined dharmas...

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha dharma abhisaṃskāram ca
translated: The formative activity of the dharmas of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas...

analyzed: bodhisattva caryā dharma abhisaṃskāram ca
translated: The formative activity of the dharmas of bodhisattva conduct...

analyzed: tathāgata bhūmi dharma abhisaṃskāram ca  saṃskṛta dharma abhisaṃskāram ca
translated: The formative activity of the dharmas of the stage of a tathāgata...🔽The formative activity of conditioned dharmas...

analyzed: a saṃskṛta dharma abhisaṃskāram ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: The formative activity of unconditioned dharmas...

original: sa evaṃjñānānugatayā buddhyā sattvacittagahanopacāraṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna anugatayā buddhyā sattva citta gahana upacāram ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He thus knows as it truly is the conduct of the depths of the minds of beings, following with his wisdom that knowledge.

analyzed: kleśa gahana upacāram ca
translated: The conduct of the depths of afflictions...

analyzed: karma gahana upacāram ca  indriya gahana upacāram ca  adhimukti gahana upacāram ca
translated: The conduct of the depths of karma...🔽The conduct of the depths of faculties...🔽The conduct of the depths of inclinations...

analyzed: dhātu gahana upacāram ca  āśaya anuśaya gahana upacāram ca  upapatti gahana upacāram ca
translated: The conduct of the depths of elements...🔽The conduct of the depths of intentions and latent tendencies...🔽The conduct of the depths of rebirths...

analyzed: vāsanā anusaṃdhi gahana upacāram ca
translated: The conduct of the depths of traces and connections...

analyzed: tri rāśi vyavasthāna gahana upacāram ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the profundity of the arrangement of the three heaps.

original: sa sattvānāṃ cittavaimātratāṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa sattvānām citta vaimātra tām ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the variety of beings' minds.

original: cittavicitratāṃ ca cittakṣaṇalaghuparivartabhaṅgabhaṅgatāṃ ca cittaśarīratāṃ ca cittānantyasarvataḥprabhūtatāṃ ca cittaprabhāsvaratāṃ ca cittasaṃkleśaniḥkleśatāṃ ca cittabandhavimokṣatāṃ ca cittamāyāviṭhapanatāṃ ca cittayathāgatipratyupasthānatāṃ ca yāvadanekāni cittanānātvasahasrāṇi yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti sa kleśānāṃ dūrānugatatāṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: citta vicitra tām ca citta kṣaṇa laghu parivarta bhaṅga bhaṅga tām ca citta śarīra tām ca citta ānantya sarvatas prabhūta tām ca citta prabhāsvara tām ca citta saṃkleśa niḥkleśa tām ca citta bandha vimokṣa tām ca citta māyā viṭhapana tām ca citta yathāgati pratyupasthāna tām ca yāvat anekāni citta nānātva sahasrāṇi yathābhūtam prajānāti sa kleśānām dūra anugata tām ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the variety of minds, the momentary rapid changes and breakages of mind, the body of mind, the infinity of mind, the abundance of mind in all places, the luminosity of mind, the defilement and non-defilement of mind, the bondage and liberation of mind, the illusory nature of mind, the presence of mind according to its past actions, and so on up to the many thousands of varieties of mind. He knows as it truly is the long-standing nature of the mental afflictions.

analyzed: prayoga ananta tām ca  sahaja avinirbhāga tām ca
translated: He knows as it truly is the infinity of their application.🔽He knows as it truly is their inseparability from the innate.

analyzed: anuśaya paryutthāna eka artha tām ca
translated: He knows as it truly is their single purpose in terms of latent tendencies and manifest afflictions.

analyzed: citta saṃprayoga asaṃprayoga tām ca
translated: He knows as it truly is their association and non-association with the mind.

analyzed: upapatti saṃdhi yathāgati pratyupasthāna tām ca
translated: He knows as it truly is their presence according to the rebirth process and past actions.

analyzed: traidhātuka vibhakti tām ca
translated: He knows as it truly is their division into the three realms.

analyzed: tṛṣṇā vidyā dṛṣṭi śalya māna mahā sāvadya tām ca
translated: The great faults of the stakes of craving, ignorance, and views,

analyzed: trividha karmaṇi dāna anupaccheda tām ca
translated: And the non-interruption of giving in the three kinds of actions.

analyzed: samāsatas yāvat caturaśīti kleśa carita nānātva sahasra anupraveśa tām ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: In brief, he knows as it truly is the penetration of the manifoldness of the eighty-four thousand kinds of conduct of the defilements.

analyzed: sa karmaṇām kuśala akuśala avyākṛta tām ca
translated: He knows the wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate nature of actions,

analyzed: vijñapti avijñapti tām ca
translated: The nature of being expressed and unexpressed,

analyzed: citta sahaja avinirbhāga tām ca
translated: The co-arising with the mind and inseparability,

analyzed: sva rasa kṣaṇa kṣīṇa bhaṅga upacaya a vipraṇāśa phala anusaṃdhi tām ca
translated: The momentary destruction, disintegration, accumulation, and non-perishing of results,

analyzed: vipāka vipāka tām ca kṛṣṇa śukla a kṛṣṇa śukla aneka deśa karma samādāna vaimātra tām ca
translated: The nature of having ripening and not having ripening, the manifoldness of taking up black, white, and mixed actions,

analyzed: karma kṣetra apramāṇa tām ca  ārya laukika pravibhakti tām ca
translated: The immeasurability of the field of actions,🔽The distinction between the noble and the worldly,

analyzed: lokottara dharma vyavasthāna tām ca
translated: The establishment of supramundane dharmas,

analyzed: sa upādāna anupādāna tām ca
translated: The nature of having and not having clinging,

analyzed: saṃskṛta a saṃskṛta tām ca  dṛṣṭa dharma upapadya apara paryāya vedanīya tām ca
translated: The nature of being conditioned and unconditioned.🔽The nature of being experienced in this life, in the next birth, or in subsequent lives,
