translated: In accordance with the distinctions of inclinations, in accordance with the distinctions of latent tendencies, in accordance with the distinctions of faculties, in accordance with the distinctions of dispositions, in accordance with the knowledge of the arrangement of spheres of activity, in accordance with the knowledge of all spheres of activity, in accordance with the conformity with the conduct of the various realms, in accordance with the conformity with the latent tendencies of afflictions and actions according to birth and rebirth, in accordance with the conformity with the arrangement of groups, in accordance with the attainment of liberation through the resolve for the various vehicles, and in accordance with the manifestation of bodies with infinite colors and the manifestation of agreeable voices in all world systems, in accordance with the complete knowledge of all sounds and voices, and in accordance with skill in the ascertainment of all analytical knowledges, he teaches the Dharma.

translated: By means of the analytical knowledge of eloquence, he teaches each word of the Dharma without interruption for endless eons.

original: arthapratisaṃvidā caturaśītisattvacaritasahasrāṇāṃ yathāśayaṃ yathendriyaṃ yathādhimuktivibhaktitastathāgataghoṣaṃ prajānati /

translated: By means of the analytical knowledge of language, he teaches by means of the voice of the Tathāgata, which resounds according to the various practices of all beings.

translated: By means of the analytical knowledge of eloquence, he teaches the Dharma by means of the light of the wisdom of the Tathāgata, which is the circle of practices and aspirations.

original: sa evaṃ pratisaṃvidā jñānābhinirhārakuśalo bho jinaputra bodhisattvo navamīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāptastathāgatadharmakośaprāpto mahādharmabhāṇakatvaṃ ca kurvāṇaḥ arthavatīdhāraṇīpratilabdhaśca bhavati /

translated: Thus, O son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva, skilled in the accomplishment of knowledge through discernment, having attained the ninth Bodhisattva stage, having obtained the treasury of the Tathagata's Dharma and acting as a great Dharma preacher, also attains the retention of meaningful words.

analyzed: ananta
translated: The infinite.

original: vicitrārthakośa / / / /🔽sa evamādīnāṃ dhāraṇīpadānāṃ paripūrṇāni daśadhāraṇīmukhāsaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrāṇi pratilabhate /
analyzed: vicitra artha kośa  saḥ evamādīnām dhāraṇī padānām paripūrṇāni daśa dhāraṇī mukha asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi pratilabhate
translated: The treasury of various meanings.🔽He attains a full one hundred thousand asaṃkhyeya retentions of these and other such retentions.

original: tathā asaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrānugatenaiva svarāṅgakauśalyena tāvadapramāṇānugatenaiva pratibhānavibhaktimukhena dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: tathā asaṃkhyeya śata sahasra anugatena eva svara aṅga kauśalyena tāvat apramāṇa anugatena eva pratibhāna vibhakti mukhena dharmam deśayati
translated: And he teaches the Dharma with a skill in the parts of speech that is attended by a hundred thousand asaṃkhyeyas, and with a door of the manifestation of eloquence that is attended by immeasurables.

original: sa evamapramāṇairdhāraṇīmukhāsaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrairdaśasu dikṣu aprameyāṇāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśāddharmaṃ śṛṇoti /
analyzed: saḥ evam apramāṇaiḥ dhāraṇī mukha asaṃkhyeya śata sahasraiḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyāṇām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇoti
translated: He hears the Dharma from the Blessed Buddhas in the ten directions through countless hundreds of thousands of immeasurable dhāraṇī gateways.

analyzed: śrutvā ca na vismārayati
translated: Having heard it, he does not forget it.

analyzed: yathāśrutam ca a pramāṇa vibhaktitaḥ evam nirdiśati
translated: And as he has heard it, he teaches it with immeasurable analysis.

analyzed: saḥ ekasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt daśabhiḥ dhāraṇī mukha asaṃkhyeya śata sahasraiḥ dharmān paryavāpnoti
translated: He comprehends the Dharma from one Tathāgata through countless hundreds of thousands of ten dhāraṇī gateways.

analyzed: yathā ca ekasya
translated: And just as from one,

analyzed: evam aparyantānām tathāgatānām
translated: so also from countless Tathāgatas.

analyzed: sa praṇidhāna mātreṇa bahutaram samyaksaṃbuddha sakāśāt dharma mukha ālokam saṃpratīcchati
translated: He receives the light of the Dharma from many Perfectly Awakened Ones merely through his vow,

original: na tveva mahābāhuśrutyaprāptaḥ śrāvakaḥ śrutodgrahaṇadhāraṇīpratilabdhaḥ kalpaśatasahasrodgrahaṇādhiṣṭhānena /
analyzed: na tu eva mahā bāhu śrutya prāptaḥ śrāvakaḥ śruta udgrahaṇa dhāraṇī pratilabdhaḥ kalpa śata sahasra udgrahaṇa adhiṣṭhānena
translated: but not so the Śrāvaka who has attained great learning and obtained the dhāraṇī of memorizing what he has heard, through the power of memorizing for a hundred thousand eons.

original: sa evaṃ dhāraṇīprāptaśca bhavati pratibhānaprāptaśca dharmasāṃkathyaṃ saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ sarvāvatīṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuṃ spharitvā yathāśayavibhaktitaḥ sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayati dharmāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ evam dhāraṇī prāptaḥ ca bhavati pratibhāna prāptaḥ ca dharma sāṃkathyam saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ sarvāvatīm tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātum spharitvā yathā āśaya vibhaktitaḥ sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayati dharma āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having attained such retention and eloquence, while seated in a Dharma discourse, he teaches the Dharma to beings, pervading the entire great trichiliocosm, in accordance with their inclinations, while seated on his Dharma seat.

original: dharmāsanaṃ cāsya tathāgatānabhiṣekabhūmiprāptān bodhisattvān sthāpayitvā sarvato viśiṣṭamapramāṇāvabhāsaprāptaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: dharma āsanam ca asya tathāgatān abhiṣeka bhūmi prāptān bodhisattvān sthāpayitvā sarvatas viśiṣṭam apramāṇa avabhāsa prāptam bhavati
translated: And his Dharma seat, except for those Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas who have attained the stage of consecration, is superior to all others and has attained immeasurable radiance.

original: sa dharmāsane niṣaṇṇa ākāṅkṣan ekaghoṣodāhāreṇa sarvaparṣadaṃ nānāghoṣarutavimātratayā saṃjñāpayati /
analyzed: sa dharma āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ ākāṅkṣan eka ghoṣa udāhāreṇa sarva parṣadam nānā ghoṣa ruta vimātra tayā saṃjñāpayati
translated: Seated on that Dharma seat, if he wishes, by uttering a single sound he causes the entire assembly to understand it according to their various sounds and languages.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan nānā ghoṣa nānā svara aṅga vibhaktibhiḥ ājñāpayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes them to understand it by various sounds and tones.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan raśmi mukha upasaṃhāraiḥ dharma mukhāni niścārayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes the doors of Dharma to emerge by withdrawing the rays of light.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan sarva romakūpebhyaḥ ghoṣān niścārayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes sounds to emerge from all his pores.

original: ākāṅkṣan yāvattrisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau rūpāvabhāsāstebhyaḥ sarvarūpāvabhāsebhyo dharmarutāni niścārayati /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan yāvat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau rūpa avabhāsāḥ tebhyaḥ sarva rūpa avabhāsebhyaḥ dharma rutāni niścārayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes the sounds of the Dharma to emerge from all those appearances of form, from the appearances of form in the great trichiliocosm up to the appearances of form in the ten directions.

original: ākāṅkṣan ekasvararutena sarvadharmadhātuṃ vijñāpayati /🔽ākāṅkṣan sarvarutanirghoṣeṣu dharmarutamadhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan eka svara rutena sarva dharmadhātum vijñāpayati  ākāṅkṣan sarva ruta nirghoṣeṣu dharmarutam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: If he wishes, he makes the entire Dharma realm understand with the sound of a single voice.🔽If he wishes, he establishes the sound of the Dharma in all sounds and voices.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan sarva lokadhātu paryāpannebhyaḥ gītā vādya tūrya śabdebhyaḥ dharmarutam niścārayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes the sound of the Dharma to emerge from all the sounds of singing, music, and instruments that exist in all the world systems.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan eka akṣara rutāt sarva dharma pada prabheda rutam niścārayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes the sound of the Dharma to emerge from the sound of a single syllable, distinguishing all the words of the Dharma.

original: ākāṅkṣan anabhilāpyānabhilāpyalokadhātvaparyantataḥ pṛthivyaptejovāyuskandhebhyaḥ sūkṣmaparamāṇurajaḥprabhedata ekaikaparamāṇurajonabhilāpyāni dharmamukhāni niścārayati /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan anabhilāpya anabhilāpya lokadhātu aparyantataḥ pṛthivī ap tejaḥ vāyu skandhebhyaḥ sūkṣma paramāṇu rajaḥ prabhedataḥ ekaika paramāṇu rajaḥ anabhilāpyāni dharma mukhāni niścārayati
translated: If he wishes, he causes the doors of the Dharma to emerge from the subtle atoms and dust particles in the earth, water, fire, and wind elements that exist in the endless world systems, which are beyond description, and from each atom and dust particle.

original: sacettaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuparyāpannaḥ sarvasattvā upasaṃkramya ekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena praśnān paripṛccheyuḥ /
analyzed: saced tam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu paryāpannaḥ sarva sattvāḥ upasaṃkramyaḥ eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena praśnān paripṛccheyuḥ
translated: If all the beings who exist in the great trichiliocosm were to approach him and ask him questions in a single instant, a single moment, a single second,

analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca teṣām apramāṇa ruta vimātra tayā paripṛcchet
translated: And each one would ask with an immeasurable variety of voices.

original: yaṃ caikaḥ sattvaḥ paripṛcchenna taṃ dvitīyaḥ /
analyzed: yam ca ekaḥ sattvaḥ paripṛcchet na tam dvitīyaḥ
translated: What one being would ask, another would not.

analyzed: tam bodhisattvaḥ sarva sattva ruta pada vyañjanam udgṛhṇiyāt
translated: The bodhisattva would take up the language, words, and letters of all those beings.

original: udgṛhya caikarutābhivyāhāreṇa teṣāṃ sarvasattvānāṃ cittāśayān paritoṣayet yāvadanabhilāpyalokadhāturpayāpannā vā sattvā upasaṃkramya ekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena praśnān paripṛccheyuḥ /
analyzed: udgṛhya ca eka ruta abhivyāhāreṇa teṣām sarva sattvānām citta āśayān paritoṣayet yāvat anabhilāpya lokadhātu ṛpayā āpannāḥ vā sattvāḥ upasaṃkramya eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena praśnān paripṛccheyuḥ
translated: Having taken them up, with the utterance of a single sound he would satisfy the mental dispositions of all those beings, up to the beings who have gone to the inexpressibly numerous world systems. If they approached, in a single moment, an instant, a fraction of time, they would ask questions.

analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca teṣām apramāṇa ruta vimātra tayā paripṛcchet
translated: And each one would ask with an immeasurable variety of voices.

analyzed: yam ca ekaḥ paripṛcchet na tam dvitīyaḥ
translated: What one would ask, another would not.

original: taṃ bodhisattva ekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtenaiva sarvamudgṛhya ekodāhāreṇaiva sarvānājñāpayet /
analyzed: tam bodhisattvaḥ eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena eva sarvam udgṛhya eka udāhāreṇa eva sarvān ājñāpayet
translated: The bodhisattva would take up all of that in a single moment, an instant, a fraction of time, and with a single utterance he would answer all of them.

original: yāvadanabhilāpyānapi lokadhātūn spharitvā yathāśayendriyādhimuktitaḥ sattvebhyo dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: yāvat anabhilāpyān api lokadhātūn spharitvā yathā āśaya indriya adhimuktitaḥ sattvebhyaḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: Up to pervading the inexpressibly numerous world systems, he teaches the Dharma to beings according to their mental dispositions, faculties, and inclinations.

original: dharmasāṃkathyaṃ niṣaṇṇaśca tathāgatādhiṣṭhānasaṃpratyeṣakaḥ sakalena buddhakāryeṇa sarvasattvānāṃ pratyupasthito bhavati /
analyzed: dharma sāṃkathyam niṣaṇṇaḥ ca tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna saṃpratyeṣakaḥ sakalena buddha kāryeṇa sarva sattvānām pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: And while engaged in a Dharma discussion, by the empowerment of the Tathāgatas, he becomes present to all beings with the entire activity of a Buddha.

analyzed: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā evam jñāna avabhāsa pragrahaṇam ārabhate
translated: He generates even more of this illumination of knowledge.

original: sacedekasmin vālāgraprasare yāvantyanabhilāpyeṣu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇurajāṃsi tāvantastathāgatāstāvadapramāṇaprāpteṣveva parṣanmaṇḍaleṣu dharmaṃ deśayeyuḥ /
analyzed: saced ekasmin vāla agra prasare yāvanti anabhilāpyeṣu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇu rajāṃsi tāvantaḥ tathāgatāḥ tāvat apramāṇa prāpteṣu eva parṣad maṇḍaleṣu dharmam deśayeyuḥ
translated: If as many Tathāgatas as there are atoms in the inexpressibly numerous, nayuta, koṭi, nayuta, asaṃkhyeya worlds in a single point were to teach the Dharma in their respective assemblies of limitless extent,

original: ekaikaśca tathāgatastāvadapramāṇaprāptebhyaḥ sarvasattvebhyo nānātvato dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca tathāgataḥ tāvat apramāṇa prāptebhyaḥ sarva sattvebhyaḥ nānātvataḥ dharmam deśayet
translated: and if each Tathāgata were to teach the Dharma to limitless beings in various ways,

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca sattva āśaya saṃtāne tāvat apramāṇam eva dharma upasaṃhāram upasaṃharet
translated: and if each being were to receive limitless Dharma teachings in their mental continuum,

original: yathā caikastathāgataḥ parṣanmaṇḍale tathā te sarve tathāgatāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca ekaḥ tathāgataḥ parṣad maṇḍale tathā te sarve tathāgatāḥ
translated: just as one Tathāgata does in the assembly circle, so would all those Tathāgatas.

original: yathā caikasmin vālāgraprasare tathā sarvasmin dharmadhātau /
analyzed: yathā ca ekasmin vāla agra prasare tathā sarvasmin dharmadhātau
translated: And just as in a single point, so in the entire Dharma realm.

original: tatrāsmābhistādṛśaṃ smṛtivaipulyamabhinirhartavyaṃ yathaikakṣaṇena sarvatathāgatānāṃ sakāśāddharmāvabhāsaṃ pratyeṣemahi ekarutāvyatirekāt /
analyzed: tatra asmābhiḥ tādṛśam smṛti vaipulyam abhinirhartavyam yathā eka kṣaṇena sarva tathāgatānām sakāśāt dharma avabhāsam pratyeṣemahi eka rutā vyatirekāt
translated: There we should generate such an abundance of memory that in a single instant we would understand the illumination of the Dharma from all the Tathāgatas, without distinction due to the single sound.

original: yāvanti ca tāni yathāparikīrtitāni parṣanmaṇḍalāni nānānikāyadharmapravaṇaikaparipūrṇāni /

translated: And as for those assemblies and circles that are proclaimed in various ways, filled with the Dharma inclined to various groups,

analyzed: tatra asmābhiḥ tādṛśam prajñā avabhāsa viniścaya pratibhānam pariśodhyam yat eka kṣaṇena sarva sattvān paritoṣayet
translated: there we should purify such an illumination of wisdom, such a certainty of eloquence, that in a single instant we would satisfy all beings.

analyzed: kim punar iyatsu lokadhātuṣu sattvāni
translated: What need is there to speak of the beings in so many worlds?

original: sa imāṃ sādhumatīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāpto bodhisattvo bhūyasyā mātrayā rātriṃdivamananyamanasikāraprayukto bhūtvā buddhagocarānupraviṣṭastathāgatasamavadhānaprāpto gambhīrabodhisattvavimokṣānuprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ imām sādhumatīm bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā rātriṃdivam an anya manasikāra prayuktaḥ bhūtvā buddha gocara anupraviṣṭaḥ tathāgata samavadhāna prāptaḥ gambhīra bodhisattva vimokṣa anuprāptaḥ bhavati
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained this bodhisattva bhūmi called Good Intelligence, becoming even more devoted to the Buddha domain, having entered the domain of the Tathāgata, having attained the profound bodhisattva liberations,

analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna anugataḥ bodhisattvaḥ samāhitaḥ tathāgata darśanam na vijahāti
translated: the bodhisattva who is thus endowed with knowledge, being concentrated, does not abandon the vision of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca kalpena ikān buddhān
translated: And in each eon, many Buddhas.

analyzed: asaṃhāryāṇi bhavanti sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ adhara bhūmi sthitaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: They are not surpassed by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and by the bodhisattvas dwelling on lower stages.

original: tasya sā kuśalamūlābhā sattvānāṃ kleśacittagahanānyavabhāsya tata eva vyāvartate /
analyzed: tasya sā kuśala mūla ābhā sattvānām kleśa citta gahanāni avabhāsya tatas eva vyāvartate
translated: That light of the roots of virtue of that bodhisattva, having illuminated the thickets of the afflictions in the minds of beings, turns back from there.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ dvisāhasrikaḥ mahābrahmā sarvasmin dvisāhasrike lokadhātau gahana nimna upacārān avabhāsayati
translated: Just as, sons of the Victorious Ones, the great Brahmā of the second-order thousand-world universe illuminates all the thickets, low-lying areas, and unilluminated places in the second-order thousand-world universe,

original: evameva bho jinaputrā bodhisattvasya asyāṃ sādhumatyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya sā kuśalamūlābhā sattvānāṃ kleśacittagahanānyavabhāsya tata eva vyāvartate /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya asyām sādhumatyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya sā kuśala mūla ābhā sattvānām kleśa citta gahanāni avabhāsya tatas eva vyāvartate
translated: in the same way, sons of the Victorious Ones, the light of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva dwelling on this bodhisattva stage of Excellent Wisdom, having illuminated the thickets of the afflictions in the minds of beings, turns back from there.

original: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyo balapāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ bala pāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati
translated: Of the ten perfections, the perfection of power becomes most outstanding for him.

original: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudācarati yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudācarati yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: But he does not fail to practice the remaining ones according to his ability and as much as he can.

original: iyaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattvasya sādhumatī nāma navamī bodhisattvabhūmiḥ / / /mahābrahmā bhavati mahābalasthāmaprāpto dvisāhasrādhipatirabhibhūḥ / / /pāramitopadeśeṣvasaṃhāryaḥ sattvāśayaparipṛcchānirdeśaiḥ /
analyzed: iyam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya sādhumatī nāma navamī bodhisattva bhūmiḥ mahā brahmā bhavati mahā bala sthāma prāptaḥ dvi sāhasra adhipatiḥ abhibhūḥ pāramitā upadeśeṣu asaṃhāryaḥ sattva āśaya paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: He is unassailable in teaching the perfections, in answering questions about the intentions of the beings.

analyzed: yat ca kiṃcid  sādhumatī nāma navamī bhūmiḥ
translated: And whatever...🔽The ninth stage is called the Far-reaching.

analyzed: dharmameghā nāma daśamī bhūmiḥ
translated: The tenth stage is called the Cloud of Dharma.

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha yo'yaṃ bhavanto jinaputrā bodhisattva evamapramāṇajñeyavicāritayā buddhyā yāvannavamī bodhisattvabhūmiriti suvicitavicayaḥ suparipūrṇaśukladharmaḥ paryantasaṃbhāropacayopacitaḥ suparigṛhītamahāpuṇyajñānasaṃbhāraḥ mahākaruṇāvaipulyādhigataḥ lokadhātuvibhaktivaimātryakovidaḥ sattvadhātupraviṣṭagahanopacāraḥ tathāgatagocarapraveśānugatasaṃjñāmanasikāraḥ balavaiśāradyabuddhadharmādhyālambanānugataḥ sarvākārasarvajñajñānābhiṣekabhūmiprāpta ityucyate //
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yaḥ yam bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvaḥ evam apramāṇa jñeya vicāritayā buddhyā yāvat navamī bodhisattva bhūmiḥ iti su vicita vicayaḥ su paripūrṇa śukla dharmaḥ paryanta saṃbhāra upacaya upacitaḥ su parigṛhīta mahā puṇya jñāna saṃbhāraḥ mahā karuṇā vaipulya adhigataḥ lokadhātu vibhakti vaimātrya kovidaḥ sattvadhātu praviṣṭa gahana upacāraḥ tathāgata gocara praveśa anugata saṃjñā manasikāraḥ bala va
translated: The bodhisattva Vajragarbha said, “Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, when a bodhisattva has, with such immeasurable discernment of objects of knowledge, thoroughly investigated up to the ninth bodhisattva stage, has fulfilled the completely pure dharmas, has accumulated the provisions up to the limit, has well grasped the great provisions of merit and wisdom, has attained the vastness of great compassion, is skilled in the various divisions of world systems, has penetrated the deep practices of the realm of beings, has the attention and conception of following the entry into the domain of the Tathāgatas, is focused on the powers, confidences, and Buddha dharmas, and has attained the stage of consecration into the omniscient knowledge of all aspects, he is said to have attained the stage of consecration.”

original: tasya khalu punarbhavanto jinaputrā evaṃjñānānugatasya bodhisattvasya abhiṣekabhūmisamāpannasya vimalo nāma samādhirāmukhībhavati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar bhavantaḥ jinaputrāḥ evaṃjñānānugatasya bodhisattvasya abhiṣeka bhūmi samāpannasya vimalaḥ nāma samādhiḥ āmukhībhavati
translated: “Venerable sons of the Victorious Ones, for that bodhisattva who has attained such knowledge and attained the stage of consecration, the samādhi named Vimalā becomes manifest.

analyzed: dharmadhātu vibhakti praveśaḥ ca nāma
translated: And the one named Dharma-dhātu-vibhanga-praveśa.

analyzed: bodhimaṇḍa alaṃkāra vyūhaḥ ca nāma
translated: And the one named Bodhi-maṇḍa-ālamkāra-vyūha.

analyzed: sarvākāraraśmikusumaḥ ca nāma  sāgaragarbhaḥ ca nāma  sāgarasamṛddhiḥ ca nāma
translated: Named All-Aspect Light and Flower.🔽Named Ocean Womb.🔽Named Ocean Prosperity.

analyzed: ākāśadhātuvipulaḥ ca nāma
translated: Named Vast Space Element.

analyzed: sarvadharmasvabhāvavicayaḥ ca nāma
translated: Named Investigation of the Nature of All Phenomena.

analyzed: sarva sattva citta carita anugataḥ ca nāma
translated: Named Conforming to the Mental Activities of All Beings.

analyzed: pratyutpanna sarva buddha saṃmukha avasthitaḥ ca nāma bodhisattva samādhiḥ āmukhībhavati
translated: Named Abiding Face-to-Face with All Buddhas of the Present. These bodhisattva samādhis manifest.

analyzed: daśa samādhi asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi āmukhībhavanti
translated: With these as the foremost, one hundred thousand asaṃkhyeya samādhis manifest.

original: sa tān sarvān samādhīn samāpadyate ca vyuttiṣṭhate ca /
analyzed: sa tān sarvān samādhīn samāpadyate ca vyuttiṣṭhate ca
translated: He enters into and emerges from all those samādhis.

analyzed: samādhi kauśalya anugataḥ ca yāvat samādhi kāryam tat sarvam pratyanubhavati
translated: And being endowed with the skillfulness of samādhi, he experiences all that is to be done with regard to samādhi.

analyzed: tasya yāvat daśa samādhi asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇām paryante sarvajña jñāna viśeṣa abhiṣekavān nāma bodhisattva samādhiḥ āmukhībhavati
translated: At the end of those one hundred thousand asaṃkhyeya samādhis, the bodhisattva samādhi named Anointed with the Distinctive Knowledge of All-Knowing Wisdom manifests to him.

original: yasmin samanantarābhimukhībhūte daśatrisāhasraśatasahasrāparyantapramāṇaṃ mahāratnarājapadmaṃ prādurbhavati sarvākārararatnapratyarpitaṃ sarvalokaviṣayasamatikrāntaṃ lokottarakuśalamūlasaṃbhūtaṃ māyāsvabhāvagocarapariniṣpannaṃ dharmadhātusuvyavasthitāvabhāsaṃ divyaviṣayasamatikrāntaṃ mahāvaiḍūryamaṇiratnadaṇḍamatulyacandanarājakarṇikaṃ mahāśmagarbhakesaraṃ jāmbūnadasuvarṇāvabhāsapatramaparimitaraśmisaṃkusumitaśarīraṃ sarvapravararatnapratyuptagarbhamaparyantamahāratnajālasaṃchannaṃ paripūrṇadaśatrisāhasraśatasahasraparamāṇurajaḥsamamahāratnapadmaparivāram /
analyzed: yasmin samanantara abhimukhībhūte daśa tri sāhasra śata sahasra aparyanta pramāṇam mahā ratna rāja padmam prādurbhavati sarva ākāra raratna pratyarpitam sarva loka viṣaya samatikrāntam lokottara kuśala mūla saṃbhūtam māyā svabhāva gocara pariniṣpannam dharmadhātu su vyavasthita avabhāsam divya viṣaya samatikrāntam mahā vaiḍūrya maṇi ratna daṇḍam atulya candana rāja karṇikam mahā aśmagarbha kesaram jāmbūnada suvarṇa avabhāsa patram aparimita raśmi saṃkus
translated: As soon as he is born, a great jeweled lotus king appears, extending for hundreds of thousands of leagues, made of all kinds of jewels, surpassing all worlds, arisen from supramundane roots of virtue, perfected in the domain of the nature of illusion, well-established in the appearance of the dharma realm, surpassing the divine realm, with a stem of great beryl jewels, a pericarp of incomparable sandalwood king, stamens of great crystal essence, petals shining with the light of Jāmbūnada gold, a body blooming with immeasurable light rays, a womb adorned with the best of all jewels, covered with an endless net of great jewels, surrounded by a full hundred thousand trichiliocosms of great jeweled lotuses equal to the number of atoms.

analyzed: tad anugataḥ tad anurūpaḥ ca tasya bodhisattvasya kāyaḥ saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: The body of that bodhisattva remains in accordance with that and in conformity with that.

original: sa tasya sarvajñajñānaviśeṣābhiṣekavataḥ samādheḥ sahapratilambhāttasminmahāratnarājapadme niṣaṇṇaḥ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: sa tasya sarvajña jñāna viśeṣa abhiṣekavataḥ samādheḥ saha pratilambhāt tasmin mahā ratna rāja padme niṣaṇṇaḥ saṃdṛśyate
translated: As soon as he attains that samādhi, which is the consecration of the special knowledge of omniscience, he is seen seated on that great jewel-king lotus.

analyzed: samanantara niṣaṇṇaḥ ca sa bodhisattvaḥ tasmin mahā ratna rāja padme
translated: As soon as that bodhisattva is seated on that great jewel-king lotus,

original: atha yāvanti tasya mahāratnarājapadmasya mahāpadmāni parivāraḥ prādurbhūtaḥ /
analyzed: atha yāvanti tasya mahā ratna rāja padmasya mahā padmāni parivāraḥ prādurbhūtaḥ
translated: then as many great lotuses as there are in the retinue of that great jewel-king lotus appear.

original: tāvanto bodhisattvā daśadiglokadhātusaṃnipatitāstaṃ bodhisattvamanuparivārya teṣu mahāratnapadmeṣu niṣīdanti /
analyzed: tāvantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ daśa diś lokadhātu saṃnipatitāḥ tam bodhisattvam anuparivārya teṣu mahā ratna padmeṣu niṣīdanti
translated: As many bodhisattvas as there are in the assemblies from the worlds of the ten directions surround that bodhisattva and sit on those great jewel lotuses.

original: ekaikaśca teṣāṃ daśa samādhiśatasahasrāṇi samāpadyate tameva bodhisattvaṃ nirīkṣamāṇaḥ //
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca teṣām daśa samādhi śata sahasrāṇi samāpadyate tam eva bodhisattvam nirīkṣamāṇaḥ
translated: And each of them enters a hundred thousand samādhis while gazing at that bodhisattva.

original: samanantarasamāpanne ca tasmin bodhisattve teṣu ca bodhisattveṣu niravaśeṣam /
analyzed: samanantara samāpanne ca tasmin bodhisattve teṣu ca bodhisattveṣu niravaśeṣam
translated: As soon as that bodhisattva and those bodhisattvas enter that samādhi,

analyzed: atha sarva lokadhātu saṃprakampanam bhavati  sarva apāya pratiprasrambhaṇam ca
translated: then all the worlds tremble.🔽All the lower realms are cleared.

analyzed: sarva dharmadhātu avabhāsa karaṇam ca
translated: All the realms of phenomena are illuminated.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu pariśodhanam ca
translated: All the worlds are purified.

analyzed: sarva buddhakṣetra nāmadheya ruta an anuravaṇam ca
translated: It causes the sounds of the names of all buddha-fields to be heard.

original: sarvasabhāgacaritabodhisattvasaṃnipātanaṃ ca sarvalokadhātudevamanuṣyatūryasaṃgītisaṃpravādanaṃ ca sarvasattvasukhasaṃjananaṃ ca sarvasamyaksaṃbuddhācintyapūjopasthānapravartanaṃ ca sarvatathāgataparṣanmaṇḍalavijñāpanaṃ ca bhavati /
analyzed: sarva sabhāga carita bodhisattva saṃnipātanam ca sarva lokadhātu deva manuṣya tūrya saṃgīti saṃpravādanam ca sarva sattva sukha saṃjananam ca sarva samyaksaṃbuddha acintya pūjā upasthāna pravartanam ca sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍala vijñāpanam ca bhavati
translated: It causes all bodhisattvas with similar conduct to assemble, and all the musical instruments of the gods and humans in all worlds to play. It generates happiness in all beings, and causes the inconceivable worship and service of all perfect buddhas to be performed. It causes all the assemblies of tathagatas to be known.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi bho jinaputrāstasya bodhisattvasya samanantaraniṣaṇṇasya tasmin mahāratnarājapadme adhastāccaraṇatalābhyāṃ daśaraśmyasaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrāṇi niścaranti /
analyzed: tathā hi bho jinaputrāḥ tasya bodhisattvasya samanantara niṣaṇṇasya tasmin mahā ratnarāja padme adhastāt caraṇa talābhyām daśa raśmi asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti
translated: O sons of the victorious ones, as soon as that bodhisattva sits on that great jewel king lotus, from the soles of his feet ten trillion light rays emerge.

analyzed: niścarya daśa diśam avīci paryantān mahānirayān avabhāsayanti
translated: Emerging, they illuminate the great hells down to Avīci in the ten directions.

analyzed: nairayikānām sattvānām sarva duḥkhāni pratiprasrambhayati
translated: They soothe all the sufferings of the beings in the hells.🔽From his knees ten trillion...

analyzed: jānu maṇḍalābhyām daśa daśa diśam sarva tiryagyoni bhavanāni avabhāsayanti
translated: light up all the abodes of the animal realm in the ten directions.

analyzed: sarva tiryagyoni duḥkhāni ca praśamayanti
translated: And they pacify all the sufferings of the animal realm.

analyzed: nābhi maṇḍalāt daśa sarva yama loka bhavanāni avabhāsayanti
translated: they illuminate all the abodes of the world of Yama, and they pacify the sufferings of all the beings in the world of Yama.🔽From his left and right sides...

original: sarvayamalaukikānāṃ sattvānāṃ duḥkhāni ca praśamayanti /🔽vāmadakṣiṇābhyāṃ pārśvābhyāṃ / / /manuṣyāśrayān / / /manuṣya / / / /
analyzed: sarva yama laukikānām sattvānām duḥkhāni ca praśamayanti  vāma dakṣiṇābhyām pārśvābhyām manuṣya āśrayāt manuṣya
translated: they illuminate the human abodes, and they pacify the sufferings of all human beings.🔽From both his hands...

analyzed: ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām  aṃsābhyām śrāvaka yānīya āśrayān avabhāsayanti
translated: they illuminate the abodes of gods and asuras, and they pacify the sufferings of all gods and asuras.🔽From his shoulders...

analyzed: dharma āloka mukham ca upasaṃharanti  pṛṣṭhatas grīvāyāḥ ca pratyekabuddha āśrayān avabhāsayanti
translated: they illuminate the abodes of those who follow the Śrāvakayāna, and they bestow the gateway to the light of the Dharma.🔽From his back and neck...

analyzed: śānti samādhi mukha nayam ca upasaṃharanti  mukha dvārāt prathama citta upādam upādāya yāvat navamīm bhūmim anuprāptān bodhisattvān avabhāsayanti
translated: they illuminate the abodes of the pratyekabuddhas, and they bestow the method of the samādhi of peace.🔽From his mouth...

analyzed: prajñā upāya kauśalya nayam ca upasaṃharanti
translated: they illuminate the bodhisattvas who have attained the first generation of the mind up to the ninth stage, and they bestow the method of skill in means and wisdom.🔽From his tuft...

analyzed: ūrṇā kośāt daśa raśmi asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti
translated: ten hundred thousand koṭīs of light rays emerge.

original: niścarya daśasu dikṣu sarvamārabhavanānyavabhāsya dhyāmīkṛtya abhiṣekabhūmiprāptān bodhisattvān avabhāsya tatkāyeṣvevāstaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: niścarya daśasu dikṣu sarva māra bhavanāni avabhāsya dhyāmīkṛtya abhiṣeka bhūmi prāptān bodhisattvān avabhāsya tad kāyeṣu eva astam gacchanti
translated: Having emerged, they illuminate all the palaces of Māra in the ten directions, dazzle them, and disappear right there in the bodies of the bodhisattvas who have attained the stage of consecration.

analyzed: upari uttamāṅgāt paripūrṇa daśa tri sāhasra asaṃkhyeya śata sahasra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ raśmayaḥ niścaranti
translated: From the top of their heads, light rays equal to the number of atoms in a hundred thousand times ten to the power of sixty worlds emerge.

original: niścarya daśasu dikṣu dharmadhātupramāṇānyākāśadhātuparyavasānāni sarvatathāgataparṣanmaṇḍalānyavabhāsya daśākāraṃ lokaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya uparikhagapathe sthitvā mahāraśmijālamaṇḍalāni kṛtvā uttaptaprabhāsaṃ nāma mahattathāgatapūjopasthānaṃ sarvatathāgatānāmanupravartayanti /
analyzed: niścarya daśasu dikṣu dharmadhātu pramāṇāni ākāśa dhātu paryavasānāni sarva tathāgata parṣad maṇḍalāni avabhāsya daśa ākāram lokam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya upari khaga pathe sthitvā mahā raśmi jāla maṇḍalāni kṛtvā uttaptaprabhāsam nāma mahat tathāgata pūjā upasthānam sarva tathāgatānām anupravartayanti
translated: Having emerged, they illuminate the assemblies of all tathāgatas in the ten directions, extending to the limits of space and the realm of phenomena, circle the world ten times, and remain in the sky, forming great nets of light. They present the great offering and service to all tathāgatas, called Blazing Light,

analyzed: tasya pūjā upasthānasya prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat navamī bhūmi anupravartitam tathāgata pūjā upasthānam
translated: and that offering and service is presented to all tathāgatas from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment up to the ninth stage.

original: tataḥ khalvapi mahāraśmijālamaṇḍalādyāvatī daśasu dikṣu niravaśeṣasarvadharmadhātvantargatā puṣpaprajñaptirvā gandhadhūpamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvastrābharaṇamaṇiratnaprajñaptirvā /
analyzed: tatas khalu api mahā raśmi jāla maṇḍalāt yāvatī daśasu dikṣu niravaśeṣa sarva dharmadhātu antargatā puṣpa prajñaptiḥ vā gandha dhūpa mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vastra ābharaṇa maṇi ratna prajñaptiḥ vā
translated: Then, from that great network of light-rays, as many arrangements of flowers as there are in all the Dharma-dhātus in the ten directions, without exception, or arrangements of perfumes, incense, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, fabrics, ornaments, jewels and gems,

original: tato'tiriktatarāḥ sarvalokaviṣayasamatikrāntā lokottarakuśalamūlasaṃbhārādhipatyābhinirvṛttāḥ sarvākāraguṇasaṃpannā acintyanirvāṇādhiṣṭhānādhiṣṭhitā nānāvyūhamahāratnavarṣā iva ekaikatathāgataparṣanmaṇḍale mahāmeghā ivābhipravarṣanti sma /
analyzed: tatas utiriktatarāḥ sarva loka viṣaya samatikrāntāḥ lokottara kuśala mūla saṃbhāra ādhipatya abhinirvṛttāḥ sarva ākāra guṇa saṃpannāḥ acintya nirvāṇa adhiṣṭhāna dhiṣṭhitāḥ nānā vyūha mahā ratna varṣāḥ iva ekaika tathāgata parṣad maṇḍale mahā meghāḥ iva abhipravarṣanti sma
translated: which are even more numerous, surpassing all worldly realms, accomplished through the power of the roots of virtue that transcend the world, endowed with all aspects of good qualities, supported by the inconceivable consecration of nirvāṇa, like a rain of great jewels with various patterns, pour down in each Tathāgata's assembly-circle like great clouds.

original: tāṃ ca ye sattvāḥ pūjāṃ saṃjānante /
analyzed: tām ca ye sattvāḥ pūjām saṃjānante
translated: And those beings who perceive that worship,

analyzed: te sarve niyatāḥ bhavanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: they are all destined for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃrūpaṃ pūjopasthānaṃ pravartya tā raśmayaḥ punareva sarvāvanti tathāgataparṣanmaṇḍalānyavabhāsya daśākāraṃ lokaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmadhastātkramataleṣu astaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam pūjā upasthānam pravartya tāḥ raśmayaḥ punar eva sarvāvanti tathāgata parṣad maṇḍalāni avabhāsya daśa ākāram lokam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya teṣām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām adhastāt krama taleṣu astam gacchanti
translated: Having performed such worship and service, those light rays again illuminate all the assemblies of Tathagatas, circumambulate the world ten times, and disappear into the soles of the feet of those Tathagatas, Arhats, Samyaksambuddhas.

original: tatasteṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ viditaṃ bhavati amuṣmin lokadhātuprasare evaṃcaryānugato bodhisattvo'bhiṣekakālaprāpta iti
analyzed: tatas teṣām tathāgatānām teṣām ca bodhisattvānām viditam bhavati amuṣmin lokadhātu prasare evaṃcaryā anugataḥ bodhisattvaḥ abhiṣeka kāla prāptaḥ iti
translated: Then those Tathagatas and those Bodhisattvas know that in this vast world system, a Bodhisattva has attained the time for consecration, following such conduct.

original: tatra bho jinaputrā daśabhyo digbhyo'paryantebhyo lokadhātuprasarebhyo'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāparyantā bodhisattvā yāvannavamībodhisattvabhūmipratiṣṭhitā āgatya taṃ bodhisattvamanuparivārya mahatīṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā tameva bodhisattvaṃ nirīkṣamāṇā daśa samādhiśatasahasrāṇi samāpadyante /
analyzed: tatra bho jinaputrāḥ daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ upari antebhyaḥ lokadhātu prasarebhyaḥ uprameya asaṃkhyeya aparyantāḥ bodhisattvāḥ yāvat navamī bodhisattva bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ āgatya tam bodhisattvam anuparivārya mahatīm pūjām kṛtvā tam eva bodhisattvam nirīkṣamāṇāḥ daśa samādhi śata sahasrāṇi samāpadyante
translated: There, O sons of the Victorious Ones, from the boundless vastness of world systems in the ten directions, immeasurable, innumerable, and boundless Bodhisattvas, up to those established on the ninth Bodhisattva ground, come and surround that Bodhisattva, perform great worship, and while gazing at that Bodhisattva, enter into a hundred thousand of the ten types of samadhis.

original: abhiṣekabhūmiprāptānāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ kāyebhyaḥ śrīvatsālaṃkārādvajrasvastikāt sarvamāraśatruvijayo nāmaikaikā mahāraśmirdaśaraśmyasaṃkhyeyaśatasahasraparivārā
analyzed: abhiṣeka bhūmi prāptānām ca bodhisattvānām kāyebhyaḥ śrīvatsa alaṃkārāt vajra svastikāt sarvamāraśatruvijayaḥ nāma ekaikā mahā raśmiḥ daśa raśmi asaṃkhyeya śata sahasra parivārā
translated: And from the bodies of the bodhisattvas who have attained the stage of consecration, from the Shrivatsa ornament and the vajra swastika, a great light ray named Victory over All Maras and Enemies, each surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of light rays,

original: niścarya daśadiśo'vabhāsya aparyantāni prātihāryāṇi saṃdarśya tasya bodhisattvasya śrīvatsālaṃkāre vajrasvastika evāstaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: niścarya daśa diśaḥ vabhāsya aparyantāni prātihāryāṇi saṃdarśya tasya bodhisattvasya śrīvatsa alaṃkāre vajra svastike eva astam gacchati
translated: emerges and, illuminating the ten directions, displays boundless miracles, and then disappears right into the vajra swastika of that bodhisattva's Shrivatsa ornament.

original: samanantarādastamitāyāśca tasyā raśmyāḥ śatasahasraguṇottarā tasya bodhisattvasya balasthāmābhivṛddhiḥ prajñāyate //
analyzed: samanantarāt astamitāyāḥ ca tasyāḥ raśmyāḥ śata sahasra guṇa uttarā tasya bodhisattvasya bala sthāma abhivṛddhiḥ prajñāyate
translated: Immediately after that light ray has disappeared, the bodhisattva's increase in strength and power is known to be a hundred thousand times greater.

original: atha khalu bho jinaputrāḥ sarvajñatābhijñāvatyo nāma raśmayasteṣāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmūrṇākośebhyo niścarantyasaṃkhyeyaoparivārāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bho jinaputrāḥ sarvajña tā abhijñāvatyaḥ nāma raśmayaḥ teṣām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām ūrṇā kośebhyaḥ niścaranti asaṃkhyeya oparivārāḥ
translated: Then, O sons of the Victorious Ones, light rays named Endowed with Omniscience and Superknowledge emerge from the urna hair tufts of those Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands.

original: tāḥ sarvāsu daśasu dikṣu aśeṣataḥ sarvalokadhātūnavabhāsya daśākāraṃ lokaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya mahānti tathāgatavikurvitāni saṃdarśya bahūni bodhisattvakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi saṃcodya sarvabuddhakṣetraprasarān ṣaḍvikāraṃ saṃprakampya sarvāpāyacyutigatyupapattīḥ praśamya sarvamārabhavanāni dhyāmīkṛtya sarvatathāgatābhisaṃbodhivibuddhabuddhāsanānyupasaṃdarśya sarvabuddhaparṣanmaṇḍalavyūhaprabhāvaṃ nidarśya dharmadhātuparamānākāśadhātuparyavasānān sarvalokadhātūnavabhāsya punarevāgatya taṃ sarvāvantaṃ bodhisattvaparṣatsaṃnipātamuparyuparipradakṣiṇīkṛtya mahāvyuhānnidarśya tā raśmayastasya bodhisattvasyoottamāṅge'staṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: tāḥ sarvāsu daśasu dikṣu aśeṣatas sarva lokadhātūn avabhāsya daśa ākāram lokam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya mahānti tathāgata vikurvitāni saṃdarśya bahūni bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃcodya sarva buddhakṣetra prasarān ṣaṣ vikāram saṃprakampya sarva apāya cyuti gati upapattīḥ praśamya sarva māra bhavanāni dhyāmīkṛtya sarva tathāgata abhisaṃbodhi vibuddha buddha āsanāni upasaṃdarśya sarva buddha parṣad maṇḍala vyūha prabhāvam nidarśy
translated: They illuminated all the worlds in the ten directions without exception, circumambulated the world ten times, displayed the great miracles of the Tathagatas, inspired many quintillions of Bodhisattvas, shook all the Buddha-fields in six ways, pacified all the miserable destinies and rebirths, eclipsed all the abodes of Mara, revealed the seats of enlightenment of all the Tathagatas, displayed the splendor of the arrays of all the Buddha-assemblies, illuminated all the worlds up to the end of space, and then returned and circumambulated that entire assembly of Bodhisattvas above and to the right, revealing the great arrays, and those light rays disappeared into the crown of the Bodhisattva's head.

original: tatparivāraraśmayaśca tathā saṃnipatitānāṃ teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ śirassvantardhīyante sma /
analyzed: tad parivāra raśmayaḥ ca tathā saṃnipatitānām teṣām bodhisattvānām śirassu antardhīyante sma
translated: And the surrounding rays of light disappear into the heads of those assembled bodhisattvas.

original: samanantarasaṃnipatitābhiśca tābhī raśmibhiste bodhisattvā apratilabdhapūrvāṇi daśa samādhiśatasahasrāṇi pratilabhante /
analyzed: samanantara saṃnipatitābhiḥ ca tābhiḥ raśmibhiḥ te bodhisattvāḥ a pratilabdha pūrvāṇi daśa samādhi śata sahasrāṇi pratilabhante
translated: And by those rays of light that have just assembled, those bodhisattvas obtain one hundred thousand samādhis that they have not obtained before.

original: tāśca raśmayastulyakālaṃ tasya bodhisattvasyottamāṅge nipatitā bhavanti /
analyzed: tāḥ ca raśmayaḥ tulya kālam tasya bodhisattvasya uttamāṅge nipatitāḥ bhavanti
translated: And those rays of light simultaneously descend upon the crown of that bodhisattva's head.

analyzed: sa ca bodhisattvaḥ abhiṣiktaḥ iti ucyate samyaksaṃbuddha viṣaye
translated: And that bodhisattva is said to be consecrated in the domain of the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: daśabalaparipūryā tu samyaksaṃbuddha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: daśa bala paripūryā tu samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: But by fulfilling the ten powers, he is counted as a Perfectly Awakened One.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrā yo rājñaścakravartinaḥ putro jyeṣṭhaḥ kumāro'gryamahiṣīprasūtaścakravartirājalakṣaṇasamanvāgato bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ yaḥ rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ putraḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ kumāra ugrya mahiṣī prasūtaḥ cakravarti rāja lakṣaṇa samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: Just as, O sons of the Victorious One, the eldest prince of a wheel-turning king, born of the chief queen and endowed with the marks of a wheel-turning king,

original: taṃ rājā cakravartī divye hastisauvarṇe bhadrapīṭhe niṣādya /
analyzed: tam rājā cakravartī divye hasti sauvarṇe bhadrapīṭhe niṣādya
translated: when the wheel-turning king has seated him on an auspicious golden throne on a divine elephant,

analyzed: caturbhyaḥ mahā samudrebhyaḥ vāri ānīya
translated: and has brought water from the four great oceans,

original: upariratnavimānena dhāryamāṇena mahatā puṣpadhūpagandhadīpamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākātūryatālāvacarasaṃgitivyūhena sauvarṇaṃ bhṛṅgāraṃ gṛhītvā tena vāriṇā taṃ kumāraṃ mūrdhanyabhiṣiñcati /
analyzed: upari ratna vimānena dhāryamāṇena mahatā puṣpa dhūpa gandha dīpa mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā tūrya tālāvacara saṃgiti vyūhena sauvarṇam bhṛṅgāram gṛhītvā tena vāriṇā tam kumāram mūrdhani abhiṣiñcati
translated: Holding a golden ewer, he sprinkles that water on the head of that prince with a great array of flowers, incense, perfume, lamps, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and musical instruments, carried by a great jeweled palace above.

original: samanantarābhiṣiktaśca rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhabhiṣikta iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: samanantara abhiṣiktaḥ ca rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdha abhiṣiktaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: Immediately after being consecrated, the king becomes known as a consecrated kṣatriya.

analyzed: daśa kuśala karma patha paripūryā tu cakravartī iti saṃjñām pratilabhate
translated: But by perfecting the ten wholesome paths of action, he attains the title of a universal monarch.

analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ samanantara abhiṣiktaḥ bodhisattvaḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ mahā jñāna abhiṣeka abhiṣiktaḥ iti ucyate
translated: In the same way, Blessed Sons of the Victorious Ones, immediately after a bodhisattva is consecrated, he is called one who has been consecrated with the great wisdom consecration by those Blessed Buddhas.

original: samyaksaṃbuddhābhiṣekeṇa daśabalaparipūryā tu samyaksaṃbuddha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddha abhiṣekeṇa daśa bala paripūryā tu samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: But by perfecting the ten powers through the consecration of a Perfectly Awakened One, he becomes known as a Perfectly Awakened One.

original: ayaṃ bho jinaputrā bodhisattvasya mahājñānābhiṣeko yasyārthe bodhisattvo'nekāni duṣkaraśatasahasrāṇyārabhate /
analyzed: ayam bho jinaputrāḥ bodhisattvasya mahā jñāna abhiṣekaḥ yasya arthe bodhisattvaḥ ūnekāni duṣkara śata sahasrāṇi ārabhate
translated: Blessed Sons of the Victorious Ones, this is the great wisdom consecration of a bodhisattva, for the sake of which a bodhisattva undertakes many hundreds of thousands of difficult tasks.

original: sa evamabhiṣikto'prameyaguṇajñānavivardhito dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhita ityucyate //
analyzed: saḥ evam abhiṣikta uprameya guṇa jñāna vivardhitaḥ dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ iti ucyate
translated: He, thus consecrated, having increased immeasurable qualities and knowledge, is said to be established in the bodhisattva stage Cloud of Dharma.

original: so'syāṃ dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo dharmadhātusamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: saḥ usyām dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ dharmadhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: That bodhisattva established in this bodhisattva stage Cloud of Dharma truly knows the origin of the dharma realm.

original: kāmadhātusamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽rūpadhātusamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: kāmadhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti  rūpa dhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the origin of the desire realm.🔽He truly knows the origin of the form realm.

analyzed: ārūpya dhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the origin of the formless realm.

analyzed: lokadhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the origin of the world realm.

analyzed: sarva sattvadhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the origin of the realm of all beings.

original: vijñānadhātusamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽saṃskṛtāsaṃskṛtadhātusamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti  saṃskṛta a saṃskṛta dhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the origin of the realm of consciousness.🔽He truly knows the origin of the realm of the conditioned and unconditioned.

analyzed: ākāśa dhātu samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the origin of the space realm.

analyzed: bhūta abhūta deśanām ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows the teaching of what is and is not.

analyzed: nirvāṇam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He truly knows nirvana.

analyzed: dṛṣṭi kleśa samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the attainment of the afflictions of views.

original: lokadhātupravṛttinivṛttisamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽śrāvakacaryāsamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: lokadhātu pravṛtti nivṛtti samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti  śrāvaka caryā samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the attainment of the arising and cessation of world systems.🔽He knows as it truly is the attainment of the practice of the hearers.

analyzed: pratyekabuddha caryā samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the attainment of the practice of the solitary realizers.

analyzed: bodhisattva caryā samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the attainment of the practice of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tathāgata bala vaiśāradya āveṇika buddha dharma rūpa kāya dharmakāya samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the attainment of the powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of the tathāgatas, and the attainment of the form body and truth body.

original: sarvākārasarvajñajñānasamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽abhisaṃbodhidharmacakrapravṛttisaṃdarśanasamudāgamaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sarva ākāra sarvajña jñāna samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti  abhisaṃbodhi dharma cakra pravṛtti saṃdarśana samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the attainment of the wisdom of omniscience in all its aspects.🔽He knows as it truly is the attainment of demonstrating the complete awakening, turning the wheel of Dharma, and [other deeds].

analyzed: samāsatas sarva dharma praveśa vibhakti niṣtīrṇa samudāgamam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: In brief, he knows as it truly is the attainment of the complete transcendence of the classification of the entry into all phenomena.

original: sa evaṃjñānānugatayā buddhyā uttari sattvakāyanirmāṇaṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: saḥ evaṃjñāna anugatayā buddhyā uttari sattvakāya nirmāṇam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: With a mind that is endowed with such knowledge, he knows as it truly is the creation of higher bodies of beings.

analyzed: kleśa kāya nirmāṇam ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the creation of the body of afflictions.

original: dṛṣṭikṛtanirmāṇaṃ ca / / /lokadhātunirmāṇaṃ ca / / /dharmadhātunirmāṇaṃ ca / / /śrāvakanirmāṇaṃ ca / / /pratyekabuddhanirmāṇaṃ ca / / /bodhisattvanirmāṇaṃ ca / / /tathāgatanirmāṇaṃ ca / / /sarvanirmāṇakalpākalpatāṃ ca yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi kṛta nirmāṇam ca lokadhātu nirmāṇam ca dharmadhātu nirmāṇam ca śrāvaka nirmāṇam ca pratyekabuddha nirmāṇam ca bodhisattva nirmāṇam ca tathāgata nirmāṇam ca sarva nirmāṇa kalpa akalpa tām ca yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the creation of views, the creation of the world systems, the creation of the Dharma realm, the creation of śrāvakas, the creation of pratyekabuddhas, the creation of bodhisattvas, the creation of tathāgatas, and the non-creation of all creations.

original: sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /dharmādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /saṃghādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /karmādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca kleśādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /kālādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /praṇidhānādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /pūjādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /caryādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /kalpādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca / / /jñānādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: sarva buddha adhiṣṭhānam ca dharma adhiṣṭhānam ca saṃgha adhiṣṭhānam ca karma adhiṣṭhānam ca kleśa adhiṣṭhānam ca kāla adhiṣṭhānam ca praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānam ca pūjā adhiṣṭhānam ca caryā adhiṣṭhānam ca kalpa adhiṣṭhānam ca jñāna adhiṣṭhānam ca prajānāti
translated: He knows the blessings of all buddhas, the blessings of the Dharma, the blessings of the Saṅgha, the blessings of karma, the blessings of afflictions, the blessings of time, the blessings of vows, the blessings of worship, the blessings of conduct, the blessings of eons, and the blessings of wisdom.

original: sa yānīmāni tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ sūkṣmapraveśajñānāni yaduta caryāsūkṣmapraveśajñānaṃ vā /🔽cyutyupapattisukṣmapraveśajñānaṃ vā /
analyzed: sa yāni imāni tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sūkṣma praveśa jñānāni yat uta caryā sūkṣma praveśa jñānam vā  cyuti upapatti sukṣma praveśa jñānam vā
translated: He knows these subtle penetrations of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas, namely, the subtle penetration of conduct,🔽the subtle penetration of death and rebirth,

analyzed: janma sūkṣma praveśa jñānam vā
translated: the subtle penetration of birth,

analyzed: abhiniṣkramaṇa sūkṣma praveśa jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of subtle entry into renunciation.

analyzed: abhisaṃbodhi sūkṣma praveśa jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of subtle entry into perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: vikurvaṇa sukṣma praveśa jñānam vā  dharmacakra pravartana sūkṣma praveśa jñānam vā  vā
translated: Or the knowledge of subtle entry into transformation.🔽Or the knowledge of subtle entry into setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion.🔽Or the knowledge of subtle entry into teaching the Dharma.

analyzed: dharma vistara sūkṣma praveśa jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of subtle entry into the vast Dharma.

analyzed: āyuḥ pramāṇa adhiṣṭhāna jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of the power of life.

analyzed: varṇa rūpa kāya saṃdarśana jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of displaying the body of form and appearance.

analyzed: sarva sattva vinaya atikramaṇa jñānam vā  sarva lokadhātu spharaṇa jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of transcending the training of all beings.🔽Or the knowledge of pervading all world systems.

analyzed: sarva sattva citta carita vyavalokana jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of observing the various mental activities of all beings.

analyzed: eka kṣaṇe tri adhva vyavalokana jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of observing the three times in a single moment.

analyzed: pūrva anta apara anta niravaśeṣa jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of the past and future without remainder.

analyzed: sarva sattva citta carita nānātva samanta jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of the diversity of the mental activities of all beings.

analyzed: tathāgata bala vaiśāradya buddha dharma acintya jñānam vā
translated: Or the inconceivable knowledge of the powers, fearlessnesses, and qualities of a Buddha.

analyzed: tathāgata parinirvāṇa jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of the parinirvāṇa of a Tathāgata.

analyzed: śāsana adhiṣṭhāna saddharma sthiti jñānam vā
translated: Or the knowledge of the power of the teachings and the duration of the true Dharma.

analyzed: evaṃpramukhāni aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni tathāgatānām sukṣma praveśa jñānāni
translated: The Tathāgatas have immeasurable and innumerable such subtle penetrations of knowledge.

analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows all of them as they truly are.

original: sa khalu punarbho jinaputrā bodhisattva evamimāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanugato'cintyaṃ ca nāma bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ pratilabhate /

original: anāvaraṇaṃ ca nāma viśuddhivicayaṃ ca nāma samantamukhāvabhāsaṃ ca nāma tathāgatakośaṃ ca nāma apratihatacakrānugataṃ ca nāma tryadhvānugataṃ ca nāma dharmadhātugarbhaṃ ca nāma vimuktimaṇḍalaprabhāsaṃ ca nāma aśeṣaviṣayagamaṃ ca nāma bodhisattvavimokṣaṃ pratilabhate /

translated: and also attains the Bodhisattva liberations called ‘Uncovered,’ ‘Pure Analysis,’ ‘Illumination of All Directions,’ ‘Treasury of the Tathāgatas,’ ‘Following the Unimpeded Wheel,’ ‘Perceiving the Three Times,’ ‘Womb of the Dharma Realm,’ ‘Light of the Circle of Liberation,’ and ‘Reaching All Objects Without Exception.’

original: iti hi bho jinaputrā imān daśa bodhisattvavimokṣān pramukhān kṛtvā aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni bodhisattvavimokṣamukhaśatasahasrāṇi bodhisattvo'syāṃ daśamyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ pratilabhate /
analyzed: iti hi bho jinaputrāḥ imān daśa bodhisattva vimokṣān pramukhān kṛtvā aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni bodhisattva vimokṣa mukha śata sahasrāṇi bodhisattvaḥ ūsyām daśamyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ pratilabhate
translated: Thus, O sons of the Victorious Ones, having taken these ten Bodhisattva liberations as the foremost, the Bodhisattva established in this tenth Bodhisattva stage attains innumerable and countless hundreds of thousands of doors to Bodhisattva liberation.

analyzed: evam yāvat samādhi śata sahasrāṇi dhāraṇī śata sahasrāṇi abhijñā abhinirhāra śata sahasrāṇi pratilabhate
translated: In the same way, he attains hundreds of thousands of concentrations, hundreds of thousands of retentions, and hundreds of thousands of accomplishments of higher knowledge.”

original: jñānālokaśatasahasrāṇi vikurvaṇaśatasahasrāṇi prasaṃvinnirhāraśatasahasrāṇi upāyaprajñāvikrīḍitaśatasahasrāṇi gambhīradharmanayapraveśaśatasahasrāṇi mahākaruṇāvegaśatasahasrāṇi bodhisattvavaśitāpraveśaśatasahasrāṇi pratilabhate //
analyzed: jñāna āloka śata sahasrāṇi vikurvaṇa śata sahasrāṇi prasaṃvid nirhāra śata sahasrāṇi upāya prajñā vikrīḍita śata sahasrāṇi gambhīra dharma naya praveśa śata sahasrāṇi mahā karuṇā vega śata sahasrāṇi bodhisattva vaśitā praveśa śata sahasrāṇi pratilabhate
translated: He attains hundreds of thousands of lights of knowledge, hundreds of thousands of transformations, hundreds of thousands of accomplishments of discernment, hundreds of thousands of displays of skillful means and wisdom, hundreds of thousands of entrances into the profound Dharma way, hundreds of thousands of impulses of great compassion, and hundreds of thousands of entrances into the powers of a bodhisattva.

original: sa evaṃjñānānugatayā buddhyā apramāṇānugatena smṛtikauśalyena samanvāgato bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ evaṃjñāna anugatayā buddhyā apramāṇa anugatena smṛti kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, endowed with a mind that follows such knowledge, he is endowed with skill in immeasurable recollection.

original: sa daśabhyo digbhyo'prameyāṇāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśādekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtenā apramāṇān mahādharmāvabhāsān mahādharmālokān mahādharmameghān sahate saṃpratīcchati svīkaroti saṃghārayati /
analyzed: sa daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ uprameyāṇām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśāt eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena apramāṇān mahā dharma avabhāsān mahā dharma ālokān mahā dharma meghān sahate saṃpratīcchati svīkaroti saṃghārayati
translated: In one instant, moment, or brief period, he receives, accepts, takes up, and upholds immeasurable great illuminations of the Dharma, great lights of the Dharma, and great clouds of the Dharma from the immeasurable Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the ten directions.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrāḥ sāgaranāgarājameghavisṛṣṭo mahānapskandho na sukaro'nyena pṛthivīpradeśena soḍhuṃ vā saṃpratyeṣituṃ vā svīkartuṃ vā saṃdhārayituṃ vā anyatra mahāsamudrāt /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ sāgara nāga rāja megha visṛṣṭaḥ mahān ap skandhaḥ na sukaraḥ anyena pṛthivī pradeśena soḍhum vā saṃpratyeṣitum vā svīkartum vā saṃdhārayitum vā anyatra mahā samudrāt
translated: Just as, sons of the Victorious Ones, the great mass of water released by the clouds of the king of nāgas in the ocean is not easily borne, accepted, taken up, or held by any other part of the earth, except by the great ocean.

original: evameva bho jinaputrā ye te tathāgatānāṃ bhagavatāṃ guhyānupraveśā yaduta mahādharmāvabhāsā mahādharmālokā mahādharmāmeghāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ ye te tathāgatānām bhagavatām guhya anupraveśāḥ yat uta mahā dharma avabhāsāḥ mahā dharma ālokāḥ mahā dharma āmeghāḥ
translated: In the same way, O sons of the Victorious Ones, those secret penetrations of the Blessed Tathagatas, namely the great illumination of the Dharma, the great light of the Dharma, the great rain of the Dharma,

original: te na sukarāḥ sarvasattvaiḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ prathamāṃ bhūmimupādāya yāvannavamībhūmipratiṣṭhitairapi bodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: te na sukarāḥ sarva sattvaiḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ prathamām bhūmim upādāya yāvat navamī bhūmi pratiṣṭhitaiḥ api bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: are not easily endured by all beings, by all Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, or even by Bodhisattvas established in the first stage up to the ninth stage.

original: tān bodhisattvo'syāṃ dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitaḥ sarvān sahate saṃpratīcchati svīkaroti saṃdhārayati /
analyzed: tān bodhisattvaḥ usyām dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ sarvān sahate saṃpratīcchati svīkaroti saṃdhārayati
translated: That Bodhisattva, abiding in this Bodhisattva stage of Dharmamegha, endures all of them, accepts them, takes them up, and holds them.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputrā mahāsamudra ekasyāpi mahābhujagendrasya mahāmeghān sahate / / /dvayorapi trayāṇāmapi yāvadaparimānāṇāmapi bhujagendrāṇāmekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtenāprameyān mahāmeghān sahate / / / /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputrāḥ mahā samudraḥ ekasya api mahā bhujaga indrasya mahā meghān sahate dvayoḥ api trayāṇām api yāvat aparimānāṇām api bhujaga indrāṇām eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena aprameyān mahā meghān sahate
translated: Just as, O sons of the Victorious Ones, the great ocean endures the great clouds of even one great king of serpents, and in one instant, in one moment, it endures immeasurable great clouds of two, three, up to immeasurable kings of serpents.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: apramāṇa vipula vistīrṇa tvāt mahā samudrasya
translated: Because the great ocean is immeasurable, vast, and extensive.

original: evameva bho jinaputrā asyāṃ dharmameghāyām bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattva ekasyāpi tathāgatasya sakāśādekakṣaṇa / / /dvayorapi trayānāmapi yāvadaparimānāṇāmapi tathāgatānāṃ sakāśādekakṣaṇa / / / /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputrāḥ asyām dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ekasya api tathāgatasya sakāśāt eka kṣaṇa dvayoḥ api trayānām api yāvat aparimānāṇām api tathāgatānām sakāśāt eka kṣaṇa
translated: In the same way, O sons of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva established in this Bodhisattva ground Cloud of Dharma, in one instant, in the presence of one Tathagata, in the presence of two, three, up to innumerable Tathagatas, in one instant, in one moment, in one brief moment, he is able to receive and hold the Dharma wheel of the Tathagatas.

analyzed: tatas ucyate iyam bhūmiḥ dharma meghā iti
translated: Therefore, this ground is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: vimukticandro bodhisattva āha śakyaṃ punarbho jinaputra saṃkhyāṃ kartuṃ kiyatāṃ tathāgatānāmantikebhyo bodhisattvaikakṣaṇa / / / /
analyzed: vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha śakyam punar bho jinaputra saṃkhyām kartum kiyatām tathāgatānām antikebhyaḥ bodhisattva ekakṣaṇa
translated: The Bodhisattva Vimuktiचandra said, O son of the Victorious Ones, is it possible to count how many Tathagatas the Bodhisattva receives and holds the Dharma wheel in one instant?

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha na sukarā bho jinaputra saṃkhyā kartu gaṇanānirdeśena iyatāṃ tathāgatānāmantikebhyo bodhisattvaikakṣaṇa / / / /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha na sukarā bho jinaputra saṃkhyā kartu gaṇanā nirdeśena iyatām tathāgatānām antikebhyaḥ bodhisattva ekakṣaṇa
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajragarbha said, O son of the Victorious Ones, it is not easy to count by means of calculation how many Tathagatas the Bodhisattva receives and holds the Dharma wheel in one instant.

analyzed: api tu khalu aupamyam kariṣyāmi
translated: However, I will give a simile.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra daśasu dikṣu daśabuddhakṣetrānabhilāpyakoṭiniyutaśatasahasraparamāṇurajaḥsamāsu lokadhātuṣu yāvat sattvadhātuniravaśeṣayogena saṃvidyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra daśasu dikṣu daśa buddhakṣetra anabhilāpya koṭi niyuta śata sahasra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāsu lokadhātuṣu yāvat sattvadhātu niravaśeṣa yogena saṃvidyate
translated: For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the worlds of the ten directions, in as many worlds as there are atoms in ten inexpressibly vast buddha-fields, to the extent that the realm of beings exists without remainder,

original: tata ekaḥ sattvaḥ śrutagrahaṇadhāraṇīpratilabdho bhavettathāgatānāmupasthāuyako mahāśrāvako'gryaḥ śrutadharāṇām /
analyzed: tatas ekaḥ sattvaḥ śruta grahaṇa dhāraṇī pratilabdhaḥ bhavet tathāgatānām upasthāuyakaḥ mahāśrāvaka ugryaḥ śrutadharāṇām
translated: therein, one being would have attained the power of hearing and retaining what is heard, would be a great hearer who has attended to the Tathagatas, the foremost of those who retain what is heard,

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavato vajrapadmottarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya mahāvijayo nāma bhikṣurevaṃrūpeṇa śrutakauśalyabalādhānena sa ekaḥ sattvaḥ samanvāgato bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavataḥ vajrapadmottarasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya mahāvijayaḥ nāma bhikṣuḥ evaṃrūpeṇa śruta kauśalya bala ādhānena saḥ ekaḥ sattvaḥ samanvāgataḥ bhavet
translated: for example, like the monk named Mahavijaya of the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Vajra Padma Uttara, who would possess such a power of skill in hearing and retaining what is heard.

original: yathā ca sa ekaḥ sattvastathā niravaśeṣāsu sarvāsu lokadhātuṣu te sarve sattvāḥ samanvāgatā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca saḥ ekaḥ sattvaḥ tathā niravaśeṣāsu sarvāsu lokadhātuṣu te sarve sattvāḥ samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And just as that one being is endowed, so would all those beings be endowed in all those worlds without remainder.

analyzed: yat ca ekena udgṛhītam syāt na dvitīyena
translated: And what is retained by one would not be retained by another.

original: tatkiṃ manyase bho jinaputra bahutaraṃ teṣāmaprameyāpramāṇaṃ vā śrutakauśalyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase bho jinaputra bahutaram teṣām aprameya apramāṇam vā śruta kauśalyam bhavet
translated: What do you think, O son of the Victorious Ones, would the skill in hearing and retaining what is heard of those be immeasurable and boundless?

original: vimukticandro bodhisattva āha bahu bho jinaputra apramāṇaṃ tatteṣāṃ sarvasattvānāṃ śrutakauśalyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha bahu bho jinaputra apramāṇam tat teṣām sarva sattvānām śruta kauśalyam bhavet
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti-candra said, Venerable son of the Victorious Ones, the skill in hearing of all those beings would be immeasurable and vast.

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha ārocayāmi te bho jinaputra /🔽prativedayāmi /🔽yaṃ dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattva ekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtenaikasyaiva tāvattathāgatasya sakāśāddharmadhātutryadhvakośaṃ nāma mahādharmāvabhāsālokameghaṃ sahate / / / /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha ārocayāmi te bho jinaputra  prativedayāmi  yam dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena ekasya eva tāvat tathāgatasya sakāśāt dharmadhātu tri adhva kośam nāma mahā dharma avabhāsa āloka megham sahate
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra-garbha said, I declare to you, venerable son of the Victorious Ones, I inform you,🔽that the skill in hearing of those beings would not even come close to a hundredth part of the skill in hearing of a bodhisattva who has attained the Dharma-megha stage of bodhisattva-hood.

analyzed: yasya mahā dharma avabhāsa āloka megha saṃdhāraṇa kauśalyasya tat pūrvakam śruta kauśalyam kṣamate
translated: The skill in hearing of those beings would not even come close to a thousandth, a hundred-thousandth, a koṭī-th, a hundred-koṭī-th, a thousand-koṭī-th, a hundred-thousand-koṭī-th, or even a hundred-thousand-koṭi-niyuta-śatasahasra-th part of the skill in hearing of a bodhisattva who has attained the Dharma-megha stage of bodhisattva-hood.🔽The skill in hearing of those beings would not even come close to a kala, a portion, a part, a fraction, a measure, a comparison, or an example of the skill in hearing of a bodhisattva who has attained the Dharma-megha stage of bodhisattva-hood.

original: yathā caikasya tathāgatasya sakāśāttathā daśasu dikṣu yāvanti tāsu pūrvikāsu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇurajāṃsi saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yathā ca ekasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tathā daśasu dikṣu yāvanti tāsu pūrvikāsu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇu rajāṃsi saṃvidyante
translated: Just as one would be able to bear the great light of the Dharma that arises from the clouds of the great Dharma-illumination of a single Tathāgata, in the same way, a bodhisattva who has attained the Dharma-megha stage of bodhisattva-hood is able to bear the great light of the Dharma that arises from the clouds of the great Dharma-illumination of as many Tathāgatas as there are atoms in all the previous world systems in the ten directions.

original: tāvatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ tato'pi bhūya uttari aprameyāṇāṃ tathāgatānāṃ sakāśādekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena dharmadhātutryadhvakośaṃ nāma mahādharmāvabhāsālokameghaṃ sahate / / / /
analyzed: tāvatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām tatas api bhūyaḥ uttari aprameyāṇām tathāgatānām sakāśāt eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena dharmadhātu tri adhva kośam nāma mahā dharma avabhāsa āloka megham sahate
translated: In one instant, he can receive the great light of the Dharma, the cloud of light called the Treasury of the Dharma Realm of the Three Times, from that many perfectly enlightened Buddhas, and even more, from immeasurable Tathāgatas.

analyzed: tatas ucyate iyam bhūmiḥ dharma meghā iti
translated: Therefore, this stage is called the Dharma Cloud.

original: punaraparaṃ bho jinaputra dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvaḥ svapraṇidhānabalādhānato mahākṛpākaruṇāmeghaṃ samutthāpya mahādharmāvabhāsagarjanamabhijñāvidyāvaiśāradyavidyudvidyotitaṃ mahāraśmimārutasamīritaṃ mahāpuṇyajñānaghanābhrajālasaṃdarśanaṃ vividhakāyaghanāvartasaṃdarśanaṃ mahādharmanirnādanaṃ namuciparṣadvidrāvaṇamekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena daśasu dikṣu yāvanti tāsu lokadhātuṣu tāni paramāṇurajāṃsi saṃvidyante tāvanti lokadhātukoṭinayutaśatasahasrāṇi spharitvā tebhyo'pi bhūyo'prameyāṇi lokadhātukotinayutaśatasahasrāṇi spharitvā mahāmṛtakuśaladhārābhipravarṣaṇena yathāśayataḥ sattvānāmajñānasamutthitāḥ sarvakleśarajojvālāḥ praśamayati /
analyzed: punar aparam bho jinaputra dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sva praṇidhāna bala ādhānataḥ mahā kṛpā karuṇā megham samutthāpya mahā dharma avabhāsa garjanam abhijñā vidyā vaiśāradya vidyut vidyotitam mahā raśmi māruta samīritam mahā puṇya jñāna ghana abhra jāla saṃdarśanam vividha kāya ghana āvarta saṃdarśanam mahā dharma nirnādanam namuci parṣad vidrāvaṇam eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena daśasu dikṣu yāvanti tāsu lokadh
translated: Furthermore, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva established in the Dharmamegha stage, having aroused the cloud of great compassion through the power of his own vows, with the thunder of the great Dharma, the lightning flashes of his higher knowledge, wisdom, and fearlessness, the great light rays and winds, the display of the net of clouds of great merit and wisdom, the display of various bodily whirlpools, the great sound of the Dharma, and the scattering of the assembly of demons, in a single moment, an instant, a second, pervades as many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of world systems in the ten directions as there are atoms in those worlds. And he pervades even more, countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of world systems, and by the rain of the great nectar of virtue, he extinguishes the flames of all the afflictions that arise from ignorance in the minds of beings, according to their dispositions.

analyzed: tatas ucyate iyam bhūmiḥ dharma meghā iti
translated: Therefore, this stage is called Dharmamegha.

original: punaraparaṃ bho jinaputra dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattva ekasyāmapi lokadhātau tuṣitavarabhavanavāsamupādāya cyavanācaṃkramaṇagarbhasthitijanmābhiniṣkramaṇābhisaṃbodhyadhyeṣaṇamahādharmacakrapravartanamahāparinirvāṇabhūmiriti sarvatathāgatakāryamadhitiṣṭhati yathāśayeṣu sattveṣu yathāvaineyikeṣu /
analyzed: punar aparam bho jinaputra dharmameghāyām bodhisattvaḥ ekasyām api lokadhātau tuṣita vara bhavana vāsam upādāya cyavanā caṃkramaṇa garbha sthiti janma abhiniṣkramaṇa abhisaṃbodhi adhyeṣaṇa mahā dharma cakra pravartana mahā parinirvāṇa bhūmiḥ iti sarva tathāgata kāryam adhitiṣṭhati yathā āśayeṣu sattveṣu yathā vaineyikeṣu
translated: Moreover, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, in the Dharmamegha stage, a bodhisattva, starting from residing in the excellent Tusita heaven, manifests all the activities of a Tathagata in a single world realm, such as passing away, descending, residing in the womb, birth, leaving home, attaining supreme enlightenment, being requested [to teach], turning the great wheel of Dharma, and attaining great parinirvana, for beings with various inclinations and those to be guided.

original: evaṃ dvayorapi yāvadyāvanti tāsu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇurajāṃsi saṃvidyante /
analyzed: evam dvayoḥ api yāvat yāvanti tāsu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇu rajāṃsi saṃvidyante
translated: In the same way, he manifests all the activities of a Tathagata in two world realms, up to as many world realms as there are atoms in all those realms.

original: tato'pi bhūyo'prameyeṣu lokadhātukoṭiniyutaśatasahasreṣu tāni paramāṇu / / / vaineyikeṣu //
analyzed: tatas api bhūyas uprameyeṣu lokadhātu koṭi niyuta śata sahasreṣu tāni paramāṇu vaineyikeṣu
translated: And even more, in countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of world realms, in those world realms, the atoms... for those to be guided.

original: sa evaṃjñānavaśitāprāptaḥ suviniścitamahājñānābhijña ākāṅkṣan saṃkliṣṭāyā lokadhātoḥ pariśuddhatāmadhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: saḥ evam jñāna vaśitā prāptaḥ su viniścita mahā jñāna abhijñaḥ ākāṅkṣan saṃkliṣṭāyāḥ lokadhātoḥ pariśuddha tām adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Having attained such mastery of knowledge, with well-ascertained great knowledge and supernormal powers, if he wishes, he manifests the purity of a defiled world realm.

analyzed: pariśuddhāyāḥ lokadhātoḥ saṃkliṣṭa tām adhitiṣṭhati
translated: He manifests the defilement of a pure world realm.

analyzed: saṃkṣiptāyāḥ lokadhātoḥ vistīrṇa tām adhitiṣṭhati
translated: He determines the extension of a contracted world-sphere,

analyzed: vistīrṇāyāḥ saṃkṣipta tām adhitiṣṭhati
translated: and the contraction of an extended one.

analyzed: evam vipula mahat gata apramāṇa sūkṣma audārika vyatyastau amūrdhama tala ādīnām sarva lokadhātūnām vṛṣabha tayā anantam abhinirhāram adhitiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, he determines the infinite manifestation of all world-spheres, such as extensive, great, infinite, subtle, gross, inverted, upside-down, etc., as supreme.

original: ākāṅkṣan ekasmin paramāṇurajasyekāmapi lokadhātuṃ sarvāvatīṃ sacakravālaparikhāmadhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan ekasmin paramāṇu rajasi ekām api lokadhātum sarvāvatīm sa cakravāla parikhām adhitiṣṭhati
translated: If he wishes, he determines one entire world-sphere with its Cakravāḍa mountains and moats in a single atomic particle.

original: tacca paramāṇurajo na vardhayati tāṃ ca kriyāmādarśayati /
analyzed: tat ca paramāṇu rajaḥ na vardhayati tām ca kriyām ādarśayati
translated: And that atomic particle does not increase, and he displays that action.

original: dve'pi tisro'pi catasro'pi pañcāpi yāvadanabhilāpyāpi lokadhāturekasmin paramāṇurajasi sarvāḥ sacakravālaparikhā adhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: dve api tisraḥ api catasraḥ api pañca api yāvat anabhilāpyā api lokadhātuḥ ekasmin paramāṇu rajasi sarvāḥ sa cakravāla parikhāḥ adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Two, three, four, five, up to inexpressibly many world-spheres with their Cakravāḍa mountains and moats, he determines in a single atomic particle.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan ekasyām lokadhātau dvi lokadhātu vyūham ādarśayati
translated: If he wishes, he displays the arrangement of two world-spheres in one world-sphere.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan yāvat anabhilāpya lokadhātu vyūham ādarśayati
translated: If he wishes, he displays the arrangement of up to inexpressibly many world-spheres.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan eka lokadhātu vyūham dvayoḥ lokadhātvoḥ ādarśayati
translated: If he wishes, he displays the arrangement of one world-sphere in two world-spheres.

analyzed: yāvat anabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu ādarśayati
translated: If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.

original: ākāṅkṣan yāvadanabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu yaḥ sattvadhātustamekasyāṃ lokadhātau saṃdadhāti /🔽na ca sattvān viheṭhayati /🔽ākāṅkṣan ekasyāṃ lokadhātau yāvān sattvadhātustamanabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu saṃdadhāti / / / /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan yāvat anabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu yaḥ sattvadhātuḥ tam ekasyām lokadhātau saṃdadhāti  na ca sattvān viheṭhayati  ākāṅkṣan ekasyām lokadhātau yāvān sattvadhātuḥ tam anabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu saṃdadhāti
translated: If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.

original: ākāṅkṣan anabhilāpyalokadhātugatān sattvānekavālapathe saṃdadhāti / / / /🔽ākāṅkṣan ekavālapathe ekaṃ sarvabuddhaviṣayavyūhamādarśayati /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan anabhilāpya lokadhātu gatān sattvān eka vālapathe saṃdadhāti  ākāṅkṣan eka vālapathe ekam sarva buddha viṣaya vyūham ādarśayati
translated: If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.

original: ākāṅkṣan yāvadanabhilāpyān sarvākārabuddhaviṣayavyūhānādarśayati /🔽ākāṅkṣan yāvantyanabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇurajāṃsi tāvata ātmabhāvānekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena nirmimīte /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣan yāvat anabhilāpyān sarva ākāra buddha viṣaya vyūhān ādarśayati  ākāṅkṣan yāvanti anabhilāpyāsu lokadhātuṣu paramāṇu rajāṃsi tāvataḥ ātma bhāvān eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena nirmimīte
translated: If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.

original: ekaikasmiṃśca ātmabhāve tāvata eva pāṇīn saṃdarśayati /
analyzed: ekaikasmin ca ātma bhāve tāvataḥ eva pāṇīn saṃdarśayati
translated: If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.

analyzed: taiḥ ca pāṇibhiḥ daśasu dikṣu buddha pūjāyām prayujyate
translated: If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm of a Buddha as far as the world spheres in the ten directions.🔽If he wishes, he displays in one world sphere the entire arrangement of the realm

original: ekaikena ca pāṇinā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamān puṣpapuṭāṃsteṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kṣipati /
analyzed: ekaikena ca pāṇinā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān puṣpa puṭān teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām kṣipati
