translated: With each hand he throws handfuls of flowers to those Buddha Bhagavats, as many as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: yathā puṣpāṇāmevaṃ gandhānāṃ mālyānāṃ vilepanānāṃ cūrṇānāṃ cīvarāṇāṃ chatrāṇāṃ dhvajānāṃ patākānāmevaṃ sarvavyūhānām /
analyzed: yathā puṣpāṇām evam gandhānām mālyānām vilepanānām cūrṇānām cīvarāṇām chatrāṇām dhvajānām patākānām evam sarva vyūhānām
translated: Just as with flowers, so also with perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, garments, parasols, banners, flags, and all adornments.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca kāye tāvanti eva śirāṃsi adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And in each body he establishes as many heads.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca śirasi tāvatīḥ eva jihvāḥ adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And in each head he establishes as many tongues.

analyzed: tābhiḥ teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām varṇam bhāṣate
translated: With those he praises the qualities of those Buddha Bhagavats.

analyzed: citta utpāde ca daśa diś haraṇam gacchāti
translated: And in each thought he extends to the ten directions.

analyzed: citta kṣaṇe ca apramāṇāḥ abhisaṃbodhīḥ yāvat mahāparinirvāṇa avyūhān adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And in each thought he establishes immeasurable complete enlightenments, up to the great parinirvāṇa adornments.

analyzed: apramāṇa kāya tām ca traya dhva tāyām adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he establishes immeasurable bodies in the three times.

analyzed: sva kāye ca apramāṇānām buddhānām bhagavatām aprameyān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And in his own body he establishes the immeasurable Buddha Bhagavats and the immeasurable adornments of the Buddha fields.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu saṃvarta vivarta vyūhān ca sva kāyedhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he establishes in his own body the adornments of the dissolution and evolution of all world systems.

analyzed: sarvāḥ vātamaṇḍalīḥ ca eka romakūpāt utsṛjati
translated: He emits all the wind maṇḍalas from a single pore.

analyzed: na ca sattvān viheṭhayati
translated: And he does not harm any beings.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣan ca ekām ap skandha paryantam lokadhātum adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And if he wishes, he controls the world-realm up to the sphere of water.

analyzed: tasyām ca mahāpadmam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he controls a great lotus in that [world-realm].

original: tasya ca mahāpadmasya prabhāvabhāsavyūhena anantā lokadhātūḥ spharati /
analyzed: tasya ca mahāpadmasya prabhā avabhāsa vyūhena anantāḥ lokadhātūḥ spharati
translated: And with the array of the light of the splendor of that great lotus, he fills the infinite world-realms.

analyzed: tatra ca mahā bodhivṛkṣam ādarśayati
translated: And he displays a great Bodhi tree there.

analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra vara upetam sarvajñāna tvam saṃdarśayati
translated: Up to he displays the state of omniscience endowed with all the supreme aspects.

analyzed: sva kāye daśa diś maṇi vidyut candra sūrya prabhāḥ yāvat sarva avabhāsa prabhāḥ adhitiṣṭhati
translated: He controls the light of all the jewels, lightning, moon, sun, and radiance in his own body in the ten directions.

original: ekamukhavātena caikaikasyā diśaḥ pratidiśamanantā lokadhātūḥ kampayati /
analyzed: eka mukha vātena ca ekaikasyāḥ diśaḥ pratidiśam anantāḥ lokadhātūḥ kampayati
translated: And with a single breath from his mouth, he shakes the infinite world-realms in each direction of the one direction.

analyzed: na ca sattvān uttrāsayati
translated: And he does not frighten any beings.

analyzed: daśa diśam ca vāta saṃvartanīm tejaḥ saṃvartanīm ap saṃvartanīm adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he controls the wind, fire, and water destructions in the ten directions.

analyzed: sarva sattvān ca ākāṅkṣan yathā abhiprāyam rūpa āśraya alaṃkṛtān adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And if he wishes, he controls all beings adorned with forms according to their intentions.

analyzed: sva kāye ca tathāgata kāyam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he controls the Tathāgata's body in his own body.

analyzed: tathāgata kāye ca sva kāyam adhitiṣṭhati  tathāgata kāye sva buddhakṣetram adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he manifests his own body in the body of the Tathāgata.🔽And he manifests his own buddha-field in the body of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: sva buddhakṣetre ca tathāgata kāyam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And he manifests the body of the Tathāgata in his own buddha-field.

original: iti hi bho jinaputra dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhito bodhisattva imāni cānyāni cāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni ṛddhivikurvaṇakoṭinayutaśatasahasrāṇyādarśayati
analyzed: iti hi bho jinaputra dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ imāni ca anyāni ca aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni ṛddhi vikurvaṇa koṭi nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ādarśayati
translated: Thus, O son of the victors, the bodhisattva established in the Dharma-cloud bodhisattva bhūmi manifests these and other countless, innumerable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of miraculous transformations.

original: atha khalu tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ keṣāṃcidbodhisattvānāṃ keṣāṃciddevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragaśakrabrahmalokapālamaheśvaraśuddhāvāsānāmetadabhavat yadi tāvadbodhisattvasyaivamapramāṇa ṛddhyabhisaṃskāragocaraḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ keṣāṃcid bodhisattvānām keṣāṃcid deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga śakra brahma lokapāla maheśvara śuddhāvāsānām etat abhavat yadi tāvat bodhisattvasya evam apramāṇaḥ ṛddhi abhisaṃskāra gocaraḥ
translated: Then, in that assembly, some bodhisattvas, some devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, Śakras, Brahmās, world guardians, Maheśvaras, and Śuddhāvāsas had this thought: If the bodhisattva's range of miraculous transformations is thus immeasurable,

analyzed: tathāgatānām punar kiṃrūpaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: what will the tathāgatas' be like?

original: atha khalu vimukticandro bodhisattvastasyāḥ parṣadaścittāśayavicāramājñāya vajragarbhaṃ bodhisattvametadavocat saṃśayitā bateyaṃ bho jinaputra parṣat /
analyzed: atha khalu vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ citta āśaya vicāram ājñāya vajragarbham bodhisattvam etat avocat saṃśayitā bata iyam bho jinaputra parṣad
translated: Then the bodhisattva Moon of Liberation, knowing the thoughts and intentions of that assembly, said this to the bodhisattva Vajra Treasury: Oh son of the Victorious Ones, this assembly is indeed doubtful.

original: sādhu / asyāḥ saṃśayacchityarthaṃ kiṃcinmātraṃ bodhisattvavyūhaprātihāryaṃ saṃdarśaya /🔽atha khalu vajragarbho bodhisattvastasyāṃ velāyāṃ sarvabuddhakṣetrakāyasvabhāvasaṃdarśanaṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: sādhu asyāḥ saṃśaya chiti artham kiṃcid mātram bodhisattva vyūha prātihāryam saṃdarśaya  atha khalu vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tasyām velāyām sarvabuddhakṣetrakāyasvabhāvasaṃdarśanam nāma bodhisattva samādhim samāpadyate
translated: It would be good if, for the sake of dispelling their doubts, you would display a mere fraction of the marvel of the array of bodhisattvas.🔽Then the bodhisattva Vajra Treasury, at that time, entered the bodhisattva's concentration called Displaying the Nature of the Bodies of All Buddha Fields.

analyzed: samanantara samāpanne vajragarbhe bodhisattve sarva buddhakṣetra kāya svabhāva saṃdarśanam bodhisattva samādhim
translated: Immediately after the bodhisattva Vajra Treasury entered the bodhisattva's concentration called Displaying the Nature of the Bodies of All Buddha Fields,

original: atha tāvadeva sā sarvāvatī bodhisattvaparṣat sā ca devanāgayakṣaśuddhāvāsaparṣad vajragarbhasya bodhisattvasya kāyāntarībhūtamātmānaṃ saṃjānīte
analyzed: atha tāvat eva sā sarvāvatī bodhisattva parṣad sā ca deva nāga yakṣa śuddhāvāsa parṣad vajragarbhasya bodhisattvasya kāya antarībhūtam ātmānam saṃjānīte
translated: then at that very moment, the entire assembly of bodhisattvas and the assembly of gods, nagas, yakshas, and Shuddhavasas perceived themselves as having become the body of the bodhisattva Vajra Treasury,

analyzed: tatra ca buddhakṣetram abhinirvṛtam saṃjānīte sma
translated: and they perceived that buddha field as having been manifested.

original: tasmiṃśca buddhakṣetre ye ākāravyūhāste na sukarāḥ paripūrṇayāpi kalpakoṭyā prabhāvayitum /
analyzed: tasmin ca buddhakṣetre ye ākāra vyūhāḥ te na sukarāḥ paripūrṇayā api kalpa koṭyā prabhāvayitum
translated: And in that Buddha-field, the forms and arrays are not easily described even in a hundred thousand eons.

original: tatra ca bodhivṛkṣaṃ daśatrisāhasraśatasahasraviṣkambhaskandhaṃ paripūrṇatrisāhasrakoṭivipulāpramāṇaviṭapodviddhaśikharaṃ tadanurūpaṃ ca tasmin bodhimaṇḍe siṃhāsanavaipulyaṃ tatra sarvābhijñāmatirājaṃ nāma tathāgataṃ bodhimaṇḍavaragataṃ samapaśyat /
analyzed: tatra ca bodhivṛkṣam daśa tri sāhasra śata sahasra viṣkambha skandham paripūrṇa tri sāhasra koṭi vipula apramāṇa viṭapa udviddha śikharam tad anurūpam ca tasmin bodhimaṇḍe siṃhāsana vaipulyam tatra sarvābhijñāmatirājam nāma tathāgatam bodhimaṇḍa vara gatam samapaśyat
translated: And there, the Bodhi tree had a trunk extending for three hundred thousand leagues, with branches spreading for a thousand leagues, and its peak rising to an immeasurable height. And in that Bodhimanda, the lion throne was vast, befitting that tree. There, he saw the Tathagata named Sarvaabhijñaamatiraja, who had gone to the excellent Bodhimanda.

original: iti hi yāvantastatra vyūhāḥ saṃdṛśyante te na sukarāḥ paripūrṇayāpi kalpakoṭyā prabhāvayitum /🔽sa idaṃ mahāprātihāryaṃ saṃdarśya tāṃ sarvāvatīṃ bodhisattvaparṣadaṃ tāṃ ca devanāga / / / śuddhāvāsaparṣadaṃ punareva yathāsthāne sthāpayāmāsa
analyzed: iti hi yāvantaḥ tatra vyūhāḥ saṃdṛśyante te na sukarāḥ paripūrṇayā api kalpa koṭyā prabhāvayitum  saḥ idam mahā prātihāryam saṃdarśya tām sarvāvatīm bodhisattva parṣadam tām ca deva nāga śuddhāvāsa parṣadam punar eva yathāsthāne sthāpayāmāsa
translated: Thus, the arrays that were seen there are not easily described even in a hundred thousand eons.🔽Having shown this great miracle, he again established that entire assembly of Bodhisattvas, and that assembly of gods, Nagas, and so forth up to the Pure Abodes, in their respective places.

original: atha khalu sā sarvāvatī parṣadāścaryaprāptā tūṣṇīṃbhūtā tameva vajragarbhaṃ bodhisattvaṃ nidhyāyantī sthitābhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu sā sarvāvatī parṣad āścarya prāptā tūṣṇīṃbhūtā tam eva vajragarbham bodhisattvam nidhyāyantī sthitā abhūt
translated: Then, that entire assembly, filled with wonder, became silent and stood gazing at the Bodhisattva Vajragarbha.

original: atha khalu vimukticandro bodhisattvo vajragarbhaṃ bodhisattvametadavocat āścaryamidaṃ bho jinaputra /
analyzed: atha khalu vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ vajragarbham bodhisattvam etat avocat āścaryam idam bho jinaputra
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vimukti-candra said this to the bodhisattva Vajra-garbha: This is wonderful, O son of the Victorious Ones!

analyzed: adbhutam yāvat acintya upamasya samādheḥ nimeṣa vyūha prabhāvaḥ
translated: How marvelous is the power of the concentration called 'Inconceivable,' which is manifested in an instant.

analyzed: tat kaḥ nāma ayam bho jinaputra samādhiḥ
translated: What is the name of this concentration, O son of the Victorious Ones?

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha sarvabuddhakṣetrakāyasvabhāvasaṃdarśano nāmāyaṃ bho jinaputra samādhiḥ /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha sarva buddhakṣetra kāya svabhāva saṃdarśanaḥ nāma ayam bho jinaputra samādhiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra-garbha said: This concentration, O son of the Victorious Ones, is called 'The Demonstration of the Nature of the Bodies in All Buddha-fields.'

original: vimukticandro bodhisattva āha kaḥ punarbho jinaputra asya samādhergocaraviṣayavyūhaḥ /
analyzed: vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha kaḥ punar bho jinaputra asya samādheḥ gocara viṣaya vyūhaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti-candra said: What, O son of the Victorious Ones, is the arrangement of the sphere and domain of this concentration?

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha ākāṅkṣan bho jinaputra bodhisattvo'sya samādheḥ suparibhāvitatvādgaṅgānadīvālikāsamalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamāni daśa buddhakṣetrāṇi svakāye ādarśayet /🔽ato vā bhūya uttari /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha ākāṅkṣan bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ sya samādheḥ su paribhāvita tvāt gaṅgā nadī vālikā sama lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni daśa buddhakṣetrāṇi sva kāye ādarśayet 🔽atas vā bhūyaḥ uttari
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra-garbha said: If he wishes, O son of the Victorious Ones, a bodhisattva who has thoroughly cultivated this concentration would manifest in his own body the ten buddha-fields, equal in number to the atoms in the dust of the earth in the Ganges river, or even more than that.

original: īdṛśānāṃ bho jinaputra bodhisattvasamādhīnāṃ dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattvo bahūni śatasahasrāṇi pratilabhate /
analyzed: īdṛśānām bho jinaputra bodhisattva samādhīnām dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bahūni śata sahasrāṇi pratilabhate
translated: O son of the Victorious Ones, a Bodhisattva who is on the Bodhisattva ground Cloud of Dharma attains many hundreds of thousands of such Bodhisattva concentrations.

original: tena tasya bodhisattvasya yāvad yauvarājyaprāptairapi bodhisattvaiḥ sādhumatībodhisattvabhūmau pratiṣṭhitairna sukaraḥ kāyaḥ kāyakarma vā jñātum
analyzed: tena tasya bodhisattvasya yāvat yauvarājya prāptaiḥ api bodhisattvaiḥ sādhumatī bodhisattva bhūmau pratiṣṭhitaiḥ na sukaraḥ kāyaḥ kāya karma vā jñātum
translated: For that Bodhisattva, it is not easy for even Bodhisattvas who have attained the status of crown prince and are established on the Bodhisattva ground Excellent Mind to know his body or bodily actions,

analyzed: na sukarā vāc vāc karma vā jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his speech or verbal actions,

original: na sukaraṃ mano manaskarma vā jñātum /
analyzed: na sukaram manaḥ manaskarma vā jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his mind or mental actions,

analyzed: na sukarā ṛddhiḥ jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his supernormal powers,

analyzed: na sukaram tri adhva vilokitam jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his survey of the three times,

analyzed: na sukaraḥ samādhi gocara anupraveśaḥ jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his entry into the domain of concentration,

analyzed: na sukaraḥ jñāna viṣayaḥ jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his sphere of knowledge,

original: na sukaraṃ vimokṣavikrīḍitaṃ jñātum /🔽na sukaraṃ nirmāṇakarma vā adhiṣṭhānakarma vā prabhākarma vā prabhākarma vā jñātum /
analyzed: na sukaram vimokṣa vikrīḍitam jñātum  na sukaram nirmāṇa karma vā adhiṣṭhāna karma vā prabhā karma vā prabhā karma vā jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know his play in liberation,🔽it is not easy to know his emanation actions, his consecration actions, or his radiance actions,

analyzed: na sukaram yāvat samāsatas krama utkṣepa nikṣepa karma api jñātum
translated: it is not easy to know even his actions of raising and lowering his feet, let alone his other actions.

analyzed: yāvat yauvarājya
translated: up to: the status of crown prince...

original: evamapramāṇā bho jinaputra iyaṃ dharmameghā bodhisattvabhūmiḥ samāsanirdeśataḥ /
analyzed: evam apramāṇā bho jinaputra iyam dharmameghā bodhisattva bhūmiḥ samāsa nirdeśataḥ
translated: Thus, O son of the Victorious Ones, this Bodhisattva Ground of Cloud of Dharma is immeasurable when taught concisely.

analyzed: vistaraśaḥ punar asaṃkhyeya kalpa śata sahasra nirdeśa aparyanta ākārataḥ draṣṭavyā
translated: Moreover, it should be seen as having an endless mode of teaching that extends over a hundred thousand innumerable eons, when taught extensively.

original: vimukticandro bodhisattva āha kidṛśo bho jinaputra tathāgatagocaraviṣayapraveśo yatredaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ caryāviṣayādhiṣṭhānamevamaopramāṇam /
analyzed: vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha kidṛśaḥ bho jinaputra tathāgata gocara viṣaya praveśaḥ yatra idam bodhisattvānām caryā viṣaya adhiṣṭhānam evam ao pramāṇam
translated: The Bodhisattva Vimukti-candra said, O son of the Victorious Ones, what kind of entry into the domain of experience of the Tathagata is it, where this domain of experience of the conduct of the Bodhisattvas is thus immeasurable?

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha tadyathāpi nāma syādbho jinaputra kaścideva puruṣaścaturdvīpikāyā lokadhātordvau trīn vā kolāsthimātrān pāṣāṇān gṛhitvaivaṃ vadet kiyatī nu khalu sā pṛthivīdhāturaparyantāsu lokadhātuṣu itaḥ pāṣāṇebhyo mahadgatatayā vā pramāṇatveneti /
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha tat yathā api nāma syāt bho jinaputra kaścid eva puruṣaḥ catur dvīpikāyāḥ lokadhātoḥ dvau trīn vā kola asthi mātrān pāṣāṇān gṛhitvā evam vadet kiyatī nu khalu sā pṛthivī dhātuḥ aparyantāsu lokadhātuṣu itas pāṣāṇebhyaḥ mahadgata tayā vā pramāṇa tvena iti
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajra-garbha said, For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, suppose some person were to take two or three mustard seeds the size of a koli-seed from the four-continent world-system and say, 'How great is that earth element in the limitless world-systems compared to these stones, in terms of magnitude or measure?'

analyzed: īdṛśam idam mama tvad vacanam pratibhāti
translated: This is how your statement appears to me.

original: yastvamapramāṇajñānināṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ dharmatāṃ bodhisattvadharmatayā tulayasi /
analyzed: yaḥ tvam apramāṇa jñāninām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām dharmatām bodhisattva dharmatayā tulayasi
translated: You compare the reality of the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, who have immeasurable knowledge, with the reality of a bodhisattva.

original: api tu khalu punarbho jinaputra yathā cāturdvīpikāyā lokadhātoḥ parīttā pṛthivīdhāturyā udgṛhītāpramāṇāvaśiṣṭā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bho jinaputra yathā cāturdvīpikāyāḥ lokadhātoḥ parīttā pṛthivī dhātuḥ yā udgṛhītā a pramāṇa avaśiṣṭā
translated: Moreover, O son of the Victorious One, just as the limited earth element of the world system of four continents is grasped, and the immeasurable remainder,

original: evameva bho jinaputra asyā eva tāvaddharmameghāyā bodhisattvabhūmeraprameyān kalpānnirdiśyamānāyāḥ pradeśamātraṃ nirdiṣṭaṃ syāt /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra asyāḥ eva tāvat dharmameghāyāḥ bodhisattva bhūmeḥ aprameyān kalpān nirdiśyamānāyāḥ pradeśa mātram nirdiṣṭam syāt
translated: in the same way, O son of the Victorious One, if the stage of Dharmamegha of the bodhisattvas were explained for immeasurable eons, only a part of it could be explained.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ tathāgata bhūmeḥ
translated: What to speak of the stage of the Tathāgata!

analyzed: ārocayāmi te bho jinaputra
translated: I declare to you, O son of the Victorious One.

analyzed: prativedayāmi
translated: I make it known.

original: ayaṃ me tathāgataḥ purataḥ sthitaḥ sākṣībhūtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam me tathāgataḥ puratas sthitaḥ sākṣībhūtaḥ
translated: This Tathāgata is present before me as a witness.

original: sacedbho jinaputra daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyāṃ diśi aparyantalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamāni buddhakṣetrāṇyevaṃbhūmiprāptairbodhisattvaiḥ pūrṇāni bhaveyuryathekṣuvanaṃ vā naḍavanaṃ vā veṇuvanaṃ vā tilavanaṃ vā śālivanaṃ va /
analyzed: saced bho jinaputra daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi aparyanta lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni buddhakṣetrāṇi evaṃbhūmi prāptaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ pūrṇāni bhaveyuḥ yathā ikṣu vanam vā naḍa vanam vā veṇu vanam vā tila vanam vā śāli vanam vā
translated: If, O son of the Victorious One, in the ten directions, in each direction, the buddha-fields equal to the atoms in the limitless world systems were filled with bodhisattvas who have attained this stage, like a grove of sugarcane, a grove of reeds, a grove of bamboo, a grove of sesame, or a grove of rice,

analyzed: teṣām aparyanta kalpa abhinirhṛtaḥ bodhisattva caryā abhinirhāra tathāgatasya eka kṣaṇa jñāna prasṛtasya tathāgata viṣayasya
translated: The domain of the Tathāgata, which is accomplished in an instant of knowledge of the Tathāgata, is beyond the accomplishment of the bodhisattva conduct in those endless eons.

original: iti hi bho jinaputra evaṃjñānānugato bodhisattvastathāgatādvayakāyavākcitto bodhisattvasamādhibalaṃ ca notsṛjati buddhadarśanapūjopasthānaṃ ca karoti /
analyzed: iti hi bho jinaputra evaṃjñāna anugataḥ bodhisattvaḥ tathāgata advaya kāya vāc cittaḥ bodhisattva samādhi balam ca nā utsṛjati buddha darśana pūjā upasthānam ca karoti
translated: Thus, O son of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who is endowed with such knowledge, whose body, speech, and mind are non-dual with the Tathāgata, does not abandon the power of the bodhisattva's concentration, and he performs the service of seeing, worshipping, and attending to the Buddhas.

analyzed: saḥ ekaikasmin kalpe paryantān tathāgatān sarva ākāra abhinirhāra pūjābhiḥ pūjayati
translated: In each eon, he worships the endless Tathāgatas with all kinds of offerings.

original: audārikānugatayā pūjayā teṣāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmadhiṣṭhānāvabhāsaṃ saṃpratīcchati /
analyzed: audārika anugatayā pūjayā teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatām adhiṣṭhāna avabhāsam saṃpratīcchati
translated: With an offering that accords with the gross, he receives the empowerment and illumination of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā asaṃhāryo bhavati dharmadhātuvibhaktiparipṛcchānirdeśaiḥ /
analyzed: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā asaṃhāryaḥ bhavati dharmadhātu vibhakti paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: He becomes even more unassailable by the explanations of the questions regarding the divisions of the dharma-dhātu.

analyzed: anekān kalpān anekāni kalpa śatāni anekāni kalpa koṭi nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: For many eons, many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, many millions of eons, many hundreds of millions of eons, many billions of eons, many hundreds of billions of eons, many trillions of eons, and many hundreds of trillions of eons,

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra divyakarmārakṛtaṃ mahābharaṇopacāraṃ mahāmaṇiratnapratyuptaṃ vaśavartino devarājasyottamāṅge kaṇṭhe vā āvaddhamasaṃhāryaṃ bhavati tadanyairdivyamānuṣyakairābharaṇavibhūṣaṇopacāraiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra divya karmāra kṛtam mahā ābharaṇa upacāram mahā maṇi ratna pratyuptam vaśavartinaḥ devarājasya uttamāṅge kaṇṭhe vā āvaddham asaṃhāryam bhavati tad anyaiḥ divya mānuṣyakaiḥ ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇa upacāraiḥ
translated: For example, son of the victors, a great ornament made by a divine craftsman, inlaid with great precious jewels, worn on the head or neck of the king of the devas who rules over others, cannot be surpassed by other divine or human ornaments.

original: evameva bho jinaputra bodhisattvasyemāṃ daśamīṃ dharmameghāṃ bhodhisattvabhūmimanuprāptasya te bodhisattvajñanopacārā asaṃhāryā bhavanti sarvasattvaiḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ prathamāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimupādāya yāvannavamīṃ bodhisattvabhūmimanuprāptairbodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya imām daśamīm dharmameghām bhodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptasya te bodhisattva jñanā upacārāḥ asaṃhāryāḥ bhavanti sarva sattvaiḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ prathamām bodhisattva bhūmim upādāya yāvat navamīm bodhisattva bhūmim anuprāptaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: In the same way, son of the victors, the ornaments of the bodhisattva's wisdom on this tenth bodhisattva stage, the stage Cloud of Dharma, cannot be surpassed by all beings, by all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, or by bodhisattvas who have attained from the first to the ninth bodhisattva stage.

original: asyāṃ ca bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya jñānavabhāsaḥ sattvānāṃ yāvatsarvajñajñānāvatārāya saṃvartate'saṃhāryastadanyairjñānāvabhāsaiḥ
analyzed: asyām ca bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya bodhisattvasya jñāna avabhāsaḥ sattvānām yāvat sarvajña jñāna avatārāya saṃvartate saṃhāryaḥ tad anyaiḥ jñāna avabhāsaiḥ
translated: And for beings on this bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva's wisdom light functions to introduce them to the knowledge of all aspects, and it cannot be surpassed by other wisdom lights.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra maheśvarasya devarājasyābhā atikrāntā bhavati sarvopapattyāyatanāni /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra maheśvarasya devarājasya ābhā atikrāntā bhavati sarva upapatti āyatanāni
translated: For example, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the light of the king of gods Maheśvara surpasses all the places of rebirth.

analyzed: sattvānām ca kāya āśrayān prahlādayati
translated: It delights the bodies of beings.

original: evameva bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya asyāṃ daśabhyāṃ dharmameghāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthitasya jñānābhā asaṃhāryā bhavati sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ prathamāṃ bodhisattvabhūmimupādāya yāvannavamībodhisattvabhūmipratiṣṭhitairbodhisattvairyāvatsarvajñajñānadharmatāyāṃ ca sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayati sa khalu punarbho jinaputra bodhisattva evaṃjñānānugato buddhairbhagavadbhistryadhvajñānaṃ ca saṃśrāvyate /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya asyām daśabhyām dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitasya jñāna ābhā asaṃhāryā bhavati sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ prathamām bodhisattva bhūmim upādāya yāvat navamī bodhisattva bhūmi pratiṣṭhitaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ yāvat sarvajña jñāna dharmatāyām ca sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayati sa khalu punar bho jinaputra bodhisattvaḥ evam jñāna anugataḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ tri adhva jñānam ca saṃśrāvyate
translated: In the same way, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the light of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in this tenth bodhisattva stage, Cloud of Dharma, is not surpassed by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and by the bodhisattvas established in the first bodhisattva stage up to the ninth bodhisattva stage. It establishes beings in the nature of omniscient knowledge up to the stage of all-knowing knowledge. Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, that bodhisattva who is thus endowed with knowledge is taught the knowledge of the three times by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: dharmadhātuprabhedajñānaṃ ca sarvalokadhātuspharaṇaṃ ca sarvalokadhātvavabhāsādhiṣṭhānaṃ ca sarvasattvakṣetradharmaparijñānaṃ ca sarvasattvacittacaritānupraveśajñānaṃ ca sarvasattvayathākālaparipākajñānaṃ ca vinayānatikramaṇaṃ ca sarvadharmapravicayavibhaktijñānakauśalyaṃ ca samāsato yāvatsarvajñajñānāpramāṇatāṃ ca saṃśrāvyate /
analyzed: dharmadhātu prabheda jñānam ca sarva lokadhātu spharaṇam ca sarva lokadhātu avabhāsa adhiṣṭhānam ca sarva sattva kṣetra dharma parijñānam ca sarva sattva citta carita anupraveśa jñānam ca sarva sattva yathākāla paripāka jñānam ca vinaya anatikramaṇam ca sarva dharma pravicaya vibhakti jñāna kauśalyam ca samāsatas yāvat sarvajña jñāna apramāṇa tām ca saṃśrāvyate
translated: The knowledge of the divisions of the dharma realm, the pervasion of all world systems, the illumination and consecration of all world systems, the complete knowledge of all realms of beings, the knowledge of entering the conduct of the minds of all beings, the knowledge of the complete ripening of all beings in due time, not transgressing discipline, the skill in the knowledge of discerning and analyzing all phenomena - in short, up to the immeasurability of the knowledge of omniscience is proclaimed.

original: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyo jñānapāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya daśabhyaḥ pāramitābhyaḥ jñāna pāramitā atiriktatamā bhavati
translated: Among the ten perfections, the perfection of wisdom becomes most outstanding for him.

original: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudāgacchati yathābalaṃ yathābhajamānam /
analyzed: na ca pariśeṣāsu na samudāgacchati yathābalam yathā bhajamānam
translated: But he does not fail to accomplish the remaining [perfections] according to his ability and as they become available.

original: iyaṃ bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya dharmameghā nāma daśamī bodhisattvabhūmiḥ samāsanirdeśataḥ /
analyzed: iyam bho jinaputra bodhisattvasya dharmameghā nāma daśamī bodhisattva bhūmiḥ samāsa nirdeśataḥ
translated: This, O son of the Victorious Ones, is the tenth bodhisattva stage of the bodhisattva, called Dharmamegha, taught in brief.

analyzed: vistaraśaḥ punar asaṃkhyeya aparyanta kalpa nirdeśa niṣṭhā atas anugantavyā
translated: It should be understood in detail up to the point of being completed by teaching for innumerable and limitless eons.

original: yasyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo bhūyastvena maheśvaro bhavati devarājaḥ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānāṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhabodhisattvapāramitopadeśeṣvasaṃhāryo dharmadhātuvibhaktiparipṛcchānirdeśaiḥ /
analyzed: yasyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhūyastvena maheśvaraḥ bhavati devarājaḥ kṛtī prabhuḥ sattvānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattva pāramitā upadeśeṣu asaṃhāryaḥ dharmadhātu vibhakti paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: In which, the bodhisattva, being established, is mostly a great lord, king of gods, skilled, powerful, and is not to be led away from the instructions of the perfections by any śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas, through the explanations of the divisions of the dharma realm.

analyzed: yat ca kiṃcid
translated: And whatever is...

analyzed: dharmameghā nāma bodhisattva bhūmiḥ daśamī
translated: The tenth bodhisattva stage is named Dharma Cloud.

analyzed: parīndanā parivartaḥ
translated: The chapter on entrusting.

original: imāstāḥ khalu punarbho jinaputrā daśa bodhisattvabhūmayaḥ samāsanirdeśato nirdiṣṭāḥ /🔽vistaraśaḥ punaraparyantakalpanirdeśaniṣṭhāto'
analyzed: imāḥ tāḥ khalu punar bho jinaputrāḥ daśa bodhisattva bhūmayaḥ samāsa nirdeśataḥ nirdiṣṭāḥ  vistaraśaḥ punar aparyanta kalpa nirdeśa niṣṭhā
translated: Again, these ten bodhisattva stages have been taught in brief, O sons of the victorious ones.

analyzed: nugatavyāḥ
translated: In detail, they should be understood up to the end of the teaching of endless kalpas.

analyzed: yāḥ atīta anāgata pratyutpannaiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ bhāṣitāḥ ca bhāṣiṣyante ca bhāṣyante ca
translated: They have been taught and will be taught by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: tāḥ khalu punarbho jinaputra
translated: Again, O sons of the victorious ones,

original: etā daśa bodhisattvabhūmayaḥ sarvākārasarvajñajñānānugatā draṣṭavyā anupūrvābhimukhatvāt /
analyzed: etāḥ daśa bodhisattva bhūmayaḥ sarva ākāra sarvajña jñāna anugatāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ anupūrva abhimukha tvāt
translated: these ten bodhisattva stages should be seen as following all aspects of omniscient knowledge, due to their sequential progression.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra anavataptahradaprabhavaṃ pravahadvāri caturbhirmahānadīsrotomukhairjambūdvīpaṃ saṃtarpya akṣayaṃ bhūyo vivṛddhamaprameyāṇāṃ sattvānāmupakārībhūtaṃ yāvanmahāsamudramarpayati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra anavataptahrada prabhavam pravaha dvāri caturbhiḥ mahā nadī srotaḥ mukhaiḥ jambūdvīpam saṃtarpya akṣayam bhūyas vivṛddham aprameyāṇām sattvānām upakārībhūtam yāvat mahā samudram arpayati
translated: For example, O son of the victors, the water that flows from the lake Anavatapta, satisfying Jambudvipa through the mouths of the currents of the four great rivers, becomes inexhaustible, further increases, and becomes beneficial for immeasurable beings until it reaches the great ocean.

analyzed: tat ca vāri āditas eva mahā sāgara abhimukham
translated: And that water is directed towards the great ocean from the very beginning.

original: evameva bho jinaputra bodhicittamahāhradaprabhavaṃ pravahat kuśalamūlavāri mahāpraṇidhānanadīsrotomukhaiścaturbhiḥ saṃgrahavastubhiḥ sarvasattvadhātu saṃtarpya akṣayaṃ bhūya uttari vivṛddham aprameyāṇāṃ sattvānāmupakārībhūtaṃ yāvatsarvākārasarvajñajñānamahāsamudramarpayati /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra bodhi citta mahā hrada prabhavam pravahat kuśala mūla vāri mahā praṇidhāna nadī srotaḥ mukhaiḥ caturbhiḥ saṃgraha vastubhiḥ sarva sattvadhātu saṃtarpya akṣayam bhūyaḥ uttari vivṛddham aprameyāṇām sattvānām upakārībhūtam yāvat sarva ākāra sarvajña jñāna mahā samudram arpayati
translated: In the same way, O son of the victors, the water of wholesome roots that flows from the great lake of the thought of enlightenment, satisfying the entire realm of beings through the mouths of the currents of the great vows and the four means of gathering [disciples], becomes inexhaustible, further increases, and becomes beneficial for immeasurable beings until it reaches the great ocean of omniscience in all its aspects.

analyzed: tat ca kuśala mūla vāri āditas eva sarvajña tā mahā sāgara abhimukham
translated: And that water of wholesome roots is directed towards the great ocean of omniscience in all its aspects from the very beginning.

original: tāḥ khalu bho jinaputra etā daśa bhūmayo buddhajñānaṃ pratītya prajñāyante /
analyzed: tāḥ khalu bho jinaputra etāḥ daśa bhūmayaḥ buddha jñānam pratītya prajñāyante
translated: O son of the victors, these ten stages are known in dependence on the knowledge of the buddhas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra mahāpṛthivīṃ pratītya daśa mahāratnaparvatarājāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra mahā pṛthivīm pratītya daśa mahā ratna parvata rājāḥ prajñāyante
translated: For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, depending on the great earth, the ten great kings of the jewel mountains are known.

original: tadyathā himavān parvatarājo gandhamādano vaidalya ṛṣigiriryugaṃdharo'
analyzed: tat yathā himavān parvata rājaḥ gandhamādanaḥ vaidalyaḥ ṛṣi giriḥ yugaṃdharaḥ
translated: Namely, the Himalaya mountain king, Gandhamadana, Vaidalya, Rishigiri, Yugandhara,

analyzed: śvakarṇa giriḥ nimiṃdharaḥ cakravālaḥ ketumān sumeruḥ ca mahā parvata rājaḥ
translated: Ashvakarnagiri, Nimindhara, Cakravāla, Ketumat, and the great mountain king Mount Sumeru.

original: tara bho jinaputra tadyathāpi nāma himavān parvatarāja ākaraḥ sarvabhaiṣajyajātīnāmaparyantaḥ sarvabhaiṣajyajātigrahaṇatayā /
analyzed: tara bho jinaputra tat yathā api nāma himavān parvatarājaḥ ākaraḥ sarva bhaiṣajya jātīnām aparyantaḥ sarva bhaiṣajya jāti grahaṇa tayā
translated: O son of the Victorious Ones, just as the Himalaya mountain king is the source of all medicinal herbs, inexhaustible in providing all kinds of medicinal herbs.

original: evameva bho jinaputra pramuditāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattva ākaro bhavati sarvalaukikakāvyaśāstramantravidyāsthānānāmaparyantaḥ sarvalaukikakāvyaśāstramantravidyopāyena /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra pramuditāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākaraḥ bhavati sarva laukika kāvya śāstra mantra vidyā sthānānām aparyantaḥ sarva laukika kāvya śāstra mantra vidyā upāyena
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva abiding in the bodhisattva ground of The Joyful, becomes the source of all worldly poetry, treatises, spells, and sciences, inexhaustible in providing all worldly poetry, treatises, spells, and methods.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra gandhamādano mahāparvatarāja ākaraḥ sarvagandhajātīnāmaparyantaḥ sarvagandhajātigrahaṇena /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra gandhamādanaḥ mahā parvata rājaḥ ākaraḥ sarva gandha jātīnām aparyantaḥ sarva gandha jāti grahaṇena
translated: For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, the great mountain king Gandhamadana is the source of all fragrances, inexhaustible in providing all kinds of fragrances.

original: evameva bho jinaputra vimalāyāṃ bodhisattvabhūmau sthito bodhisattva ākaro bhavati sarvabodhisattvaśīlasaṃvaracāritragandhānāmaparyantaḥ sarvabodhisattvaśīlasaṃvaracāritragandhasaṃgrahaṇena
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra vimalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākaraḥ bhavati sarva bodhisattva śīla saṃvara cāritra gandhānām aparyantaḥ sarva bodhisattva śīla saṃvara cāritra gandha saṃgrahaṇena
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva who is in the Vimalā stage becomes a mine of all the fragrances of the Bodhisattva's morality, discipline, and conduct, inexhaustible through collecting all the fragrances of the Bodhisattva's morality, discipline, and conduct.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra vaidalyo mahāparvatarājaḥ śuddho ratnamaya ākaraḥ sarvaratnajātīnāmaparyantaḥ sarvalaukikaratnajātigrahaṇena /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra vaidalyaḥ mahā parvata rājaḥ śuddhaḥ ratna mayaḥ ākaraḥ sarva ratna jātīnām aparyantaḥ sarva laukika ratna jāti grahaṇena
translated: Just as, O son of the Victorious Ones, the great mountain king Vaidūrya, pure, made of jewels, a mine of all kinds of jewels, is inexhaustible through collecting all kinds of worldly jewels,

analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra prabhākaryām buddha bhūmau sarva laukika dhyāna abhijñā vimokṣa samādhi samāpattīnām
translated: in the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the Buddha stage called Prabhākarī, all worldly meditations, superknowledges, liberations, concentrations, and attainments,

analyzed: aparyantaḥ sarva laukika dhyāna abhijñā vimokṣa samādhi samāpattīnām
translated: are inexhaustible through collecting all worldly meditations, superknowledges, liberations, concentrations, and attainments.

analyzed: aparyantaḥ sarva laukika dhyāna abhijñā vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: It is inexhaustible through the explanations of questions about all worldly meditations, superknowledges, liberations, concentrations, and attainments.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra ṛṣigirirmahāparvatarājaḥ pañcābhijñānāmṛṣīṇāmaparyantaḥ pañcābhijñarṣigaṇanayā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra ṛṣigiriḥ mahā parvata rājaḥ pañca abhijñānām ṛṣīṇām aparyantaḥ pañca abhijña ṛṣi gaṇanayā
translated: Just as, O son of the Victorious Ones, the great mountain king Ṛṣigiri is inexhaustible for the seers with the five superknowledges, through the number of seers with the five superknowledges,

analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra arciṣmatyām buddha bhūmau sarva mārga amārga antara avatāra nirdeśa viśeṣa jñānānām aparyantaḥ sarva mārga amārga antara viśeṣa jñāna paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the stage of Buddhahood called Radiant, the knowledge of the distinctions between all paths and non-paths and the entry into them is limitless through the explanations of the questions about the knowledge of the distinctions between all paths and non-paths.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra yugaṃdharo mahāparvatarājaḥ sarvayakṣamaharddhikānāmaparyantaḥ sarvayakṣamaharddhikagaṇanayā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra yugaṃdharaḥ mahā parvata rājaḥ sarva yakṣa maharddhikānām aparyantaḥ sarva yakṣa maharddhika gaṇanayā
translated: For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, the great king of mountains called Yugandhara is limitless for all the Yakshas of great magical power, through counting all the Yakshas of great magical power.

analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra su durjayāyām buddha bhūmau sarva abhijña ṛddhi vikurvaṇa prātihāryāṇām aparyantaḥ sarva abhijña ṛddhi vikurvaṇa prātihārya paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the stage of Buddhahood called Difficult to Conquer, the miracles of supernormal knowledge, magical power, and transformation are limitless through the explanations of the questions about all the miracles of supernormal knowledge, magical power, and transformation.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho aśvakarṇagirirmahāparvatarājaḥ sarvaphalajātīnāmaparyantaḥ sarvaphalajātigrahaṇena /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho aśvakarṇa giriḥ mahā parvata rājaḥ sarva phala jātīnām aparyantaḥ sarva phala jāti grahaṇena
translated: For example, O son of the Victorious Ones, the great king of mountains called Ashvakarna is limitless for all kinds of fruits, through taking all kinds of fruits.

original: evameva bho jinaputra abhimukhyāṃ buddhabhūmau pratītyasamutpādāvatāranirdeśānāmaparyantaḥ śrāvakaphalābhisamayaparipṛcchānirdeśaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra abhimukhyām buddha bhūmau pratītyasamutpāda avatāra nirdeśānām aparyantaḥ śrāvaka phala abhisamaya paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the stage of Buddhahood called Direct Encounter, the explanations of the entry into dependent origination are limitless through the explanations of the questions about the realization of the fruits of the Shravakas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra nimiṃdharo nāma mahāparvatarājaḥ sarvanāgamaharddhikānāmaparyantaḥ sarvanāgamaharddhigaṇanayā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra nimiṃdharaḥ nāma mahā parvata rājaḥ sarva nāga maharddhikānām aparyantaḥ sarva nāga maharddhi gaṇanayā
translated: For example, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the great mountain king named Nimindhara is limitless for all the great powerful nāgas, in terms of counting the great powers of all the nāgas.

original: evameva bho jinaputra dūraṃgamāyāṃ buddhabhūmau upāyaprajñānirdeśānāmaparyantaḥ pratyekabuddhaphalābhisamayaparipṛcchāanirdeśaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra dūraṃgamāyām buddha bhūmau upāya prajñā nirdeśānām aparyantaḥ pratyekabuddha phala abhisamaya paripṛcchā anirdeśaiḥ
translated: In the same way, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, in the Buddha ground of Dūraga, the instructions on means and wisdom are limitless in terms of the explanations of the realizations of the fruits of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bho jinaputra cakravālo nāma mahāparvatarājaḥ vaśībhūtānāmaparyanto vaśībhūtagaṇanayā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bho jinaputra cakravālaḥ nāma mahā parvata rājaḥ vaśībhūtānām aparyantaḥ vaśībhūta gaṇanayā
translated: For example, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the great mountain king named Cakravāla is limitless for the self-controlled, in terms of counting the self-controlled.

original: evameva bho jinaputra acalāyāṃ buddhabhūmau sarvabodhisattvavaśitābhinirhārāṇāmaparyanto lokadhātuvibhaktiparipṛcchānirdeśaiḥ /🔽tadyathāpi bho jinaputra ketumān nāma mahāparvatarājaḥ asuramaharddhikānāmaparyanto'
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra acalāyām buddha bhūmau sarva bodhisattva vaśitā abhinirhārāṇām aparyantaḥ lokadhātu vibhakti paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ  tat yathā api bho jinaputra ketumān nāma mahā parvata rājaḥ asura maharddhikānām aparyantaḥ
translated: In the same way, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, in the Buddha ground of Acala, the accomplishments of all the self-control of the bodhisattvas are limitless in terms of the explanations of the questions about the divisions of the world systems.

analyzed: sura maharddhika gaṇanayā
translated: For example, Blessed Son of the Victorious Ones, the great mountain king named Ketumat is limitless for the great powerful asuras, in terms of counting the great powers of the asuras.

analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra sādhumatyām buddhabhūmau sarva sattva pravṛtti nivṛtti jñāna upacārāṇām aparyantaḥ sarva jagat saṃbhava vibhava paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the stage of the wise one, the knowledge of the engagement and disengagement of all beings is inexhaustible through the explanations of the questions regarding the origination and dissolution of the entire world.

original: tadyathāpi bho jinaputra sumerurmahāparvatarājaḥ sarvadevamaharddhikānāmaparyantaḥ sarvadevamaharddhikagaṇanayā /
analyzed: tat yathā api bho jinaputra sumeruḥ mahā parvata rājaḥ sarva deva maharddhikānām aparyantaḥ sarva deva maharddhika gaṇanayā
translated: Just as, O son of the Victorious Ones, Mount Sumeru, the great king of mountains, is inexhaustible for all the greatly powerful gods through the enumeration of all the greatly powerful gods,

original: evameva bho jinaputra dharmameghāyāṃ buddhabhūmau tathāgatabalavaiśaradyāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāmaparyanto buddhakāyasaṃdarśanaparipṛcchānirdeśaiḥ
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra dharmameghāyām buddha bhūmau tathāgata bala vaiśaradya āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām aparyantaḥ buddha kāya saṃdarśana paripṛcchā nirdeśaiḥ
translated: in the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the stage of the cloud of Dharma, the Buddha stage, the Tathāgata's powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities are inexhaustible through the explanations of the questions regarding the manifestation of the Buddha's body.

original: yathā khalu punarime bho jinaputra daśa mahāratnaparvatā mahāsamudrasaṃbhūtā mahāsamudraprabhāvitāḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu punar ime bho jinaputra daśa mahā ratna parvatāḥ mahā samudra saṃbhūtāḥ mahā samudra prabhāvitāḥ
translated: Moreover, O son of the Victorious Ones, just as these ten great mountain ranges of jewels originate from the great ocean and are manifested by the great ocean,

original: evameva bho jinaputra imā api daśa bhūmayaṃ sarvajñatāsaṃbhūtāḥ sarvajñatāprabhāvitāḥ //
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra imāḥ api daśa bhūmayam sarvajña tā saṃbhūtāḥ sarvajña tā prabhāvitāḥ
translated: in the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, these ten stages originate from omniscience and are manifested by omniscience.

original: tadyathāpi bho jinaputra mahāsamudro daśabhirākāraiḥ saṃkhyāṃ gacchatyasaṃhāryatayā /
analyzed: tat yathā api bho jinaputra mahā samudraḥ daśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ saṃkhyām gacchati asaṃhārya tayā
translated: Just as, O son of the Victorious Ones, the great ocean is counted as having ten inexhaustible aspects,

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: what are the ten?

original: yaduta anupūrvanimnataśca mṛtakuṇapāsaṃvāsataśca anyavārisaṃkhyātyajanataśca ekarasataśca bahuratnataśca gambhīraduravagāhataśca vipulāpramāṇataśca mahābhūtāvāsataśca sthitavelānatikramaṇataśca sarvameghavārisaṃpratyeṣaṇātṛptitaśca /
analyzed: yat uta anupūrva nimnataḥ ca mṛta kuṇapā saṃvāsataḥ ca anya vāri saṃkhyā tyajanataḥ ca eka rasataḥ ca bahu ratnataḥ ca gambhīra duravagāhataḥ ca vipula apramāṇataḥ ca mahābhūta āvāsataḥ ca sthita velā anatikramaṇataḥ ca sarva megha vāri saṃpratyeṣaṇā tṛptitaḥ ca
translated: Namely, in terms of gradual depth, in terms of dwelling with the corpse of immorality, in terms of abandoning other enumerations of water, in terms of single taste, in terms of many jewels, in terms of being profound and difficult to fathom, in terms of being vast and immeasurable, in terms of being the abode of the great elements, in terms of not transgressing the fixed time, and in terms of the satisfaction of receiving all the rain from the clouds.

original: evameva bho jinaputra bodhisattvacaryā daśabhirākāraiḥ saṃkhyāṃ gacchatyasaṃhāryatayā /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra bodhisattva caryā daśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ saṃkhyām gacchati asaṃhārya tayā
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, the conduct of the bodhisattvas is enumerated in ten ways in terms of being unassailable.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: In what ten ways?

analyzed: yat uta pramuditāyām bodhisattva bhūmau anupūrva mahā praṇidhāna abhinirhāra nimnataḥ
translated: Namely, in the bodhisattva stage of The Joyful, it is deep in gradually accomplishing the great vows.

analyzed: vimalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau dauḥśīlya mṛta kuṇapā saṃvāsataḥ
translated: In the bodhisattva stage of The Stainless, it dwells with the corpse of immorality.

analyzed: prabhākaryām bodhisattva bhūmau laukika prajñapti saṃkhyā atyāgataḥ  arciṣmatyām bodhisattva bhūmau buddha bhedya prasāda eka rasataḥ
translated: In the bodhisattva stage of The Radiant, it abandons the enumeration of worldly designations.🔽In the bodhisattva stage of The Brilliant, it has the single taste of the faith that is not to be destroyed by the Buddhas.

analyzed: su durjayāyām bodhisattva bhūmau a pramāṇa upāya abhijñā loka kriyā abhinirhāra bahu ratnataḥ
translated: In the bodhisattva stage of The Difficult to Conquer, it accomplishes the light of immeasurable skillful means and many jewels.

analyzed: abhimukhyām bodhisattva bhūmau pratītyasamutpāda pratyavekṣaṇa duravagāha gāmbhīryataḥ
translated: On the Bodhisattva ground of Direct Presence, due to the profundity of the difficulty of penetrating the observation of dependent origination.

analyzed: dūraṃgamāyām bodhisattva bhūmau buddhi pravicaya kauśalya vipula apramāṇataḥ
translated: On the Bodhisattva ground of Going Far, due to the vast and immeasurable skill in discriminating wisdom.

analyzed: acalāyām bodhisattva bhūmau mahāvyūha abhinirhāra saṃdarśana mahā bhūta āvāsataḥ
translated: On the Bodhisattva ground of Immovability, due to manifesting the great array and abiding in the great elements.

analyzed: sādhumatyām bodhisattva bhūmau gambhīra vimokṣa jagat carita yathāvat prativedha sthita velā an atikramaṇataḥ
translated: On the Bodhisattva ground of Excellent Wisdom, due to abiding in the proper penetration of the conduct of the world in the profound liberations without transgressing the proper time.

analyzed: dharmameghāyām bodhisattva bhūmau sarva tathāgata dharma avabhāsa mahā megha vāri saṃpratyeṣaṇā tṛptitaḥ
translated: On the Bodhisattva ground of Cloud of Dharma, due to receiving the great rain of the cloud of the light of all Dharmas of the Tathagatas without satiety.

original: tadyathāpi bho jinaputra mahāmaṇiratnaṃ yadā daśa ratnagotrāṇyatikramya abhyutkṣiptaṃ ca bhavati kuśalakarmārasuparitāpitaṃ ca suparipiṇḍitaṃ ca supariśodhitaṃ ca suparyavadāpitaṃ ca sunirviddhaṃ ca ratnasūtrasvāviddhaṃ ca uccavaiḍūryamaṇiratnadaṇḍadhvajāgrāvaropitaṃ ca sarvāvabhāsapramuktaṃ ca rājānujñātaṃ ca bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api bho jinaputra mahā maṇi ratnam yadā daśa ratna gotrāṇi atikramya abhyutkṣiptam ca bhavati kuśala karmāra su paritāpitam ca su paripiṇḍitam ca su pariśodhitam ca su paryavadāpitam ca su nirviddham ca ratna sūtra su āviddham ca ucca vaiḍūrya maṇi ratna daṇḍa dhvaja agra avaropitam ca sarva avabhāsa pramuktam ca rāja anujñātam ca bhavati
translated: For example, O Son of the Victorious Ones, when a great precious jewel has transcended ten jewel families, and has been lifted up, well-heated by a skilled jeweler, well-rounded, well-purified, well-polished, well-pierced, strung on a jewel thread, mounted on a high beryl jewel staff, placed at the top of a banner, emitting all kinds of light, and approved by the king,

analyzed: tadā sarva sattvānām sarva ratna saṃgrahāya pratyupasthitam bhavati
translated: then it is ready for all beings to collect all jewels.

original: evameva bho jinaputra yadā bodhisattvānāṃ sarvajñatāratnacittotpādo daśāryaratnagotrāṇyatikramyotpanno bhavati dhūtaguṇasaṃlekhaśīlavratatapaḥsuparitāpitaśca dhyānasamādhisamāpattisuparipiṇḍitaśca mārgāṅgākārasupariśodhitaśca upāyābhijñāsuparyavadāpitaśca pratītyasamutpādasunirviddhaśca upāyaprajñāvicitraratnasūtrasvāviddhaśca vaśitāmahāvaiḍūryamaṇiratnadaṇḍadhvajāgrāvaropitaśca sattvacaritapratyavekṣaṇaśrutajñānāvabhāsasaṃprayuktaśca tathāgatadharmarājasamyaksaṃbuddhajñānābhiṣekānugataśca bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva bho jinaputra yadā bodhisattvānām sarvajña tā ratna citta utpādaḥ daśa ārya ratna gotrāṇi atikramya utpannaḥ bhavati dhūta guṇa saṃlekha śīla vrata tapaḥ su paritāpitaḥ ca dhyāna samādhi samāpatti su paripiṇḍitaḥ ca mārga aṅga ākāra su pariśodhitaḥ ca upāya abhijñā su paryavadāpitaḥ ca pratītyasamutpāda su nirviddhaḥ ca upāya prajñā vicitra ratna sūtra su āviddhaḥ ca vaśitā mahā vaiḍūrya maṇi ratna daṇḍa dhvaja agra avaropita
translated: In the same way, O son of the Victorious Ones, when the bodhisattvas' mind of the jewel of omniscience arises, having transcended the ten noble jewel lineages, it becomes well-heated by the austerities of the virtues of renunciation, discipline, vows, and austerities, well-rounded by the concentrations, meditative absorptions, and attainments, well-purified by the aspects of the path, well-perfected by the skillful means and higher knowledges, well-penetrated by dependent origination, well-woven with the various jewel threads of skillful means and wisdom, well-erected at the top of the banner of the great beryl jewel staff of mastery, well-endowed with the light of hearing and knowledge in observing the conduct of beings, and well-conforming to the consecration of the wisdom of the Thus-Gone One, the Dharma King, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: tadā sarva sattvānām sarva buddha kārya ratna saṃgrahāya pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: Then it is present for the collection of the jewel of all the Buddha's activities for all beings.

analyzed: tadā ca sarvajñaḥ iti ākhyāyate
translated: And then it is called omniscient.

original: ayaṃ khalu punarbho jinaputra bodhisattvacaryāsamudānayanaḥ sarvākārasarvajñajñānaguṇasaṃcayo dharmamukhaparivarto nānavaropitakuśālamūlānāṃ sattvānāṃ śravaṇāvabhāsamāgamiṣyati //
analyzed: ayam khalu punar bho jinaputra bodhisattva caryā samudānayanaḥ sarva ākāra sarvajña jñāna guṇa saṃcayaḥ dharma mukha parivartaḥ na an avaropita kuśāla mūlānām sattvānām śravaṇa avabhāsam āgamiṣyati
translated: This Dharma discourse on the accumulation of the qualities of omniscient wisdom of all aspects, which is the culmination of the bodhisattva conduct, will not come within the range of hearing of beings who have not planted the roots of virtue.

original: vimukticandro bodhisattva āha yeṣāṃ punarbho jinaputra ayaṃ sarvākārasarvajñajñānaguṇasaṃcayo dharmamukhaparivartaḥ śravaṇāvabhāsamāgamiṣyati /
analyzed: vimukticandraḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yeṣām punar bho jinaputra ayam sarva ākāra sarvajña jñāna guṇa saṃcayaḥ dharma mukha parivartaḥ śravaṇa avabhāsam āgamiṣyati
translated: The bodhisattva Vimuktiचandra said, Those who, O son of the Victorious Ones, will come within the range of hearing of this Dharma discourse on the accumulation of the qualities of omniscient wisdom of all aspects,

analyzed: te kiyatā puṇya upacayena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: how much merit will they have accumulated?

original: vajragarbho bodhisattva āha yāvān bho jinaputra sarvajñajñānasya prabhāvastāvān sarvajñatācittotpādasaṃgrahālambanātpuṇyopacayaḥ syāt /🔽yāvān sarvajñatācittotpādasaṃgrahālambanataḥ puṇyopacayastāvānevāsya dharmamukhaparivartasyābhimukhaḥ puṇyopacayo'
analyzed: vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yāvān bho jinaputra sarvajña jñānasya prabhāvaḥ tāvān sarvajña tā citta utpāda saṃgraha ālambanāt puṇya upacayaḥ syāt  yāvān sarvajña tā citta utpāda saṃgraha ālambanataḥ puṇya upacayaḥ tāvān eva asya dharma mukha parivartasya abhimukhaḥ puṇya upacayaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva Vajragarbha said, As much as the power of omniscient wisdom, O son of the Victorious Ones, is the accumulation of merit from the focus of gathering the mind of omniscience.

analyzed: nugantavyaḥ
translated: As much as the accumulation of merit from the focus of gathering the mind of omniscience, that much is the accumulation of merit that should be understood to be directed towards this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: na hi bho jinaputra śakyaṃ anyatra bodhisattvena ayaṃ sarvākārasarvajñajñānaguṇasaṃcayo dharmamukhaparivartaḥ śrotuṃ vā adhimoktuṃ vā pratyetuṃ vā udgrahītuṃ vā dhārayituṃ vā saṃdhārayituṃ vā /
analyzed: na hi bho jinaputra śakyam anyatra bodhisattvena ayam sarva ākāra sarvajña jñāna guṇa saṃcayaḥ dharma mukha parivartaḥ śrotum vā adhimoktum vā pratyetum vā udgrahītum vā dhārayitum vā saṃdhārayitum vā
translated: For, son of the Victorious One, it is not possible for any other bodhisattva to hear, understand, believe, receive, retain, or uphold this Dharma discourse chapter called The Accumulation of the Qualities of Omniscience in All Aspects.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ bhāvanā ākāra prayoga udyoga niṣpādaneṣu
translated: How much less so in the efforts of practice, application, and accomplishment.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bho jinaputra sarvajña jñāna mukha anugatāḥ te saṃdhārayitavyāḥ
translated: Therefore, son of the Victorious One, those who follow the gateway to the knowledge of omniscience should uphold it.

analyzed: ye imam sarvajña jñāna guṇa saṃcaya dharma mukha parivartam  śrutvā ca adhimokṣyante
translated: Those who hear this Dharma discourse chapter called The Accumulation of the Qualities of Omniscience in All Aspects.🔽Having heard it, they will understand it.

analyzed: adhimucya ca ādhārayiṣyanti
translated: Having understood it, they will retain it.

analyzed: bhāvanā ākāreṇa prayokṣyante
translated: They will apply it through the aspect of practice.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ buddhānubhāvena dharmatāpratilambhena ca daśadiglokadaśabuddhakṣetrakoṭiparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātavaḥ ṣaḍvikāramaṣṭādaśamahānimittamakampanta prākampanta saṃprākampanta /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām buddha anubhāvena dharmatā pratilambhena ca daśa digloka daśa buddhakṣetra koṭi paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ ṣaṣ vikāram aṣṭādaśa mahā nimittam akampanta prākampanta saṃprākampanta
translated: Then, at that time, by the power of the Buddha and by the attainment of the Dharma-nature, the worlds in the ten directions, as many as the atoms in ten million buddha-fields, shook in six ways, with eighteen great signs: they trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

analyzed: acalan prācalan saṃprācalan
translated: they quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;🔽they shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely;🔽they quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;🔽they trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

analyzed: avedhanta prāvedhanta saṃprāvedhanta  araṇan prāraṇan saṃprāraṇan
translated: They shook, they shook strongly, they shook intensely.

analyzed: akṣumyan prākṣubhyan saṃprākṣumyan
translated: They trembled, they trembled strongly, they trembled intensely.🔽They quaked, they quaked strongly, they quaked intensely.

analyzed: agarjan prāgarjan saṃprāgarjan
translated: They roared, they roared strongly, they roared intensely.

analyzed: divyāḥ ca puṣpa gandha mālya meghāḥ abhiprāvarṣan
translated: Clouds of divine flowers, incense, garlands, and ointments rained down.

original: divyāśca vastrameghā divyāścūrṇameghā divyā ratnameghā divyā ābharaṇameghā divyā chatrameghā divyā dhvajameghā divyā patākāmeghā abhiprāvarṣan
analyzed: divyāḥ ca vastra meghāḥ divyāḥ cūrṇa meghāḥ divyāḥ ratna meghāḥ divyāḥ ābharaṇa meghāḥ divyā chatra meghāḥ divyāḥ dhvaja meghāḥ divyā patākā meghāḥ abhiprāvarṣan
translated: Clouds of divine garments, clouds of divine powders, clouds of divine jewels, clouds of divine ornaments, clouds of divine parasols, clouds of divine banners, and clouds of divine flags rained down.

analyzed: divyam ca sūrya cakra ātmabhāva maṇḍala maṇi rāja sumeru megha varṣam abhiprāvarṣan  divyam ca sarva ruta ravita vādya maṇi rāja sumeru megha varṣam abhiprāvarṣan
translated: Clouds of the great king of jewels called sun-disk body-mandala rained down.🔽Clouds of the great king of jewels called all sounds and musical instruments rained down.

analyzed: divyam ca jāmbūnada kanaka varṇa prabhā maṇḍala maṇi rāja sumeru megha varṣam abhiprāvarṣan  divyāḥ ca tūrya tālāvacara saṃgīti meghāḥ nadanti sma
translated: Clouds of the great king of jewels called radiance-mandala with the color of Jāmbūnada gold rained down.🔽Clouds of divine musical instruments and songs sounded.

analyzed: divya samatikrāntāḥ sarvajña tā bhūmi abhiṣṭava saṃgīti meghāḥ nadanti sma
translated: Clouds of praises and songs surpassing the divine, for the stage of omniscience, sounded.

original: yathā cāsyāṃ lokadhātau cāturdvīpikāyāṃ paranirmitavaśavartino devarājasya vimāne maṇiratnagarbhaprāsāde /
analyzed: yathā ca asyām lokadhātau cāturdvīpikāyām paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ devarājasya vimāne maṇi ratna garbha prāsāde
translated: And just as in this world system, in the four continents, in the palace of the king of the gods who controls the enjoyments created by others, in the palace called the Womb of Jewel Gems,

original: tathā sarvalokadhātuṣu daśa diśaḥ spharitvā iyameva dharmadeśanā sarvatraiva pravartate sma /
analyzed: tathā sarva lokadhātuṣu daśa diśaḥ spharitvā iyam eva dharma deśanā sarvatra eva pravartate sma
translated: in the same way, in all world systems, this very teaching of the Dharma proceeded, pervading the ten directions.

original: daśabhyo digbhyo daśabuddhakṣetrakoṭiparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ lokadhātūnāṃ pareṇa daśabuddhakṣetrakoṭiparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvā āgacchanti daśadiśaṃ spharantaḥ /
analyzed: daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ daśa buddhakṣetra koṭi paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām lokadhātūnām pareṇa daśa buddhakṣetra koṭi paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ āgacchanti daśa diśam spharantaḥ
translated: From the ten directions, bodhisattvas equal to the number of atoms in ten million buddha-fields came, filling the ten directions.

original: te ca āgatyaivamāhuḥ sādhu sādhu bho jinaputra /
analyzed: te ca āgatya evam āhuḥ sādhu sādhu bho jinaputra
translated: And having come, they said this: Excellent, excellent, O son of the Victor!

analyzed: yaḥ tvam imām bodhisattva bhūmi dharmatām sūcayati
translated: You who point out this reality of the stages of the bodhisattvas.

original: vayamapi bho jinaputra sarve vajragarbhasamanāmakā eva vajraśrīnāmikābhyo nānālokadhātubhya ihāgatā vajradhvajanāmakānāṃ tathāgatānāmantikebhyaḥ
analyzed: vayam api bho jinaputra sarve vajra garbha sama nāmakāḥ eva vajraśrī nāmikābhyaḥ nānā lokadhātubhyaḥ iha āgatāḥ vajradhvaja nāmakānām tathāgatānām antikebhyaḥ
translated: We also, O son of the Victor, all have the same name Vajragarbha, and we have come here from various world systems called Vajraśrī, from the presence of tathāgatas called Vajradhvaja.

original: sarvāsu ca tāsu lokadhātuṣu iyameva dharmadeśanā pravartate buddhānubhāvena evaṃrūpāsveva parṣatsu /
analyzed: sarvāsu ca tāsu lokadhātuṣu iyam eva dharma deśanā pravartate buddha anubhāvena evaṃrūpāsu eva parṣatsu
translated: And in all those world systems, this very Dharma teaching is being taught in the assemblies with such forms, by the power of the Buddhas,

analyzed: ebhiḥ eva padaiḥ ebhiḥ eva vyañjanaiḥ ebhiḥ eva niruktaiḥ etam eva artham abhilaṣadbhiḥ anūnam anadhikam anatiriktam
translated: with the same words, the same phrases, the same syllables, expressing this very meaning, without omission, addition, or excess.

original: te vayaṃ bho jinaputra sākṣībhūtā buddhānubhāvenemāṃ parṣadaṃ saṃprāptāḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bho jinaputra sākṣībhūtāḥ buddha anubhāvena imām parṣadam saṃprāptāḥ
translated: We, O son of the Victorious Ones, have become witnesses through the power of the Buddhas, and have come to this assembly.

original: yathā ca bho jinaputra vayamimāṃ lokadhātuṃ saṃprāptāstathā ca daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuṣvekaikasyāṃ lokadhātau cāturdvīpikāyāṃ paranirmitavaśavartibhavane vaśavartino devarājasya vimāne maṇiratnagarbhaprāsāde saṃprāptā iti //
analyzed: yathā ca bho jinaputra vayam imām lokadhātum saṃprāptāḥ tathā ca daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu ekaikasyām lokadhātau cāturdvīpikāyām paranirmita vaśavarti bhavane vaśavartinaḥ devarājasya vimāne maṇi ratna garbha prāsāde saṃprāptāḥ iti
translated: And just as we have come to this world system, O son of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, in all the world systems in the ten directions, in each world system, in each of the four continents, in the palace of the king of the gods who rules over others' emanations, in the palace with a jewel-filled interior, we have come.

analyzed: idam avocat vajragarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: This was said by the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Vajragarbha,

analyzed: bhyanujñātaḥ tathāgatena
translated: and was approved by the Tathagata.
